loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Group members of Rose's group thank Kiva Lenders for their previous loan. Small as it was, members explained that the loan had positive impact on their work and living standards. Rose for example, used her previous loan to buy 2 exotic piglets and feeds for them. Her pigs have grown and one has produced 6 piglets; she plans to sell three of these and 3 keep so as to expand her project. Her other group members are also doing well, and are excited about their loans. Teopista, also a group member, had her pig produce 8 piglets and she sold 6 of these to pay school fees for her children. She plans to sell one adult pig to purchase herself solar power.

Group members are now requesting for a new loan to invest in crop growing so as to be able to have enough food to feed their families and pigs. They plan to use this new loan to buy good quality seeds, fertisers and will be paying laborers to cultivate their land.

loans.use: To pay for good quality seeds, fertilisers and laborers to expand thier gardens

loans.name: Ledya

texts.es:
Ledya es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos y una hija, su negocio es la venta de alfombras.
Ella es emprendedora, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en ‘Rio Seco feria extranca’. Se llama de esa manera porque antes funcionaba un control para los vehículos que hacían su salida de la ciudad de El Alto hacia el exterior o las provincias. Este es un lugar donde hay un fuerte movimiento económico, ya que en la zona existen infinidad de negocios de todo tipo. Para una muestra vale decir que en el lugar hay cinco agencias bancarias que siempre muestran largas filas ya sea para pagar el agua, la luz, el teléfono, impuestos de los inmuebles, de los vehículos; para hacer un depósito, para hacer un retiro o para pagar la cuota del préstamo.
Ledya es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, viste de forma típica (manta y pollera), su lengua natal es el aymará que combina con el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de alfombras, labor que viene realizando hace más de 10 años junto a su madre. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y sus 4 hijos, que asisten a la escuela pública primaria, su pareja trabaja en el transporte público como chofer de taxi. Su casa cuenta con todos los servicios básicos como ser agua, luz y gas domiciliario. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de alfombras en la zona ’16 de julio’. Ella necesita realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para incursionar en otro sector y junto a su hija mayor(12) realizar la confección de gorros y pantalones para bebe y venderlos por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Ledya solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para enseñar a su hija este trabajo.
texts.en:
Ledya is a 39 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 3 sons and a daughter. Her business is selling rugs. She is entrepreneurial, sincere, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, responsible and a hard worker. She does business at the 'Rio Seco feria extranca’ market. It is called this because it used to be a control post for vehicles leaving the city of El Alto for the exterior or the provinces. This is an area of intense economic activity as there is an infinite number of businesses of all types. As an example you could mention the five banks that always have long line-ups to pay for electricity, telephone, property taxes or vehicles: to make a deposit, withdrawal or to make a payment on a loan.

Ledya is dark-skinned, her long black hair is braided and she wears typical clothing (shawl and pollera). Her native language is Aymará which she combines with Spanish for her commerce. Her business is making and selling rugs, work she has been doing since she was 10 years old together with her mother.

Her life is shared with her husband and 4 children who go to Primary school. Her husband works in the transportation sector as a taxi driver. Her house has all the basic services such as water, electricity and gas.

Her dream is to open a store to sell rugs in the '16 de julio' neighborhood. She needs to buy an industrial sewing machine to enter into another business and together with her oldest daughter make hats and pants for babies and sell them wholesale. For this reason Ledya is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to teach her daughter this work.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Sandra Nohelia

texts.es:
Sandra desde pequeña ha sido una líder natural, se ha caracterizado por organizar, supervisar y dirigir sus grupos de trabajo de clases con éxito. Es una joven de 25 años, soltera y sin hijos, cursa su último año en la carrera de Administración de Empresas. Carrera que anhelaba  estudiar para en un futuro poder administrar el negocio de su padre, quien es ganadero y agricultor. Es inteligente, trabajadora y emprendedora, aparte de estudiar, trabaja. Con un pequeño capital logró establecer una pequeña librería, la que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante. 

Ella solicita el crédito para pagar el seminario de especialización, el titulo, el certificado y la carta de egresado de su carrera Administración de Empresas. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para el pago inmediato de todos los trámites. Su mayor anhelo es obtener su titulo de licenciada ya que gracias a este logrará ser reconocida como profesional y al mismo tiempo le brindará la oportunidad de obtener buenas ofertas de trabajo. Uno de sus planes futuros es crear su propia empresa, sueño que su familia apoya y motiva para que lo haga realidad.
texts.en:
Since childhood, Sandra has been a natural leader, she always successfully organized, supervised and led the working groups in her class. She is a young woman of 25, single and childless. She is in her final year of studying for a degree in Business Administration. This is a degree course which she was eager to study so that she can manage her father's business in the future; her father is a rancher and farmer. She is intelligent, hard-working and enterprising; she works as well as studying. With a little capital she managed to establish a small bookshop, which - after much effort - she has managed to make a success. 

She is requesting the loan to pay for the specialist seminars, the degree, the certificate and confirmation of graduation for her Business Administration degree course. She relies on the funding because she does not have the financial resources necessary for the immediate payment of all the formalities. Her greatest desire is to get her degree because, thanks to this, she will achieve recognition as a professional and it will give her the opportunity to get good job offers. One of her future plans is to create her own business, a dream that her family supports and they motivate her to make it happen.

loans.use: to pay for the specialist seminars, the degree, the certificate and the confirmation of graduation for her Business Administration degree course

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wedding dresses to rent.

loans.name: Rustem

texts.en: Your financial help previously enabled Rustem, a blind man to buy fodder for his animals, and he is very appreciative to you all. He now wants to install doors and windows on his old house in order to save energy and money in warming up the place. He promises one more time that he will pay the loan on time. The amount he is requesting this time is 200,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to install doors and windows to his old house in order to save energy and money in warming up the place in winter

loans.name: Dekstro

texts.en:
Dekstro is making great progress in selling green technologies in his community. He is excited to educate his customers in the health and cost benefits of the solar lights.

Dekstro hopes you can support him again.

Photo description: Dekstro is the one on left. On his right is his wife who also supports his Tech Kiosk business promoting life-changing technologies to customers.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: This is Nancy. She is a farmer in Kiambu Kenya, practicing dairy and horticulture in small scale. Currently she has a cow that produces 8 litres of milk per day. Her current income is not adequate for family upkeep and education of her children. A loan from Kiva will help Nancy buy a cow capable of production of 12 litres of milk per day. This will boost her income from milk and support education for her children

loans.use: to purchase a higher breed cow to raise finances to educate her children

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 40 years old, lives with her husband and four children in General Mariano Alvarez for 20 years now. Originating from Bicol, Vilma and her husband decided to migrate their family after her husband got employed in Cavite. 

To help her husband earn income, Vilma decided to sell dried fish. Dried fish production is a common industry in Vilma's community and it was easy for her to get consigned products from dried fish producers in the area. Eventually, Vilma saw that income potentials would be greater if she can produce dried fish herself. Befriending her suppliers, Vilma learned the dried fish production process. 

Vilma and her family would begin work in the wee hours of the morning by buying fresh fish in a nearby fish port. The fish would later be cleaned and soaked in a salt and water solution. Afterwhich, the fish would then be laid on drying screens and regularly sprinkled with rock salt until all moisture from the fish has been dried. Later in the afternoon, the dried fish will be repacked in plastic containers for retail selling. 

As fish price invariably changes, and owing to the increased demand, Vilma had to resort to borrowing from usurious lenders who charge up 20% from the loan principal amount borrowed. In February 2014, Vilma was invited by a neighbor to attend an Orientation Seminar in SEED and eventually was granted a first loan. She used the loan amount to buy more fish and was able to increase her income. With the earnings, Vilma was able to increase her production that she already employs 5 neighbors who helps prepare the dried fish and sell those afterwards. She is also able to expand her production area.

Her family has also improved their living conditions. House repairs were done, specifically having the floor of her house tiled. More importantly, her children are able to attend to school regularly now. Also, Vilma is able to settle loans and veer away from borrowing to usurious lenders. 

On her 5th loan now, Vilma wants to buy additional volume of fish and construct extra drying screens for her dried fish business. She wanted to supply more neighbors in her area, and hence increasing not only her income but providing income generation also to her community.

loans.use: To buy additional volume of fish and construct extra drying screens for her dried fish business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: This is David. He is 54 years and resides in Kiambu Kenya. He is a small scale dairy farmer with only one cow. Due to financial constraints, David has been rearing a cow bought in its Calf stage which is now producing milk. With his current income, he is not able to meet his basic needs adequately. A loan from Kiva, will help David increase his milk production to a level where he will meet his family financial needs without strain.

loans.use: to purchase a Dairy cow to increase milk Production

loans.name: Thobias

texts.en:
A loan of Rp5,000,000 helps Thobias to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps to his community.

Thobias is a chicken farmer and supplements his income selling daily needs such as food, drinks and toiletries in his community. To increase his income Thobias joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business. He is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to his customers and improve his general business skills. 

Thobias plans to use the extra income to improve the education of his children.

Photo description: Thobias is the one on the left, on his right is his wife who also supports his Tech Kiosk business.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: This is Caroline, she is 21 years old and comes from a family of 5 where she is a first born. She is a student at the Vision's Institute of Professionals in Nairobi studying to be a Certified Public Accountant. Her dream is to achieve excellence in the financial sector and be of value to her community. A loan from Kiva will help Caroline pay her last school semester fees and complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and related educational costs.

loans.name: Phos's Group

texts.en: Phos’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phos makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is an 22 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up with his father, a taxi driver and his mother in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon. He currently lives with his parents and is engaged to a young Palestinian refugee living in the same camp. 
Growing up as a Palestinian refugee in an extremely unstable political and social setting, Salim ambitiously completed his studies at school and automatically started working on starting his own business as a construction worker specialized in cement roof constructions. 
Salim is asking for a 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to rent some tools he urgently needs for his work. He will also be expanding his toolkit by buying additional equipment to be able to serve new clients in the camp.  
In the meantime, he is slowly working on building his own house in which he will be starting his own family once he is married. This loan will therefore increase his productivity and help him generate more income to become financially independent from his parents which will allow him to provide them and his future wife a decent future.

loans.use: to complete his kit with necessary construction tools

loans.name: Irvan

texts.en:
Mr Irvan lives on the southern edge of the metropolitan area of Bandung that counts 8 million inhabitants. Most people here rely on ground water for their drinking water. Because of the high population density and the lack of sewers all ground water is infected with fecal bacteria that makes people sick. 
That is why Irvan decided to start selling Nazava Water Filters that enable people to filter their well, rain or tap water so it becomes safe to drink. Without the need of boiling, without needing electricity. 
Irvan has been active for a few months but he has shown to be a very active filter salesmen who is very willing to learn. Irvan, who also sells socks has a lot of experience in trade and business and has a large network that he uses to spread the good news about Nazava Water Filters. 
Irvan will use the loan to kickstart his business and acquire some inventory. This loan will provide safe drinking water to about 150 families or 600 people.

loans.use: to increase access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Ikenna Kinsley

texts.en: Ikenna have his business center located in central Monrovia selling dry goods. He been in business since 2011, he is marry with five children. He hopes increased profits made by adding Sustainable Energy for All  (SE4All) products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
This is the third KIVA loan for Titin, who used to be a junior highschool teacher and is nowadays entrepreneur and housewife. Titin’s sales have up growing remarkably fast. She applies for a new loan to provide inventory to her sub-agents so she can provide water filters in a larger area. 
Titin lives in Cikarang, which is part of the greater Jakarta agglomeration of over 28 million people. In this area nobody has potable water from their tap. Many people use well water which is often very dirty. To get safe drinking water people have to buy water which is very expensive. That is why Titin started to sell Nazava Water Filters and so far with great success. She paid her first and second KIVA loan back on time and also made same prepaid orders in between. 
“I hope that using this loan, I can become the largest agent in the greater Jakarta region”, says Titin
The KIVA loan allows Titin to save on shipping costs, enables her to expand more quickly and will therefore provide more people with safe and affordable drinking water.

loans.use: provide safe drinking water filters to a larger area

loans.name: Al-Aziz

texts.en:
Al-Aziz has been Nazava’s reseller in Bogor, West Java, Indonesia since 2011. He has sold hundreds of water filters and also established a network of resellers in several cities in Indonesia. Bogor is a large city just north of Indonesia’s Capital Jakarta. Bogor has all the problems third world cities have: including a lack of access to safe and affordable drinking. 
Mr Al-Aziz is becoming more and more visible in his city and he is selling to schools, mosques and Islamic education centres. Mr Al-Aziz: “Using the previous KIVA loans I was able to get new clients and increase my visibility“. He is now selling through 3 direct sales kiosks that he rents or shares with others. Besides he has a network of 5 sub agents that buy from him. Besides drinking water filters, Al-Aziz also sells Nazava water filters that make very murky and stinky water clear so that it can be used for washing. “Everybody has a different source of water here, so I need large amount of stock in order to be able to satisfy everybody”, says Al-Aziz. 

With help of KIVA credit Mr. Al-Aziz can have a greater stock with a larger variety of filters which means that he can help a larger number of households with their pressing drinking water problems. By supporting Mr. Al-Aziz, not only his business will be strengthened. More families will have access to safe and affordable drinking water and these families will also save money and increase their disposable income. The Reseller Support Team from Nazava will do a couple of joint promotions in the coming months. Besides Al-Aziz will place advertisements in local news papers and will also try to advertise Nazava through the local radio stations.

loans.use: provide even more people with safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 38-years-old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. She has been in this business for 1 year now and she currently makes a monthly income of KES 3,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In future, she hopes to grow her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries for sell.

loans.name: Richelle Jane

texts.en:
Richelle Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Richelle Jane has been in this business for 10 years. Richelle Jane earns more income from farming rice.

Richelle Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: So far, Rachel has marketed over 400 water filters, providing clean drinking water to over 2000 people. Rachel sells the Nazava Water Filters through a network of sub-agents in remote places of Indonesia, like Manado in North Sulawesi and Timor in East Indonesia. Rachel wants to use this loan to expand sales on the island of Timor. As Indonesia has over 900 inhabited islands it can take very long to ship goods from the main island, where Nazava filters are made, to islands in eastern Indonesia. To get the filters quickly, Rachel always preferred to use airfreight, which of course is very expensive. Using the KIVA loan to finance a continuous bigger stock of water filters, she can now choose for much cheaper sea freight. This will help Rachel to save around 5 USD per water filter. “It is very hard to get clean drinking water in East Indonesia. Many people still boil their water on wood which is time consuming to collect or expensive to buy. Besides, burning on wood emits greenhouse gases and the indoor fires cause many respiratory diseases. Nazava Water Filters make well and rain water safe to drink without the need for boiling," she explains. With this loan Rachel will provide a convenient solution to obtain clean drinking water to more than 100 households faster and cheaper than ever before.

loans.use: To further develop access to safe and affordable drinking water

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany (pictured) is 18 years old, has been married since 2013, and she is just pregnant. She lives with her widowed mother in a village approximately twenty kilometers outside Phnom Penh City.

Dany buys and sells clothes in a market three kilometers away from her house. Her husband is a garment worker.

She hopes to increase the volume of clothes she buys and sells so she can increase her income to better support her standard of living. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 57-year-old widow from Baybay, Leyte, and the mother of two grown children. She runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods  to the people in her area. This is her source of income. 

Ma. Luisa is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, rice, coffee, sugar, soda and other beverages, cooking oil and seasoning, snack foods, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to increase her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Ma. Luisa dreams of improving her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is married with four children; three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Sanyu operates a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years. She also generates income from selling cosmetics. She sells on a retail basis and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages. She aspires to own a fully stocked saloon. 

Sanyu has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy weaves, braids, relaxers, shampoos and treatments. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, relaxers, shampoos and treatments

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analiza works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

Analiza is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase additional vegetables to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetabkes to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Helen requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old, and she is a businesswoman. She has a kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use it to buy additional items including  sugar, coffee, aqua, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, rice, shampoo, perfume, sardines,  pens and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with a working capital of $500. She is happy to be taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management, to increase her income, and she wants her business to grow bigger in the future. She also has animals in her house like pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, aqua, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, rice, shampoo, perfume, sardines, pens and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality seeds, ferterlizers and make use of extra land

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is the age of 29 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a plumber by profession, he has been in plumbing services for many years and fulfills all the expenses of his family alone. He provides services for underground piping connections, fitting of taps, and digging wells. He has retained a list of good customers in a short time and his business is going on well. He does not have a drilling machine for well digging.  He has been hiring a drilling machine for well digging. Now, he wants to buy a well drilling machine and some new tools such as a wrench, tube cutters, pipe threader, tube flaring, soldering torch, tile spade, shovel, digging bar, etc. to continue his services but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the described goods. 

Therefore, Sumaira has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a well drilling machine and tools for plumbing. Sumaira thanks Kiva and its field Partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a well drilling machine and some new plumbing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a permanent shelter for the pigs and to buy feeds

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Lydia has been in this business for four years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Serap

texts.en:
Serap is a married mother of one. For 10 years she has helped support her family by selling knitwear and jewelry that she makes herself, to locals and visitors. When she started this work it was very hard because she was not an expert at making jewelry. In order to improve at making jewelry she went to her family. With the loan she got from Maya she bought jewelry supplies, thus increasing her selection of products. In the coming years, Serap would like to open a jewelry store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Serap hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi. On yıldır turistik mekanlarda açtığı stantlarda yerli ve yabancı turistlere kendi yaptığı örgü ve takıları satarak ailesinin geçimine destek oluyor.  Bu işe başladığında takı yapımında çok zorluklar yaşadı çünkü bu işe hakim değildi.  Takı işinde kendisini geliştirmek ve bu işi öğrenmek için ailesinin yanına gitti.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile takı malzemesi alarak ürün çeşidini artırdı.  Serap Hanım ilerleyen zamanlarda takı dükkanı açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Libia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Libia es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. 

Libia es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que es viuda desde hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal como lociones y cremas de manos a través de catalogo y cuando su esposo murió le tocó incrementar sus ventas para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y para lograrlo le tocó trabajar muy fuerte y luchar durante muchos días. 

Actualmente Libia tiene unos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal al por mayor como desodorantes, lociones y cremas para responder a los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Libia is a hardworking person. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to get ahead with her children and give them a good education. Libia is a single mother who became the head of the household when her husband died, some time ago. She has gone through difficult times, but her business has helped her to make headway.

A long time ago, Libia started to sell personal products from a catalogue, such as lotions and hand creams. When her husband died, she had to increase her sales in order to cover the home expenses. She had to work very hard for a long time.

Libia has now some orders to fulfill. She does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan to buy personal products in bulk, such as deodorants, lotions and creams, and fulfill all the orders. Her biggest dream is to get ahead with her business and be able to improve her children’s living conditions and improve the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy personal products in bulk, such as deodorants, lotions and creams.

loans.name: Akaranga Group

texts.fr:
Anitha fait partie du groupe  Akaranga et  habite à  Gitega.  Elle a 24 ans et est mariée à Audace, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de  la bière de banane depuis 3 ans.

C'est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une  grande quantité de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anitha is a member of the Akaranga group and lives in Gitega. She is 24 years old and is married to Audace, a farmer. Together they have two children, one of whom is in school.

Anitha has been selling banana beer for three years. 

She is on her first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of banana beer that she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of banana beer to resell

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 51 years old. She is married with five children aged between 31and12 years old; all of them go to school. She has sold foodstuffs for the past 18 years. With the loan, she would like to buy rice, beans, Irish potatoes, bananas, and the stock of charcoal, for a better future. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to buy enough foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, Irish potatoes, bananas and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 44 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories. He employs laborers for his molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw material. Now he has taken a huge contract, larger than before, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy additional crushed raw material to continue his manufacturing. 

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of each of her children, including their school fees, diet and health. For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses. 

Rehana is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Djuraboi

texts.ru:
Джурабой счастливый семьянин, ему 42 года. У него 4 взрослых детей, все они работают и имеют свои семьи. Джурабой занимается откормом скота, он разводит дома скот, у него есть несколько голов коров и быка. Он имеет большую семью, поэтому всю свою душу он вкладывает в свою работу. Джурабой живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. Джурабой занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Джурабой занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур.Также он работает на мельнице. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот.
 Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Джурабой хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Джурабой заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Djuraboi is a happy, 42-year-old family man. He has 4 grown children, all of whom work and have their own families. Djuraboi is involved in raising livestock at home, where he has several cows and bulls. He has a large family, and this is why he devotes his soul to his work. Djuraboi lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. He is involved in his own business to provide for his family. Djuraboi is involved in dekhan farming and animal husbandry. He has land, some of which is rainfed and some is irrigated. Djuraboi grows carrots, potatoes and cereal crops on this land. He also works at a mill. His wife helps him to care for and raise the livestock. Because they have a lot of land, they also use for livestock pasture. The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Djuraboi wants to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount. He came to Arvand to obtain a loan to buy livestock and achieve his goal. Djuraboi is grateful to Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 36, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store; he speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Shamshad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality feeds and solar kit

loans.name: Samiya Group

texts.en:
Abdiwahab is a 40-year-old man. He has eight children: two girls and six boys. He is the principal and shareholder of  a primary and secondary private school in Borama town. The school was opened in 1994. Abdiwahab and his colleague Abdirahman started up the school with only $50. Now the school is one of the largest in Borama town; 2,300 students are enrolled at this school. Around 1,000 of the 2,300 are female students. Abdiwahab needs $700 to establish a school library and he has requested a loan from Kaaba Microfinance to invest in the first phase of the library.he needs the loan to buy books,to build shelves,Chairs,tables and etc.

Abdiwahab is the group leader of Samiya Group and he is the one raising his hand in the group photo. The group consists four members, and all the group members have different pr-existing small and medium businesses that they need to expand.

loans.use: to buy books, to build shelves, Chairs, tables and etc.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 48 and the mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and has been selling fresh fruits from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can maximize sales of the fruit selling business.

Therefore, Gulnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits to resell. Gulnaz thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality seeds and pay off labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and cultivate more land

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 32 years old, married and blessed with five daughters and two sons. Her husband has a bangle-making business. Bangle making is an informal sector in Pakistan. It involves a lengthy procedure. He makes bangles in different designs and colors. Bangles are worn by women, mostly during festive occasions. But the income the business generates is less than the labor that it requires. Also they have a big family and fulfilling all their requirements is not easy. 

In order to generate more income, Sajida's husband wants to increase the number of bangles he manufactures, for which he needs raw material, but currently he has a shortage of funds. Therefore Sajida has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her husband enhance his business. They are hopeful that this loan will have a positive impact on their income and they will be able to provide better living conditions for their family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's bangle-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a market stall and buy solar kit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quality seedlings and pay labor

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is married with four children and three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She also generates additional income from selling chapatti.  She sells on a retail basis by moving from door to door for six days a week. Her major business challenge is seasonality.  She is aspiring of educating her children to university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 46 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with six children. She has a retail shop which she has been running for three years now.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and detergent. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children as well as improve the living standards of her family.

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Nuran

texts.en:
Nuran is a married mother of two. Five years ago when the manti (Turkish ravioli) she made for herself was liked a lot she began to take orders for it. Later she began to get orders from stores and restaurants. Now she has begun to get orders from abroad as well. With the loan she received from Maya she increased her potential customer base by printing posters and business cards. She would like to open a manti restaurant in the future. In this way she will be able to sell her manti both cooked and uncooked.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Nuran hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Beş yıl önce kendisine yaptığı mantılar çok beğenilince sipariş üzerine çevresine de yapmaya başlamış.  Daha sonra dükkanlardan ve lokantalardan da sipariş almaya başlamış.  Şu anda yurtdışından sipariş alarak kendisini ülke dışında da tanıtıyor. Maya'dan aldığın kredi ile el ilanı ve kartvizit bastırarak müşteri potansiyalini artırdı.  Gelecekte mantı üzerine bir lokanta açmak istiyor.  Böylece yaptığı mantıları hem çiğ hem de pişmiş olarak satabilecek.

loans.use: to print posters and business cards

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Padre de 2 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor Benjamin de 47 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira que con esta humilde actividad brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos. 

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, necesita de una actividad capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos los cuales criara y engordara para su posterior venta. 

Benjamin está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que su padre se sienta más que orgulloso de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Being father to two children and a great desire to see them become professionals are the motivating factors that fill Benjamin, 47 years old, with enthusiasm and energy to work untiringly on his pig farm. He hopes with this modest business, to provide all his children with a college education.

Since his desire is to provide his children with a good education, he needs a business that is capable of generating sufficient resources to cover these costs without neglecting the fundamental household expenses. He feels the need to apply for a loan to buy pigs which he would raise and fatten for their subsequent sale.

Benjamin is very motivated by this project, because his children show good attitudes in their studies, and an aptitude to succeed and make their father more than proud of his children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten in order to improve his income and to be able to give his children a quality education.

loans.name: Evely's Group

texts.en:
Evely's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Evely is 22 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Evely has been working hard to manage her clothes business, where she sells secondhand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Evely has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell. It will help Evely to generate greater profits and help her parents with basic needs and also help take care of her children. Evely hopes that in the future she will be able to own a small restaurant. 

Evely is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a smallholder farmer in Kebirigo, a remote village located in the rich highlands of Nyamira, Kenya. Francis has a family of five children (three girls and two boys). On his farm, Francis grows tea among other crops and keeps poultry and dairy cows. Francis is also involved in offering transportation services to other farmers from his village. For the last 20 years, farming has been the main source of income for Francis. He loves farming very much, particularly dairy farming. He dreams of being a quality farmer. However, his biggest challenge is unavailability of capital.

Francis is seeking a loan to construct a grazing unit. A grazing unit helps small-acreage landowners like Francis become better grazing managers. Because grazing is an ongoing process, the unit is an important way for Francis to monitor different grasses, fit legumes into pastures, vegetate pastures, etc. Good grazing management will lead to more milk production and better animal health on Francis' farm. This will translate into a significant rise in income, which will go towards his children’s education. Francis believes that education is the “key to success” and that by securing the future of his children through education, he will be empowering them and also generations to come.

loans.use: To construct a grazing unit

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a supportive housewife living in Rawalpindi. She is 31 years old and a mother of six children. Her husband has a tailoring shop. He is a very hardworking person and tries to complete his customer orders on time. He has a good reputation in the market and he has managed to retain a good number of customers.
They have a big family and though he does make income, it is consumed in meeting his daily expenses. Due to low income their living standards are not very good. Their children go to school and it is very difficult for them to pay for their fee. Her husband therefore wants to buy material in order to increase his tailoring business. 
Samira has requested for a loan to help her husband buy these materials. She is happy to be able to help her husband and thanks Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To help her husband buy threads, buttons, oils, zippers etc. for his tailoring business

loans.name: Dadan

texts.en: Dadan lives with three of his family members in Sukabumi, a city located about 80 km south of Jakarta the capital city. Currently, Dadan works as a staff member in a local restaurant. Dadan realized that he needs extra income in order to support his family's needs. He joined Ruma a month ago and he decided to start out selling mobile airtime and providing utility bill-payment services to his communities. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to provide more airtime transactions on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. Dadan thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide bill-payment and mobile services to his community

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer has operated her eatery for 20 years. She is married and has two children. Jennifer would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 that will be used to purchase raw vegetables, meat and ingredients for her restaurant business. She is hoping that someday she can prepare more menu items to sell within her local community. She hopes for approval of her requested loan in order for her to increase her income and improve her eatery. In this way, she can accommodate all of her customers and provide quality service.

loans.use: to purchase raw vegetables, meat and other ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She does farming in Kangundo town. She also sells second hand clothes which enables her to make more income.

She will be using this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In future Mary hopes to grow her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Ermera. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2012, with her own working capital of $600.  Most of her daily income is from selling secondhand clothes. So now she is applying for a loan of USD 800 to improve her business. She will use the loan taken from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more secondhand clothes to sell including skirts, trousers, shirts, T-shirts, jackets, etc. She is selling in her house, because many people like to come buy her secondhand clothes. She is very interested with her business, so she is selling her secondhand clothes everyday. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, shirts, T-shirts, jackets and other secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ilhame

texts.en: Ilhame is 38 years old. She is married with two children, and both of them are school aged. Ilhame and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, but now live in Ahmadbayli village of Fuzuli region. Ilhame has been in the animal breeding business for six years. Today she wants to build stall for cows and for this reason she needs a loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Ilhame is thankful to Komak Company and Kiva organization for help and support.

loans.use: to build stall for her cows.

loans.name: Sevtap

texts.en:
Sevtap is a married mother of a 5-year-old and a 3-month-old. Although her children are still young, she contributes to the economy by doing waxing at home. Sevtap began doing waxing six years ago. First she waxed her close friends and family, and then she began to go to all-women parties. When her customers increased, she began to do waxing at her own home. Now she arranges customers at her house by appointment. With the loan she received from Maya she bought waxing supplies and printed a brochure, thus reaching more customers. In the future she would like to open a beauty salon.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Sevtap hanım evli ve biri 5 yaşında diğeri 3 aylık iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarının küçük olmasına rağmen evde ağda yaparak aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Sevtap Hanım ağda yapmaya 6 yıl önce başlamış.  Önce yakın çevresine ağda yapmış daha sonra günlere gitmeye başlamış.  Müşterileri çoğalınca kendi evinde de ağda yapmaya başlamış.  Şu anda müşterilerini evinde randevuyla alıyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ağda malzemesi aldı ve broşür bastırdı.  Böylece daha çok müşteriye ulaştı.  Gelecekte güzellik salonu açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy waxing supplies and print a brochure.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Mahalaxmi Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Purnami as their president. The lady standing third from the right-hand side in the photo is Purnami. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity. 

Purnami is 30 years old, married and living with her husband in the village of Budhipadar in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Purnami is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market in Kesinga, Odisha, India. She has already had this business for five years and it is going very well. At this time, Purnami is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar’s son owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

Her son has only a single person who has to support his family and old parents also. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with the future expenses. Therefore, Gulzar has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son.

Gulzar is the mother of six children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her son will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Gulzar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for reselling.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a farmer living at Solana with her spouse and four children. The couple gets income through rice farming and are able to send all their children to school. 

Evangeline is now asking for PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) to nourish crops. With proper sustenance, crops will grow fruitfully. Someday, she hopes to gain abundant harvest and save for education purposes. She will be happy to see all her children finish their education and acquire good-paying jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) to nourish crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is an entrepreneur planting and harvesting rice to sell for income. She is already 50 years old and had one child. She had already experienced many hardships in the farming business. Her income goes for meals, bills at home, and revolving capital in the business. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides that will nourish her crops for a better harvest. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs to improve her pig-breeding business and be able to help support her parents.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 52 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Milagros works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, noodles, etc. Milagros has been in this business for 13 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maa Duarsuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Bhumisuta is a 29-year-old woman living with her three children in a village in Odisha, India. She has a small grocery shop at her house from which she earns 3,000 India Rupees (INR) per month. Her shop is the only shop for the 50 families living near her house in the village. She says that she feels good about making some daily household needs accessible to her customers without them having to travel far. She sells grains, lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, wafers, etc. in her grocery store, but she is not able to meet her customers' demands, and so she, along with her group, has requested this loan. She will use her portion to purchase grocery items like lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, wafers, etc. in bulk amounts. There is not enough stock available in her store where the demand is high. Bhumisuta’s dream is to see her children continue school and give them a good quality of life.

The other members of the Maa Duarsuni Shg are engaged in different activities. All are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this great support.

loans.use: to pay for lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, and wafers in bulk

loans.name: Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
A few years back, a group of women from a small village in Kalahandi district, Odisha, India stepped out to build a secure future for their families and made a group named Saraswati Self Help Group. Members of the Saraswati Self Help Group selected Jamini as the group leader. Jamini, the lady standing with her hand raised, is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She took on the leadership of the group and started cultivating vegetables in their village by obtaining land on lease. She was successful with vegetable cultivation and selling vegetables like brinjal, cucumbers, beans, carrots, radishes, parwal, etc. Now she has started to cultivate peanuts. 

She, along with her group, has requested this loan to use in peanut cultivation. The loan amount (Jamini's portion) will be used to purchase fertilizer and insecticide and a portion will be spent on labor costs and water pumping.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor costs and water pumping

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Five years ago Elif opened a tiny restaurant with three tables and small chairs, serving liver. She had a lot of difficulties finding customers, but she never gave up. In time, many people knew about this tiny restaurant and Elif had a good potential of customers. As the number of customers increased she got the next shop, combined it with her own and expanded her restaurant. Elif is the only woman cooking sliced liver, which mostly men make. In spite of all the difficulties and obstacles she has had, she became a successful entrepreneur.  She will renovate her restaurant and replace her plates with the help of the Maya loan. Elif wants develop her woman-made sliced liver as a brand in the future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Elif hanım 5 yıl önce çok küçük bir dükkan ,üç masa ve taburelerle ciğer üstüne bir lokanta açtı.  Müşteri çevresi oluşturana kadar zorluklar yaşadı ama vazgeçmedi.zaman içinde adını ve lokantasını tanıttı.  Böylece belli bir müşteri potansiyeline sahip oldu.  Müşterileri artınca yan tarafındaki dükkanı da alarak kendi yeriyle birleştirdi ve lokantasını büyüttü.  Masa sandalye sayısını artırdı.  Elif Hanım özellikle erkeklerin yaptığı yaprak ciğeri yapan tek kadın.  Yaşadığı bütün engellere  ve zorluklara rağmen işini geliştirmeyi başarmış kadın bir girişimci.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi lokantasını tadilat yaptırdı ve tabaklarını yeniledi.  Elif Hanım gelecekte yaprak ciğerinde bayan usta olarak marka olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and to replace her plates.

loans.name: Laldev

texts.en:
Laldev is the father of three children. His elder daughter has been married and his son is working with him, while the youngest daughter is studying. 

Twenty years ago, Laldev opened a carpentry shop with his brother where they make beautiful pieces of art, usually furniture for the home. He works 10-12 hours each day. Gradually he is getting recognized in the village for the quality of his work. The customers are impressed by the durability of his furniture and are recommending him to their friends in the area. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials that basically would be wood and some elegant pieces of art that he can sell.  With the loan, he will be able to have the necessary resources and materials to make pieces of furniture according to the orders he gets.

He dreams of getting ahead and progressing with his family, improving their quality of life, and being able to give the opportunity to other people to work in his carpentry shop, but everything depends on the evolution of his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood

loans.name: Levie

texts.en: Levie is 37 years old, married and has three children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. She wants to keep generating good profits to sustain the education needs of her children. All of them are in school and in need of daily allowance. Levie’s rice field is in need of proper maintenance and sustenance to farm inputs. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming. This will help improve crop production, which will lead to an abundant harvest some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Shabani is the father of four children, one small, two grown, and one in school. He is married and has been a taxi driver for ten years now. His business day runs from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

He has now approached Tujijenge, a Kiva partner, to request financial support. This is his fifth loan request since he started taking loans at Tujijenge, which he used to maintain his working machine (taxi). He managed to repay all of the loans successfully and has now requested another loan. Shabani will use this loan to pay for his taxi maintenance expenses and to buy new taxi tires, since if he does not do so, he will be stopped frequently by traffic. He wants to solve this issue so that he can do business freely. In the coming years, Shabani would like to open a business frame where he will sell dry foods. With his previous investments, he earned an extra income which he used to cover school fees and household expenses and saved for unforeseen needs.  

This loan request will be apportioned among Tanzania Group's five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for his taxi maintenance expenses and buy new tires.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.en:
Luis Enrique (57 years old) and Norma Angélica live in Mexico city. They are a happily married couple and live together in a house. Together they run a small stationary shop.

Unfortunately, Norma has recently had to be admitted to the hospital to receive treatment and asks for this loan to pay for the medical examinations and pharmaceuticals that she needs in order to improve her health. $5,000 Mexican pesos will pay for the medical expenses and the medication necessary for Norma's complete treatment.

This is Luis's first loan with Konfío and considers himself a responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay for a series of medical examinations his wife needs.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (corn and coffee) for 15 years, age 43; she is single and has a child. It is clear that Gumercinda works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her son will be able to do his homework and improve the living conditions. Gumercinda is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, which will permit her to have better lighting, charge her cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Sumiya Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Sumiya, Sadho, Mina, Roti, and Malti live in the rural part of Bandhdih village, Dumka District, Jharkhand, and they have formed a group called Sumiya Mahila Samuha to help each other improve their livelihoods and standard of living. They work hard to support their families and each has their own aspirations that they hope to realize. They want to educate their children and improve their homes. They are willing to work hard and do what it takes to uplift their families.

Sumiya is married and mother of two children. She runs a sweet and snack shop and plans to grow her business by also selling packaged products like biscuits, snacks, chocolates, soft drinks, etc., for which there is a good local demand. The family was initially dependent on agriculture and then they started a small snacks shop and gradually moved totally into this business. They also have hired two people to help them in this business. They wanted to grow more as there is good demand for their sweets for which they are seeking a loan from Kiva to buy raw materials needed in making sweets.

Like Sumiya, other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihood. To improve their business in large scale, they need sufficient capital, so they seek a loan which they will invest in their respective endeavors. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed in making sweets

loans.name: Saraswati Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Sabita (the group leader, who is standing with her hand raised), Gudiya, Rekha, Ranju, and Manu live in the village of Bandhdih, in the Dumka district of Jharkhand. 

They have formed a group called Saraswati Mahila Samuha. The group consists of diligent women who work as daily wage laborers and they have their own livelihood. They are married and all are mothers. They all want to ensure a better future for themselves and their families. To achieve this, the group has approached MESP (MicroGraam’s partner) for a loan which is repayable in easy installments. 

Sabita has been doing tailoring work along with her husband for the last eight years. She is now requesting a loan to establish a small ready-made garment business along with a tailoring department. She hopes to save money for her children's future.

Your loan would help these five women to provide a better standard of living for their school-going children.

loans.use: to establish a small ready-made garment business

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.en:
Maria Josefina lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (coffee) for 30 years, age 46; she is a widow and has five children. It is clear that Maria Josefina works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to do their homework and improve their living conditions.
Maria Josefina is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit them to have better lighting, charge her cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en:
Serapio lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (corn and coffee) 40 years ago, age 60 years who lives with his wife and four children, they help him to work in the farmland. It is clear that Serapio works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. 

The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that with this solar energy system, he hopes improve the living conditions. Serapio is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge their cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anna Leona

texts.en: Anna Leona is a 58-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte.  Anna Leona runs a sari-sari or retail store business in her place. She has been in the business for more than six years now. Anna Leona is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Anna Leona hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 35 years old and married, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Ethel runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, coffee, eggs, and chips.

Ethel has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, coffee, eggs, and chips.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. She has been knitting handmade embroidery at her home since a few years ago. Her sisters also help her with the completion of her tasks. She has to prove herself a responsible and brave mother. During these years, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Shagufta has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She does not want lose heart and wants to afford all of her household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her business and for her family.

Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a pedal- pump and solar kit

loans.name: Sabitri Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
The Sabitri Mahila Samuha Self-Help Group from rural Bandhdih, Dumka district, Jharkhand, is comprised of five hardworking married women--Dulari, Sunita, Bunli, Sugni and Anima--who want to provide a better education and future for their children. They also hope to insure their families against mishaps.

Dulari is the featured borrower of the group (the lady who is standing with her hand raised). She is married and has two children. Her husband is working as a para-teacher (teacher’s assistant), her two sons are engaged in a computer shop, and Dulari runs a small shoe shop.  

The income that they are generating now is not adequate to maintain the family expenditure, so she wants to improve her monthly income by expanding her shoe shop, for which she is requesting a loan from Kiva. With the loan amount, she wants to stock a variety of shoes. 

Like Dulari, other members are also want to earn better. They want to improve their small rural businesses. To this end, they seek a group loan to invest in these initiatives. Your loan will help these women and their families gain much-needed support to take the necessary steps for uplifting themselves.

loans.use: to stock a variety of shoes in her shop

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.en:
The six women members of the Friendship Group live in the small community of Guineales in the highlands of the Sololá Department of Guatemala.  The businesses represented in this group are small stores, market stalls, a small bakery, and one woman sells clothing.  These are hard working, dedicated women eager to learn how to improve their businesses through the business training that Namaste will provide to them.  They will receive classes in financial literacy and each will have a personal business advisor who will help her write a business plan and offer advice on how to grow her business to meet her goals.
One member of this group is Juana (first from left). She is 53 years old and has been chosen as the president of the group due to her organizational skills and her leadership ability.  She is married with four almost grown-up children. Her husband works as a salesman in the community and helps her support the family. Juana was only able to attend primary school through the second grade, but she has managed to become an experienced business woman.  Her dream is to grow her business enough to support her children through the university, so they can obtain good jobs and have a better future. 
Juana has a small stall in the central market of her community.  She sells household products and foods that are used daily like rice, beans, oil, etc. She has been working there for 30 years, which makes her one of the most experienced business women of her community.  She plans to invest her loan money in more products to sell, and also to do some construction to improve her market stall. She currently works 200 hours a month and has a net profit of 4400 Guatemalan Quetzales.  Her goal is to increase her net profit to 6477 Guatemalan Quetzales by the end of the nine-month loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, and to do some construction to improve her market stall

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house. She has supported her family by cooking Mole, a traditional Mexican dish, and selling it door-to-door. She dreams to become financially stable and to expand her business into a formal setting to uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Maribel would like a loan of MXN3,000 to invest in ingredients and packaging she needs to sell her product.

This is Maribel's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay raw materials she needs to make Mole (a traditional Mexican dish) to sell.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.en:
Cristian lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He works as a teacher of primary education from 3 years, age 21; He live with his parents. It is clear that Cristian works hard to maintain his parents and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, he will be able to prepare his classes at night and help his family with the tasks at home.
Cristian is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit him to have better lighting, charge his cell phone, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Shree Haripriya Shg Group

texts.en:
The responsible Shree Haripriya Self-Help Group is made up of nine members. The members of the group are all women from the district of Kalahandi in Odisha, India. All the group members are involved in doing different kind of activities. 

One of them is Tula, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her raise hand in the photo is Tula. Tula is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is engaged in the activity of making plates, bowls, spoons, and other utensils made of brass, and then selling them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes, mainly for serving food, and sometimes are used while performing rituals. She makes different types and sizes of plates and bowls, depending upon the demand of her customers. 

Tula has a plan to expand her business by producing greater quantities of her products, for which she needs machinery with which she can make the plates more frequently and quickly. She also needs raw materials like coal, brass, etc., and a furnace.  She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. 

Tula, along with her group, Shree Haripriya Self-Help Group, has requested a loan of 135,000 INR for expanding their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like coal, brass, etc.,  and a furnace for her utensil-making business.

loans.name: Aişe Betül

texts.en:
Betül started her work by doing sales from a catalogue from her home. Later on, with the help of a loan from Maya, she opened a little shop in the neighborhood and, when the business got better, she decided to expand it. Her new shop is on one of the main streets where the customer potential is high. Now, she has opened a stationary shop near her other shop. 

Betül's target is to have her own brand and to open a great store in the center of the town. With this loan she will buy products to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Betül hanım iş hayatına evde katalogdan satış yaparak başlamış.  Daha sonra Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile mahalle arasında çok küçük bir tuhafiye dükkanı açmış.  İşleri iyi gidince tuhafiye dükkanını büyütmeye karar vermiş.  Yeni dükkanını müşteri potansiyelinin daha fazla olduğu bir cadde üzerine açmış.  Şimdi tuhafiye dükkanın yan tarafına birde kırtasiye açarak işini geliştirdi.  Betül Hanım'ın en büyük hedefi kendi adına bir marka oluşturmak ve çarşı içinde daha büyük bir dükkan açmak.Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Siba Parabati Shg Group

texts.en:
