Siba Parabati Self-Help Group consists of eleven women from a small village of Kalahandi district in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among them. 

One of them is Kumudini, who was selected as the president of Siba Parabati Self-Help Group. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Kumudini. Kumudini is 35 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. Her children are in schooling. She hopes to see them as officers in the public sector unit. Kumudini has a few acres of land in her village, and she is utilizing her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

Kumudini, along with her group has requested a loan of 165,000 INR,  her portion of which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges. She is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 27 years old and lives with her boyfriend as an unmarried couple. In addition to her job as a waitress at a restaurant, she has made a living by making shoes and bags from textiles and leather to generate income for her family. Her dream is to expand her business into a formal setting and to become financially stable to uplift the living status of her family.

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales but she has insufficient capital to do so. For this reason, Araceli would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase more textiles so she can increase production.

This is Araceli's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy materials to make bags and shoes from fabric and leather.

loans.name: Flores De San Pedro Group

texts.en:
The seven women of this group live in San Pedro Las Huertas, a small town about ten minutes outside of the city of Antigua, Guatemala. The average age of the women in this group is 45 years and they have an average education level of sixth grade of primary school. Most of their businesses are either small stores or sales of clothing. The women are grateful for the support they are getting from Namaste. The Fundación Namaste Guatemaya will provide them with financial literacy classes and a personal business advisor who will help them write a business plan and then provide monthly advice on how to reach their goals.
One outstanding member of this group is Rosa (first from left), who is 32 years old and married with one child who is 7 years old and attends primary school. Rosa studied to be a secretary but has been working in her own business for several years.  Her husband works as a carpenter and is an important support for the family. Her dream is to support her daughter as much as possible to provide her with a better future.
Rosa runs a book and stationery store and also sells underwear in her community.  She will invest her loan money in more products, especially school related products for the store.  In Guatemala the school year begins in January so in the last few months of the year there is increased demand for school supplies. Her current net earnings are 1200 Guatemalan Quetzales per month and she is projecting an 18% increase in profits during this nine-month loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy more products, especially school related products for the store

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is 56 years old and divorced. She has made a living by buying and reselling shoes and beachwear from catalogues to generate income for her family. She dreams to be able to increase her sales so she can provide a better life for her children. 

She aims to continue and improve her business by increasing sales so she can one day have a shop, but she has insufficient capital to do so. For this reason, Blanca would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes and increase her sales.

This is Blanca's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy shoes and beachwear from catalogues to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a vegetable milling machine to process mushroom into powder for an existing export market

loans.name: Basukinath Mahila Samuha Shg Group

texts.en:
Kabita lives with her husband and three children in Jarmundi village, Dumka District, Jharkhand. She is working in Anganwadi (preschool), but from this she doesn't get a regular income, so she also started a tailoring business. She has been in this business for six years and now wants to expand it. 

During wedding season, she can earn more income and now there is good demand also, but there is no financial support to expand her business. Kiva's loan can help with this problem: with the loan amount, she can buy one more sewing machine to fulfill the customers' demand and she can generate more income for her family. This will help her to give a good education to her children and secure their future.

Kabita is a leader of the group called Basukinath Mahila Samuha which is managed by the local local NGO MESP with other three members. She has taken two loans from MESP to improve her business and repaid them successfully. The other members are also seeking a loan to improve their own livelihood. This is their first loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Michael A

texts.en:
Michael, 56, is a farmer in Nyimba, Zambia where he lives with his wife and 5 dependents. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his garden.

Vegetable gardening is big business for many rural farmers in Nyimba district. Michael grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. Last season he grew tomatoes, groundnuts, fresh greens and fresh maize. With the profits he was able to pay the school fees for his children and invest in livestock. 

Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Michael's need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Rent to Own  will deliver a water pump directly to Michael's farm. Rent to Own also provides Michael with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 48 years old and lives with her boyfriend as an unmarried couple. In addition to her job as a call center representative, she has made a living by buying and reselling silver accessories at her work and door-to-door in order to generate income for her family. She dreams to become financially stable to expand her business into a formal setting and uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales but she has insufficient capital to do so. For this reason, Araceli would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase more pieces of jewelry to resell.

This is Araceli's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy more pieces of silver jewelry to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret's group is comprised of two hard working women. Margret is 18 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Potal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Magret has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells all types of fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Magret has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh other foods for sale, and will help Magret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers. Magret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business into a wholesale. 

Magret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh other foods for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with four children and three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Esther sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for nine years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. As well, she aspires to buy a van to ease transportation.

Esther decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Baybay, Leyte. Marilou and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 25 years now. This is the source of their income.

Marilou is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the boat and to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to go back to fishing and augment their catch, which they can sell to the market. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve their fishing venture so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the boat and to buy a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Alejandro Martin

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven de 20 años de edad muy responsable, siempre luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a muchas horas de estudio está desempeñándose como uno de los mejores alumnos de su salón, estudia la carrera de Administración. Para apoyar con el gasto de mensualidades desde hace algún tiempo trabaja en un Banco y cree que le va bien porque es muy trabajador, emprendedor y muy entusiasta.
Alejandro está muy contento y agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar algunos enseres para su vivienda, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y con esto seguirá esforzándose para más adelante convertirse en un gran profesional para orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a young man, who is 20 years old. He is very responsible and is always fighting for the well-being of his family.

Thanks to the support of his parents and to many hours of study, he is one of best students in this class. He is studying Management. To help with the monthly expenses, he has spent some time working in a bank. He believes that it is going well because he is a very hard-working, enterprising, and enthusiastic.

Alejandro is very happy with and thankful for Kiva loans because with the support they have often him, he will buy some essentials for his home. In this way, he will be improving his quality of life, and he will continue making an effort to become a professional to make his parents proud.

loans.use: to buy essentials to furnish his house.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a model of a spirit and determination. Although her career as a beautician started as a hobby, she developed her skills over the course of 11 years through hard work and diligent studying. Three years ago, she decided to take her career one step further and opened her own beauty salon with the support of her family.

A 35 year old mother of three handicapped children, Zainab overcame many obstacles to get to where she is today. In a country where women entrepreneurs are not always perceived positively, Zainab remained persistent and has even created job opportunities for three more women in her community. She expects this number to increase as her business continues to grow. She is proud of her work and attributes much of her success to patience, time management, and organizational skills. Providing her children with the care they need is what motivates her to continue developing her business.

Zainab’s flourishing business and her willingness to cultivate her occupational skills qualified her to participate in the WLIFT program and take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 8,000 USD. With the loan, Zainab plans to expand her business further, by purchasing additional equipment, tools, and cosmetics.

loans.use: purchasing additional equipment tools and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and pay labor

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gajalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Gajalaxmi Self-Help Group is a group consisting of eleven members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking, and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Ahalya, who was selected as their president. Ahalya is a 46-year-old lady living with her husband and her one son who is schooling. The lady standing with her raised hand is Ahalya. Her husband is not able to do any work because he is always ill. Ahalya runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Ahalya has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she, along with her group, has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains, and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains, and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Citlalli Del Rosario

texts.en:
Citlalli is 43 years old, is unmarried and lives with her parents in an apartment. She currently generates income for her family running a food stand selling lunches and desserts. Her dream is to establish a diner to become financially stable and uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and set up a diner in her garage but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Citlalli would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase materials and ingredients she needs to begin the business and serve a larger number of customers.

This is Citlalli's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to pay for materials and ingredients to expand her food stall .

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena, is aged 42, married to a carpenter and blessed with two children. She has been selling personal use products in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 1,300 monthly. Her net income from her business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase lotion, perfume, deodorant, lipstick, lingerie, and body creams to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve so that she can earn more income on it.

loans.use: To purchase lotion, perfume, deodorant, lipstick, lingerie, and body creams to sell.

loans.name: Jacquilline

texts.en:
Jacquilline is a farmer in Kangundo town. Besides farming as her primary business, she also sells clothes. She is 27 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She also supports four people in her family.

She will be using this loan to buy clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her clothing business.  This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wardrobe to furnish her room.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
"Patrick is 51 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, toilet paper, salt, sanitary towels, detergent, tomatoes, eggs, egg plants, carrots.

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, toilet paper, salt, sanitary towels, detergent, tomatoes, eggs.  This will help Patrick to generate greater profits and boost the business. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to become the biggest soft drinks seller. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy more soap, toilet paper, salt, sanitary towels, detergent, tomatoes, eggs

loans.name: Pacia

texts.en:
Pacia is 63 years old, single, and helps her nephews with their education.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Pacia requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Pacia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Pacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Yolando

texts.en:
Yolando works hard to support her family. Yolando is married and has a boarding house renting business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo, wood, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her business.

Yolando has been in this business for 10 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo, wood, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Donelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Donelyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish and raising pigs. Donelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Donelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
"Joseph is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mayuge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his coffee milling business, which sells coffee. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more coffee, and will help Joseph to generate greater profit. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to increase the business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy more coffee

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a poultry farmer in Kangundo town and has been in this business for seven years now. She is 46 years old, married and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. Right now her monthly income is KES 15,000.

Jane plans to use this loan to buy poultry feed. She will also buy more chicks for rearing and thereby increase her stock of poultry. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is Jane's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In the future, Jane hopes to be successful in her farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and chicks for rearing

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married; she works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dina is 41 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Dina has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Dina requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her ice cream vending business.

Dina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Dina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her ice cream vending business

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Paterna works hard to support her family.  She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Paterna is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for the business.

Paterna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 34 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 53 years old and married.  She has five children. With three children currently in school, Maria Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, spices, noodles, coffee, biscuits, etc., to sell.  Maria Liza has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Maria Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, spices, noodles, coffee, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with two children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

Esther sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for five years. She also generates additional income from selling liquid soap. She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Esther has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.

Esther is aspiring to buy a plot and also to educate her children to the university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 22-year-old single Palestinian refugee. Due to the low social and financial situations of the Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and their limited work access, he decided two years ago to start working as a DJ to cover the needs and expenses of his family, since he is their sole earner.  He is responsible for two additional members.
Abed attracted a lot of customers with his talent and hard work as he gained a good reputation for his good work among his customers.  Thus, today he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to improve his business by buying new audio equipment to provide his customers with better services.
This loan will be help Abed improve his business, and it will be his first step toward success.

loans.use: To improve his business by buying new audio equipment to provide his customers with better services.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello Lenders,
Meet Nancy. At only 13 years old, Nancy led the young generation who picked farming as a chance to make a difference by providing food to feed the world. Now at 19, she keeps dairy cattle, raises poultry and grows tea among other crops. She is also sharpening her entrepreneurial spirit by actively running other agriculture related businesses. 

Agriculture in Kenya suffers from entrenched negative perceptions among the youth. They think it is not glamorous, since in their minds a farmer is someone like their grandparents, doing backbreaking labour in the fields and getting little to show for it. Thus they move from rural areas to urban ones and most of them find themselves living in shanty towns. They are soon faced with problems that do not exist in the countryside: street crime, social inequality and discrimination. They also realize the cost of city life is significantly higher and the opportunities to produce their own food and other basic necessities is greatly reduced.
Nancy chooses to take the opportunity of being the generation that ends hunger and alleviates malnutrition and poverty. She is particularly interested in poultry farming!  She aspires to grow this business big time, but she is facing major challenges such as limited funds. It is for this reason that Nancy is seeking a loan to buy more poultry.
Returns from this expansion will help her deal with the high cost of agricultural inputs that cripple smallholder farmers. Furthermore, the growth of her business will bring so much joy to her husband and children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rashidah

texts.en:
Rashidah is married with five children and three go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

Rashidah sells charcoal on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Rashidah has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She is aspiring to increase her sales so as to increase her capital base. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita, is aged 57, widowed, and has two children. She has been in the food vending business for almost three years. She sells spaghetti, noodles, and rice cakes in their village and earns a net income of PHP 250 weekly.  Due to insufficient funds, she would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 to purchase food styrofoam containers, sugar, tomato/spaghetti sauce, milk, cooking oil, soy sauce, and vinegar to use in her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to expand and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase food containers, styrofoam,  sugar, tomato/spaghetti sauce, milk, cooking oil, soy sauce, and vinegar to use in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for eight years. She earns more income from dried fish-making.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 20000 to purchase a fishing net for her enterprise. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron to build walls in her home.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 46-year-old married mother of five children from Baybay, Leyte. Myrna has been engaged with her husband in a fishing business, their source of income, for more than 26 years now. 

Myrna is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of their fishing boat and to buy a new engine. This will enable them to improve their enterprise by increasing their catch.

In the future, Myrna hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue to pay for the needs of the family, including the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her fishing boat and to buy a new engine

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Agustina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell for her business.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aurelio Antonio

texts.es:
Aurelio es un joven de 19 años de edad el cual se desempeña como agricultor en el municipio de Bello, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza alternadamente con los jornales y es la cría y venta de ganado bovino con los que intenta mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya vive con sus padres y siempre intenta ayudarlos.

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de ganado de levante con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá ganado para exhibir y vender.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Aurelio is a 19-year-old young man who is employed as a farmworker in the municipality of Bello. Seeing that his income is not sufficient to cover household expenses, he started an activity that he carries out between his shifts: the raising and selling of cattle. With these cattle, he is trying to improve the living conditions of his family. He still lives with his parents and always tries to help them.

This is why he needs a loan to purchase cattle to raise. Then he will be able to improve his sales and boost his activity by having more assets in his micro-business and by making it more attractive in the eyes of his customers, since he will have cattle to show and sell.

His main dream is to be able to generate good income so that he won't have to see his family going without the necessities.

Support a farmworker of the Colombian countryside with big dreams for his family!

loans.use: to buy cattle to boost his business and to be able to improve his parents' quality of life

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 50-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married mother of six children, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. 

Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in the camp, she decided 14 years ago to open a stationary shop to help her husband in covering their family’s expenses and needs.

Throughout the years, Mona was able, with her hard work and ambitions, to gain lots of customers in addition to a good reputation in her region.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new stationary supplies for the upcoming school season, which will increase her income and develop her business.

Mouna always hopes to expand her business and increase her profit to provide her beloved children with better social and financial living conditions, as she hopes this loan will help her achieve her dream of expanding her working place.

loans.use: To buy new stationary supplies for the upcoming school season

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah is married with seven children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall from home. She has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and beans.  She sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to start farming to increase her profits. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, onions,and beans for her food stall businesss

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 23 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child. She is a farmer in Kangundo town, where she keeps dairy cattle and also grows cash crops to sell. 

She will be using this loan amount to buy cattle feed, seeds, and fertilizer for planting her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more livestock.

This is Janet's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loan well. Her future hopes are to be successful in her farming and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: David Naun

texts.es:
David es un joven soñador, tiene 20 años, es soltero y vive en Pisco junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como Vendedor en una ferretería, labora por más de 10 horas porque quiere ahorrar dinero para más adelante poder estudiar una carrera universitaria, él cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y brinda una excelente atención a los clientes.
David está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un terreno para más adelante construir su casa, ya que a la fecha vive en una casa alquilada. Con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y en un corto tiempo podrá cumplir dos de sus más grandes sueños: Tener su casa propia y estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
David is a young dreamer. He is 20 years old, is single, and lives in Pisco with his family. 
He is a eager to get ahead in life. He works as a salesman in a hardware store; he works for more than 10 hours a day because he wants to save money to study for a professional degree at the university. He believes that he does well at his job because he always makes an effort at everything he does and provides excellent customer service. 
David is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him, he will be able to buy land to one day build his house, as he currently lives in a rented house. This will improve his quality of life and in a short time he will fulfill two of his greatest dreams: having his own home and studying for a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy land to build his house.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Yvonne has been in this business for 5 years. Yvonne earns more income from food processing.

Yvonne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and chips.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 34 years old and married with two children.

Angel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Angel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Angel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. Ma. Fe is widowed and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 14 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Zakia Bibi

texts.en:
Zakia lives in Rawalpindi. She is 49 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband has a livestock business where he buys livestock and raises them for reselling purposes. Zakia is a supportive housewife and works hand in hand in helping her husband in preparing the feed and taking care of the animals.They have been doing this for 15 years now. Her husband sells them at the local butcher market, and has a good client base now. But their income is not sufficient to cover all their household expenses. 

In order to increase his income, he wants to buy a buffalo to raise; he will then sell it at a profit. 

He wants to be able to save money for his children's future. Therefore, Zakia has requested a loan to be able to help her husband purchase a buffalo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Merlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell for her buy and sell ready-to-wear business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Anamaria is in her late 30s, is married, and is taking care of three orphans (of her late sister and brother) who are still at school. She has been running three projects, a general store, a stationary shop, and takes care of different types of birds which she sells outside the country. She has been in her business for 10 years now. She works from 07am to 10pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Anamaria's 23rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open a stationary shop, open a general store and buy feeds for her home bird business.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is very happy with the loan and is doing great.  She appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees for the orphans, built her own house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the stationary stock, increase on the general store inventory and to buy food for her home bird business (like ducks, turkey, ostrich, local chicken),  She dreams of building a small house for the older boy orphan.

Anamaria will share this loan with her loan group "Mpipi" which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the stationary stock, increase on the general store inventory and to buy food for her birds business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy better seed to make good food for her cattle.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte. Mirasol has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source their income. 

Mirasol is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and an engine boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Moreover, Mirasol hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income. Mirasol also wants to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and an engine boat

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. She does farming in Kangundo town where she keeps poultry as well as does dairy farming. She has been in this business for 5 years now and it has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to increase her stock of chicks for raising. She will also buy more stock of cattle feeds. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business and a good future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of poultry.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, a 45-year-old mother of three, is living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Her husband earns from transportation services and she helps him, augmenting their situation. She is selling ready to wear clothes in their community, and she earns better income from this to sustain their living. She borrowed a new loan recently from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more ready to wear clothes to sell. In the future, she wants to have a boutique where she could sell more.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmelin

texts.en: Carmelin, a 25 year old mother of two, has operated a swine fattening business for over five years. She earns well from this activities alongside her husband's income from their transportation services business. She is determined to save a portion of her returns for education costs for her children in the future. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase feeding supplies for her pigs. She hopes that in the near future, her business will prosper as well as their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Doricah

texts.en:
Hearing a description of Doricah can sound a lot like hearing someone describe your own mother. She doesn’t stand out in a crowd. She’s not the first one to speak, nor the loudest. She sits down every day in the evening to catch the latest intrigue on her favorite local radio station, which provides maybe the only break in her day. 

Doricah who is a mother of four and based in the Nyamira area of Kenya has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. She sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy building, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy building. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that provides small holder farmers with a service bundle that includes credit, training and market facilitation, she believes her life will change. 

Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy building provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Doricah believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy building. 

Doricah believes that ending poverty begins with empowering women so that they can control their own destiny.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy building

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stall.

Antonina has been in this business for 5 years. Antonina earns more income from pig fattening.

Antonina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stall

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 25, is a rookie smallholder farmer from Nyamira, Kenya. Since he started farming last year, he sees a lot of potential in the business. He started out with a small number of poultry and calves just to test the waters. He made significant sales selling eggs to customers at a local market. He established that the demand for the product is on the rise. 

Daniel is now seeking a loan investment from the Kiva lenders to buy more poultry. After being in the poultry business for some time, he is now willing and ready to go all the way in. He not only enjoys farming itself, but also selling the products in the market. He has sharp entrepreneurial skills that he has acquired through other business ventures that he runs to sustain his lifestyle.  

Since he is still a bachelor, he plans to plow the profits from the investment back into the business to fuel growth and efficiency.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is married with five children; four of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy cassava, cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. She also generates additional income from selling chapatti. She sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked stall of different foodstuffs. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their flexibility. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cassava, cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tools for her hair shop and to raise chickens

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 45 years old and she has a grocery business in Kangundo town. She is married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She has been in this business for five years, and she currently makes a monthly income of KES 11,000.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a stock of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Monico

texts.en: Monico, a father of six, has been in many activities in order to make a living. He has been operating a transportation service for over eight years, and he earns a good income from this. However, farming is their main source of income and it is his desire to cultivate all the vacant lot to improve his return. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying vehicle spare parts. To restore farm nutrients, he took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer. He wants to improve his farm as well as to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is 44 years old and she lives in Yerevan city. Unfortunately she became a widow when she was very young and now she lives with her son and her retired mother. Her son is 21 years old and he is a very kind and caring young man, who does his best to help his mother to earn their family living. He both studies and works at the travel agency. Karine is very skilled tailor and and has been in this field for over 15 years. As she says tailoring was once her hobby and is now her business and source of income, which she greatly developed. Now she has a small rented booth and she has a worker who helps her to manage the orders of her many customers. She takes orders of different kinds; she sews both for women and men, she sews, repairs and changes any kind of clothes and she does it quickly and with good quality. Karine asks this loan in order to buy some suitable furniture for her small workshop and also to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her small workshop and to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is 44 years old, married, and raising four children. He lives with his family in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a,Yemen. Yahya has a secondary education. His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind, honest, and hardworking man. As the main source of income for his family, Yahya has sold groceries and food products for eight months. He started this business with a small capital. Thanks to Yahya's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from his business have allowed Yahya to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Yahya turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy many kinds of food materials as milk, soft drinks, biscuits, vegetables, and other foods to be able to meet all the demands of  customers.  Yahya plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to save money to send his children to the school. He hopes to purchase a piece of land and build his own house on it.

loans.use: to buy more stock to be able to meet all the demands of customers.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 61 years old and he lives in the village of Khotanan of Syunik region. After his schooling, Edgar received a vocational education and since a very young age (for 40 years) he worked at the Kapan city combine as a driller. 

Edgar now is unemployed, and he is fully engaged in framing and agriculture. He has a cute and nicely cared farm where he has three cows, two heifers, 20 chickens and a horse. As he says the assortment of his farm products are not a wide variety; he sells milk, and sometimes meat and eggs. He also cultivates beans, cucumbers, and tomatoes on his plot of land. 

For Edgar to earn an everyday living, like every peasant family, is the result of hard work and patience each day.  Edgar is married, and he has a son and a daughter, who both are married and live with their families. 

Edgar asks for this Kiva loan in an amount of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle; he wants already to start the storing of fodder for his farm cattle. As he says, if there is a lot of fodder and the cattle are fed, he feels that his farm is ready and safe to meet the cold season.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 37 years old. She is a housewife, blessed with a son and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi with her family. Her husband is a tailor by profession and has a tailoring shop in a nearby market. They live in a rented house. Their children go to school and it is very difficult for them to pay their school fees and also meet their regular expenses. 

Her husband wants to buy needles, measuring tape and other supplies for tailoring purposes. Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan to buy these materials in order to get more orders. They are hopeful that it will increase their income and help them cover their expenses more easily.

Shabana's dream is that her children get educated. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, measuring tape and other supplies to add to her husband's current stock.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fatima de 34 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Esta joven mujer es muy trabajadora, responsables, que ha tenido que lucha día a día para alimentar a sus dos hijos menores lo cual es madre y padres para sus pequeños, que son su vida, su motivación, su fuerza y sus ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  El objetivo del crédito es para surtir su negocio  con la compra de cosméticos como: rubor, labial, cremas hidratantes, marbelline, delineador, sombra de ojos, vanidades. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fatima is 34 years old and is a single mother with two young children. She is originally from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the region. She young woman is very hard working and responsible, and she has had to fight day after day to feed her two young children, who are her life, her motivation, her strength, and her desire to go forward. Unfortunately, she wasn’t able to study, and she has needed to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her strength and her desire to go forward, she sells cosmetics door to door and in her house. She is dedicated to her work and offers her products for eight hours each day. The use for the loan is to supply her business by buying cosmetics—such as blush, lipstick, hydrating lotions, Maybelline products, eyeliner, eye shadow, and vanities—so that in the near future she can earn a better income. Fatima is thankful for the help that Kiva loans offer to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that she can do dignified work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as blush, lipstick, hydrating lotions, Maybelline products, eyeliner, eye shadow, and vanities.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia is married with five children; four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava, flour, beans, and green banana. She works for seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land to start farming.  She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy food stock for her restaurant

loans.name: Nourhan Group

texts.en:
Aida is the featured borrower for Nourhan's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living at the same time.

Aida is a 57-year-old Syrian refugee, a widowed mother of three. Twenty years ago, she started making handicrafts to cover the expenses and needs of her children. She is the sole earner in her family, and she is trying with all her power and energy to improve her children’s social and financial situations to compensate her husband’s absence. Today, through the acquired Al Majmoua loan, she wants to improve her business by buying necessary handicraft tools with a newly released collection. She is seated on the right in the picture.

With respect to the other members of the group, Darine is a 32-year-old married mother of three children who wants to increase her merchandise by acquiring new girls' accessories products. She is the lady at the center of the picture with blond hair. Sawsan is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who wants to open her own girls' accessories business. She is the first lady on the left.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying necessary handicraft tools with a newly released collection.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
This kind and laborious man lives in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. Yurik happily lives with his beloved wife in their small house built on his own many years ago; as he says, his house is very old, but it is full of nice and warm memories of when their children were small (now they are married and live separately), the family was big, and they lived all together. 

Now Yurik is busy with farming and agriculture, which fills all his time. He cultivates potatoes, beans, cabbage and greens, also sunflowers, which nicely decorate and make Yurik’s farm cheerful with their bright yellow color. On his farm, Yurik breeds 2 cows, 2 heifers, 2 pigs and 20 chickens. His farm products are things like such as milk, eggs and vegetables, which Yurik sells to their already regular customers. As Yurik says, he is close to nature which makes him feel younger, but despite of his efforts the income is very little, both for their living and for the care of his farm.

He asks this loan in order to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, since in his barn he already lacks it for his cattle.  The warm months of summer are in past, and the fields are not full of fresh and green grass.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 48 years old and she lives in the village of Bazum, which is in the Lori region. Valentina has a higher pedagogical education, and thanks to her specialty for several years, she worked as a teacher of biology and chemistry. Now she changed the profile of her work because of the need of money, which was very little when she worked at the school. 

Valentina is not married, and she lives with her retired mother. Her mother is 71 years old and she has some problems with her health. Valentina is very worried and impatient to find out the cause of her mother’s health issues, but she needs some financial support and she relies on Kiva lenders’ help.

She asks for this loan in order to pay for her mother’s medical examination, with the great hope that there will be nothing serious and her beloved and sweety mother will be as active and cheerful as she usually used to be.

loans.use: to pay for her mother’s medical examination

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 49-year-old widowed woman, lives in a small borough named Kulashi, in west Georgia. She lives alone, and the only source of income for her is transfers from abroad. Maia can't stand waiting for these mentioned payments, and doing nothing for herself. She has requested a loan to start her own activity and generate some income.
 
Her application was rejected several times because of her unstable financial condition and lack of business experience. At last, MFO Credo has processed her loan request within its joint initiative with Kiva, which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. So, Maia plans to purchase stocks of clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community at higher prices. 

This business will greatly assist Maia, as she will be able to generate her own income, tackle her financial difficulties and live in better conditions. She awaits your support and will highly appreciate your help and kindness.

loans.use: to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is 60 years old and she lives with her beloved husband in Kapan city, of the Syunik region. 

For many years, she worked at different textile factories as a worker, then as an engineer. She also worked as a head of the workshop for several years. Now, she works at a combine in Kapan city. Bela’s husband works at a factory of dairy products as a guard. They have two sons who are married and they live with their families, separately. 

Bela says that now she is very worried and has an urgent problem, the solution of which she needs some financial support. Her husband feels unhealthy and weak and the reason for that kind of feeling still remains unknown. 

Bela asks a loan of AMD 300,000 (Armenian drams) in order to pay for the medical examination of her husband, with the great hope that there will be nothing seriously wrong with him.  She thanks Kiva lenders for help beforehand and she wishes all the best to all of them.

loans.use: to pay for the medical examination of her husband.

loans.name: Araceli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely de 42 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de  Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Esta joven mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios, en la actualidad lucha día a día para salir adelante con sus hijos, y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su  esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es llevar sus encargos a clientes fijos y eventuales en clientes de empresas y  con un pesos de unos  25 kg todos los unas diez horas diarias,  actividad que la disfruta ya que es el medio de mantener a sus familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos como: labial, rubor, marbelline, sombra de ojos, lápiz de ojos, desmaquillador, crema hidratantes.  Araceli agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Araceli is 42 years old and is married with two young children. She is originally from Achuapa, a place located in the northern part of the region. She is a young woman, characterized by being hard working and responsible, with the desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, she couldn’t go to school. Now, she fights day after day to go forward with her children and to offer them a better future.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to go forward, she sells cosmetics door to door and in her house. Her work routine is to bring orders to her fixed clients and possible business clients, carrying a weight of 25 kg for ten hours daily. She enjoys this work, since it is how she can take care of her family. The use for the loan is to invest in capital for her business and to supply her business with product such as lipstick, blush, Maybelline products, eye shadow, eye pencils, make-up remover, and hydrating lotions. Acaceli is thankful for the help that Kiva loans have offered to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that she can do dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying and selling cosmetics, such as lipstick, blush, Maybelline products, eye shadow, eye pencils, make-up remover, and hydrating lotions.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
This nice and charming lady’s name is Armine and she lives in the city of Tashir in the Lori region. As she says, she has a big and lovely family; her husband is a taxi driver, her elder son works at the city police station, and the younger son has just returned from the army. Her parents-in-law are already pensioners.  Armine is a pedagogue, with a higher education and already many years of experience in that field. She works at the school as a teacher of elementary classes.  After her school work, she also helps some pupils to prepare their lessons. These are children, who do not manage to do well in school. She is a very clever and patient specialist who works with great devotion to her profession. 

She asks this loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer, since she wants both to learn some computer programs and also by the help of computer, to get informed about the innovations in the methodology of teaching.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has a farming business in Kangundo town where she keeps cattle and grows cash crops to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is 42 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. 

She will use this loan to stock more cattle feed, fertilizer and seeds for planting during this planting season. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In future she hopes to educate her children to higher education and also build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and cattle feeds.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Alice, who has something that many farm workers in Kenya don't - a small plot of land on which to grow her own maize, fruits and vegetables. Alice lives with her family of six in a two-room mud-thatched house in Kenyenya, a remote village in the Kisii area of Kenya. Alice completed her secondary school education, thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but she never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. 

She started farming and has been farming for the past twelve years, and through mixed farming she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Otigo' (from a person's name). Although Alice passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Alice comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will help her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption.

Harvested water will help Alice irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. This loan will turn around the life of Alice, as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of this “precious commodity”, thus saving her time.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Venus Bibi

texts.en:
Venus is a hardworking married woman. She is a mother of 10 children. She started tailoring to add additional income to support their family. Venus has been a tailor for a period of 12 years, earning income to meet their household expenses. She is 60 years old now, but age did not impact her passion to support her family. She still manages to attract a good clientele. All her life she has worked hard for her children and now wants to do more for them and for her grandchildren. 

Venus was introduced to BRAC Pakistan by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan. She intends to buy materials, threads, zippers and buttons to add to her current stock to make more orders. Venus plans to use the anticipated income for her children and grandchildren. She also hopes that their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, buttons and zippers to add to her current stock.

loans.name: N.y.n Group

texts.en:
Joumana is the featured borrower of the N.y.n group. She joined with the other members to request this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends, and are working hard to develop their businesses and lives. Joumana is 39 years old, married and the mother of two children. Due to the low earnings of her husband, she decided to work as teacher to help meet the needs of her family. As her children grew up, she searched for a new source of income to meet her children's needs and began working with a group of women to tailor beads for special dresses to make them more special and beautiful. Today, Joumana wants to improve her work by buying more beads that will make dresses that attract more customers. That's why she is requesting this loan. We see her on the far right side of the picture. 

With respect to the other group members, Neamat, the second lady from the left, is a 40-year-old divorced woman with three children who wants to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children. Ragheda, second on the right, is a 41-year-old married mother of two who works in a stationary shop and wants to increase her inventory with products for the upcoming school season. Sahar, the first one from the left, is a 43-year-old married mother of four who wants to repair her car.

loans.use: to make dresses that will attract more customers..

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tools for her bicycle-repairing store.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 52 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children; three of them sit idle at home. 

Her son has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Razia is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her son wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Razia is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings, as well.

Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt etc. for her son's restaurant.

loans.name: Francisco Jacob

texts.es:
Francisco Jacob es un joven de 22 años, casado, habitante del municipio de El Sauce.
Desciende de una familia muy pobre donde él y sus hermanos crecieron solo con su madre, la que tenía que trabajar como empleada doméstica lavando y planchando a particulares para llevar el pan de cada día a sus hijos.
Hoy gracias a Dios tiene trabajo como operario de limpieza el cual lo realiza en los camiones recolectores de basura que transitan por las diferentes calles del municipio con el fin de ver una ciudad más limpia y sana.
Aunque gana tan poco ayuda a su madre en los gastos del hogar y le gustaría ayudarle más y que ella no trabajara porque se merece mucho más, pero por el bajo salario no puede.
A pesar de las circunstancias en las que ha crecido y la carencia de muchas cosas, se siente muy feliz porque se acaba de casar y en tan pocos meses con la ayuda de Dios va a ser papá que es lo más maravilloso que le ha pasado.
Por tal motivo necesita un crédito para la compra de medicamentos, pago de consultas y realización de ultrasonidos que necesita hacerse su esposa para ver si el bebé está bien.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le apoyen con este financiamiento donde les quedará eternamente a gradecido.
texts.en:
Francisco Jacob is young 22-year-old man. He is married and lives in the municipality of El Sauce.

He comes from a very poor family. He and his siblings grew up only with a mother, who had to work as a domestic employee, washing and ironing people’s personal items to bring food to her children everyday.

Today, thanks to God, he works as a cleaning worker, which he does in garbage collection trucks that travel through different streets in the municipality with the goal of making the city cleaner and healthier.

Even though he earns very little, he helps his mother with the household expenses. He would like to help her more and have her not work because she deserves much more. However, with his low salary, it’s not possible.

Despite the circumstances under which he grew up and the lack of many things, he feels very happy because he has just married and in a few months, with the help of God, he will be a father, which is the most amazing thing that has happened to him.

For this reason, he needs a loan to buy medicines, pay for appointments, and allow his wife to have ultrasounds to make sure the baby is doing well.

He hopes and trusts in God that the Kiva investors through Ceprodel support him with this loan, for which he will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicines, pay for appointments, and allow his wife to have ultrasounds.

loans.name: Put

texts.en:
Put is a 25-year-old student at a university. He is single and lives with his parents in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Put would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him go on in his third year at university. 

In the future, he wants to have a successful business and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Hiralal

texts.en:
Hiralal is a 35-year-old carpenter who is living in Jarmundi village, Dumka district, Jharkhand. He is married and has two daughters who are studying in school. His wife takes care of the household.

Hiralal’s elder brother had started this business. Hiralal learned his trade from his brother and started working with him. Hiralal is also a para teacher (teacher’s assistant). He is very happy because he has orders to fill and is getting popular in his area.

He needs primary materials, mainly wood, to do his job, so he is requesting a loan. He will use the entire loan amount to buy wood and other equipment to complete his orders. This will provide him with a good income, which he wants to save for his daughters’ education and to continue his trade.

The loan is very important for him because he has many orders, something that he has always hoped for, but he does not have the supplies to fill them.

loans.use: to buy wood and other equipment.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is single and has no children, but does care for other family members. For the last five years, she has operated a retail shop, and is requesting this loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil and rice to sell to her customers. She generates additional income from selling fruits and vegetables, and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She hopes to expand her shop into a wholesale operation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en:
Fuzuli  is a farmer.  He is married and has two  children. One of them is 25 years old and married, the other child studies at the university. They are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from Fuzuli city and live in the village of Ahmadbayli in the Fuzuli region. 

Fuzuli  has been in the agriculture business for 13 years and wants to repair the roof of his barn. He needs 1,100 AZN.  

He thanks  Kiva organization  and lenders.

loans.use: to pay for repair roof of stall

loans.name: Segundo Jarquin

texts.es: Don Segundo cuenta con gran experiencia en el manejo de finca, desde muy niño su padre le enseño esta actividad y la pone en practica en su parcela,  con esfuerzos propio ha ido incrementado su hato ganadero, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en esta actividad. Tiene la necesidad de establecer semilla mejorada como marandu, alambre de púas, Gliforfato, Fertilizantes, entre otros y pagar mano de obra con el animo de garantizar buena alimentación a su ganado y contar con excelentes condiciones en su parcela solicita crédito a Afodenic mediante Kiva que seria una oportunidad de continuar trabajando con su actividad para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Se caracteriza por ser un padre aplicado, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se preparen y dependan de ellos mismos, por lo que lucha a diario para darle sus estudios mientras el trabaja cada día mas en su propiedad.
texts.en: Segundo has a lot of experience in cattle handling on a ranch. From a very young age, his father taught him this activity, and he puts it in practice on his land. With his own efforts, he has grown his cattle herd. He counts on the support of his wife in this work. He needs to pay for better seed like marandu, barbed wire, glyphosate (a herbicide), and fertilizers, among other things, and to pay for workers with energy to guarantee good food for his cattle. He has excellent conditions on his land. He requests this loan from AFODENIC through Kiva and believes that it will be an opportunity to continue working at this to improve his quality of life. He is a dedicated father. His main dream is that his children are ready and are independent. He fights daily to ensure his children go to school while he works every day on his property.

loans.use: to buy better seed and wire to improve the grass for his cattle to eat.

loans.name: Mujeres Y Hombres Avanzando 6 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the group "Mujeres y Hombres Avanzando 6", (Women and Men Going Forward 6). 

Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children. 

She says that her most difficult challenge has been to have a successful business. She wants to produce enough money to give her children a great education and to live safely.
