This is Santa's 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully grown her business and repaid her previous loan. She has been running her business for around four years. In the beginning, she started with the savings she had. She will use this loan to increase her inventory, by buying more clothes and other products, such as underwear, shoes, cosmetics, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to provide her children all they need. 

She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios.
 Ella es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también al cuido de animales domésticos, es madre de un hijo que es el que le ayuda a estos tipos de trabajo, ya que hace un año que salió de estudiar bachillerato y él es el que depende de ella. 

María cuenta con 15 años de experiencia al cuido de animales domésticos, y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron desde que estaba pequeña, y también que es un trabajo que ella lo realiza en su casa y a la vez sin  descuidar los oficios de su hogar, a este trabajo también le ayuda su hijo y su esposo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 2 novillas que le cuestan $500c/u, con esto ella pretende engordarlas para luego poder venderlas y así obtener algunos sus ingresos.


Ella a futuro con esto desea tener un mayor ingreso de recursos económicos que le permitan poder ayudarle a sus hijo para que pueda continuar con sus estudios a nivel superior.
texts.en:
María, 52 years old, studied until sixth grade. For reasons of economic scarcity, she could no longer continue her studies. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture and also the care of domesticated animals. She is mother to one son who helps her with this type of work, now that it has been a year since he left high school and he depends on her.

María has 15 years of experience in the care of domesticated animals, and she learned thanks to her parents who taught it to her from when she was very young. Also, it is a job that she carries out in her house and at the same time without neglecting the household duties. Her son and husband also help her with this work.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy two calves that cost $500 each. With this she hopes to fatten them to later sell them and obtain income. 

In the future, she wishes to have a better income and economic resources that will allow her to help her son so he can continue with his studies at a higher level.

loans.use: to buy two calves to fatten them to later sell them and obtain income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover maintenance costs for growing cocoa.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 34 años de edad, 30 años de edad y 25 años de edad. Estudio hasta tercer grado ya que en su tiempo eran pocas las personas que tenían acceso a la educación y también solo daban clases hasta tercer grado. Se casó a los 24 años de edad. Su esposo ya falleció, del matrimonio procrearon 3 hijos que son mayores de edad, dos viven en el extranjero y uno vive con ella.

María se dedica a vender tomates en el mercado local, lo hace de 6:00 am a 9:00 am. Para llegar al lugar de venta viaja todos los días 5 kilómetros en autobús y comenta que ya lleva muchos años trabajando de esta manera.

El préstamo será utilizado para hacer la solicitud de una visa para viajar a los Estados Unidos, pues tiene 15 años de no ver a sus hijos y su único contacto ha sido por teléfono.
texts.en:
María, who is 61 years old, is single and has three children ages 34, 30 and 25. She studied up to third grade since during that time few people had access to education and classes were only available up to the third grade.
She got married when she was 24 years old. Her husband has passed, but the marriage yielded three children who are now of age. Two of them live abroad and one lives with her.
Maria sells tomatoes in the local market, she does this from 6:00 am to 9:00 am. To arrive at the place of sale she travels five kilometers a day on a bus and has been working like this for many years. 
The loan would be used to request a visa to travel to the United States since she has not seen her children for 15 years and her only contact with them has been via telephone.

loans.use: request a visa to travel to the United States

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
This group is called "Antehwe" and consists of women who are driven by a desire to improve the living conditions of their families. They enjoy long experience in their lines of work, and all live in the same area and share strong ties. Their main activities including selling fish, firewood, slippers, sandals, shoes, sauce pans, maize and cassava dough. 

Mrs. Margaret (who is in the middle of the photo) leads this group. She is a very dynamic woman and plays a decisive role in the development of her family. She is 49 years old, married, and mother of three children, all boys. She has a stall at the entrance to the central market where she sells smoked fish, and has extensive experience in this line of work. With this loan, she wants to buy three cartons of fish, fish wood and smoked fish to sell to customers in the market. The profits will allow her to increase her savings, better help her children, and help support her husband.

Members of this group hold each other for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shaziais is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, and nail polish. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Her husband has a job but earns very low income, so she decided to open a beauty parlor at home to earn some additional income and help her husband support their family. She is well-known locally for her bridal makeovers, and is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more cosmetics products. Shazia thanks Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gopal

texts.en:
Gopal, 42, is married. He makes a living by working as a member of the field staff at MESP NGO. His wife is a homemaker, and he has three children; all are studying in school.

He's requesting the loan from the same NGO where he is working to buy cement, sand, and other materials to repair his house because last year his house was destroyed due to heavy rain. He wants to secure his family from natural calamities, for which he needs financial support from Kiva.

His dreams for the future are to give higher education to his children so they can be professionals and work in more secure jobs, and to live comfortably with the family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Leonidas is one of the coordinators of her group, which is called Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) 1, 2 & 3. She is from the city of Hato Mayor, which is one the most rural cities in the country and whose economy is dependent on agriculture. Leonidas is an entrepreneur dedicated to services in her beauty salon. She is a mother of three children who live with her and her long-term partner. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. In her free time, she likes to be at home with her family.

Leonidas is very excited to receive her 12th loan from Esperanza International, after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and, with each one, having taken steps toward growing her business. For about six years, she has had loans with Esperanza and she started with her first Esperanza's loan. She is planning to invest her latest loan in the purchase of a variety of beauty products and other supplies. She plans to reinvest in her business and improve it in the short term to have a sustainable future. She thanks you all for your support.

One of the group member's children is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and other supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has sold a variety of grains for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision fund Kenya  to purchase dry maize, sorghum, green grass, and rice.

She is a 56-year-old married who supports the family with additional income.  She and her husband, Steven, have two children who are 16 and 18 years old.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and provide for her family's basic needs.

Alice hopes to expand her business and be a successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: to add more stock of assorted cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy soñadora, tiene 36 años de edad y vive en Subtanjalla junto a su familia. Es madre soltera de 2 niños de 10 y 6 años. Siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace porque quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde hace más de 1 años trabaja como cocinera en un programa de ayuda a niños pobres y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo, dedicación y amabilidad con todos.
Maria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar ropa para iniciar un pequeño negocio, ya que quiere tener otros ingresos para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Gracias a esto ella seguirá luchando y así más adelante podrá construir su casa propia y espera en un corto plazo cumplir el sueño de toda madre de ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a dreamer who is 36 years old and lives in Subtanjalla with her family. She is the single mother of two children aged 6 and 10 years old. She always makes the effort to do as much as she can as she wants to get ahead with her children. For the last year she has worked as a cook in a program to help needy children and feels that things are going well thanks to her effort, dedication and friendliness to everyone.

Maria is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can buy clothing to start a small business. She wants to have other revenues to be able to improve her family's quality of living. Thanks to this she will continue to struggle and later on be able to construct her own house and she hopes in the short-term like all mothers to see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing to start her business.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es: Claudia de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de pan dulce, desde hace mucho tiempo lo que le ha permitido contar con una muy buena cantidad de clientes que cada día buscan sus productos por la buena calidad de estos y la amabilidad con que son tratados por Claudia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de pan dulce, vendiendo también hortalizas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, cebollas, chile verde, etc para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia  is 24 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two-year-old son. She is an enterprising women who has worked for a long time  selling sweet breads ,which has allowed her  to have a considerable clientele who each day seek out her products because of their good quality and the friendly way they are treated by Claudia.

 She wishes to expand her business selling sweetbreads, by selling vegetables as well, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase tomatoes, onions, green chilies, etc.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions,  green chilis, etc.

loans.name: Verònica

texts.es:
Verónica es madre de una niña de 7 años de edad que está en primer grado de la escuela,su hijo de 4 años; también explica que  tiene siete meses de embarazo, vive en unión libre hace 8 años con el papá de sus hijas, el cual le apoya en todo lo que  desee realizar. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos por catálogo, especialmente zapatos, pero indica que esa empresa ya  cerro; y ella está vendiendo ropa que le lleva una joven, a precios muy cómodos para lograr revender a sus clientas ya establecidas, de igual manera lleva la mercadería hasta el trabajo de las clientas y ellas ahí le compran. Tiene dos años de realizar su actividad comercial, en este tiempo ha logrado crecimiento, aumentando mercado, lo que la lleva a solicitar apoyo económico para comprar suficiente mercadería que ya le solicito su clientela.
Verónica desde su infancia es testigo de la falta de empleo en la zona, por lo que, decide realizar alguna actividad que le genere ingresos al hogar, con más razón aún ahora que va a ser mamá nuevamente. Cuenta con buena clientela de la zona ya que en su mayoría son asalariadas. 
Ella ha demostrado interés y compromiso con el crédito que le brindo Fundación Mujer, presento una correcta moral de pago y crecimiento en la actividad productiva ya que cambio de venta por catálogo a vender ropa para todo público, donde genera mayor ganancia.
Eligió nuevamente a Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y el servicio personalizado que brinda.
texts.en:
Verónica has a seven year old daughter, who is in the first grade, and a four year old son.  She is seven months pregnant.  She has been in a common-law marriage with the father of her children for eight years.  He supports her in everything that she wishes to do.  She previously sold products, especially shoes, by catalog.  However, this business is closed.  

She is now selling clothes that a young woman brings to her and sells at very affordable prices so that she can resell to her already established customers.  She also takes the merchandise to where her customers work, and they buy the clothes there.  She has been engaged in this business activity for two years.  During this time she has managed growth 

The market is increasing, which brings her to request financial support to buy enough of the merchandise that her customers have requested.

Ever since her childhood, Verónica has witnessed the lack of employment in the area.  Therefore, she decided to engage in a business activity that generates income for her household.  This is even more true now that she is going to be a mother again.  She has good clientele in the area because most of them are wage earners.

She has shown interest and commitment to the loan from Fundación Mujer.  She displays proper payment ethics.  She also shows growth in her business activity because she changed from catalog sales to selling clothes to the public, where she generates greater earnings.  She chose the Fundación Mujer again because of the low interest rate and the personalized service that it offers.

loans.use: to buy personal use merchandise that her customers are requesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt that one of her older daughters has and to invest in the educational expenses for her younger children.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en: Faiza is 25 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband owns an electrical workshop where he sells various goods and provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electrical goods.  In order to grow his business and generate maximum profits, he wants to buy more items to sell. Therefore, Faiza has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to provide her husband with the money he needs to do this. He will buy light bulbs, florescent tubes, switches, bulb holders, sockets and various devices to help his customers save energy. Faiza hopes that in the future her husband will be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, etc for her business

loans.name: Ines Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Inés Albertina de 47 años de edad es casada, tiene casa propia en donde vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que dependen de ambos se dedican por más de 15 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanías.

Doña Inés Albertina gracias a su negocio ha podido salir adelante con su familia,  está solicitando el prestamo para la compra productos como tierra, barro, leña, pinturas, etc. para elaborar sus artesanías, espera que esta inversión le permita seguir adelante con su negocio y a su espera obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad vida y la de su familia.

Doña Inés Albertina con las ganancias ha mandado a sus hijos al colegio y algunos ya se le graduaron, su sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener buenos empleos para así  tener mejor condición de vida.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2014.
texts.en:
Ines is 47 years old and is married. She has her own home, where she lives with her spouse and their three children who depend on her. For more than 15 years, she has made a living at her business, which consists of making and selling handicrafts. 

Ines is grateful that her business has allowed her family to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to buy products like clay, mud, wood, paint, etc. to create her handicrafts. She hopes that this loan will allow her to continue getting ahead in her business, and she hopes to obtain the necessary income to better the quality of life of her and her family.

With her profits, Ines has sent her children to school and some of them have already graduated. Her dream is for her children to have good careers and a better condition of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -- August 2014

loans.use: to buy clay, mud, wood, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es:
Reyna, es casada, actualmente vive con sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 10 años de edad; se dedica a vender tamales de elotes, el oficio lo aprendió de su mamá desde que tenía 10 años de edad, actualmente tiene su propio negocio que funciona desde hace 37 años, de esta manera ella puede tener ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de tres de la tarde a siete de la noche, según sea la demanda.
Se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito para comprar elotes, aceite, leña y bolsas, así tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta, espera mejorar su situación económica para cancelar sus deudas y seguir aportando para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Su visión es mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio para lograr trabajar con capital propio y dar un estilo de vida más digno  a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and currently lives with her three children ages 18, 16 and 10. She sells sweet corn tamales, a trade she learned from her mother since she was 10 years old. She currently has her own business that has been running for 37 years. This is how she is able to secure enough income to cover the basic necessities of her family. Her work schedule is from 3:00pm to 7:00pm depending on the demand. 
She has decided to request a loan to purchase sweet corn, oil, firewood and bags to have the raw materials to make her sales. She hopes to improve her economic situation in order to pay off her debts and continue covering her home's expenses. Her vision is to improve the profitability of her business in order to be able to work with her own capital and be able to give her family a more dignified style of life.

loans.use: purchase sweet corn, oil, firewood and bags to have the raw materials needed to make her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his institute tuition fees and buy supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan un agricultor de 34 años de edad que todos los días tiene el privilegio de trabajar en un hermoso campo donde tiene una vista envidiable y tan espectacular que hace amar cada día más  la naturaleza.

Trabaja desde muy joven en el campo y es en este donde tiene su familia conformada por dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad y su pareja. 

Como agricultor tiene un gran problema y es el alto costo de los insumos agrícolas como lo son fertilizantes, abonos, fumigantes etc. 

Ante dicho problema Juan quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de fumigantes para cavar plaga de insectos y alejar algunos roedores que dañan sus cultivos ya que no tiene capital para sustentar tantos insumos que requieren para tener su campo en excelentes condiciones 

Juan distribuye agucates y su pricnicpal sueño es expandir sus cultivos que un día despierte y vea la majestuosidad de sus campos rodeado de belleza y abundantes cultivos con los cuales podra mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is a 34 year old farmer who has the privilege of working every day in a beautiful field where he has an enviable view, so spectacular that it makes him love nature more every day. He works in the fields since he was very young, and here he has a family formed by two children, ages 8 and 7 and his domestic partner. As a farmer he has a problem and that is the high cost of agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, fumigants, etc. Faced with this problem, Juan wants to request a loan to buy fumigants to finish with the insect plague and keep away some rodents who damage his crops, because he does not have the capital to pay for the inputs needed to have the field in excellent condition. Juan distributes avocados, and his main dream is to expand his crops so that he will wake up one day and see the majesty of his fields surrounded by beauty and by abundant crops with which he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fumigants in order to finish with the insect plague and keep rodents away.

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
Luz de 28 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, de dos y cuatro años. Es  originaria  de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.  Esta joven mujer lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de gaseosas en su casa de habitación, y de forma ambulante. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus  productos.  Como   es la gaseosas de diferentes sabores. Su rutina de trabajo es levantarse a las  5: 00am para preparar su termo con gaseosas de diferentes sabores  y todos los días tiene que cargar un peso de unos 30 kg, para poder  vender su producto.  Agradece tener ese trabajo porque es el medio que le ayuda a salir adelante con sus hijos.  Luz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
28-year-old Luz is a single mother. She has two young children, aged two and four. She is originally from Achuapa, which is located in the northern area of the region. She is hard-working and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to pursue a degree and she was obliged to work from an early age. This young woman fights day after day to offer her children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she sells soft drinks for a living from home and on the streets. She dedicates around eight hours a day to her business, selling the different flavours of soft drink on offer. Her work routine is to get up at 5:00am to prepare different flavours of soft drink to put in her thermos, and every day she has to carry a weight of about 30kg in order to be able to sell her product. She is grateful to have this work because it is her means of getting ahead in life with her children. Luz is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources, and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in different flavours of soft drink

loans.name: Jisu Khrist Shg Group

texts.en:
Surenjina is 22 years old, married and has one child. She lives in the Koraput district of Odisha, India. Surenjina is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. 

She has a business growing vegetables and paddy rice and selling them in a market of Koraput district of Odisha, India. She has already had this business for five years, and it is going very well. At this time, Surenjina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. 

This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group together. The members of the group have selected Surenjina as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand is Surenjina. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

Jisu Khrist Group members are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin con 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 10 años, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comprar y vender cerdos, pues los obtiene, los cría, engorda y al momento de la venderlos los ofrece a un precio un poco más alto, de acuerdo al peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones para engordarlos y venderlos, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Elkin espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elkin, who is 22 years old, lives in a civil union with his wife. During his productive life he has performed varying activities independently, through which he has been able to generate incomes to sustain his family. 
10 years ago he began to buy and sell pigs, obtaining them, raising them, fattening them and at the time of sale charging a higher price according to the weight acquired by the animal. This has permitted him to obtain the resources to continue taking care of and sustaining his children.
Elkin is a hard working, thriving man, who does his best every day to get ahead, motivated by his family. This pushed him to request the credit, to invest it in the purchase of pigs and piglets to fatten and sell. This will allow him to have availability enough to fulfill orders and improve his utility margin and incomes. 
In this manner, Elkin hopes to advance one step closer towards the fulfillment of his principal dream. He hopes to formalize his business and start a small meat store that is profitable and long-lasting and be able to establish economic stability to provide his children the opportunity for a better education and good living conditions.

loans.use: purchase pigs and piglets for raising in order to boost his business to provide for his children

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Desde el año 2000  Ramon empezó a trabajar con un amigo y aprendió el oficio de reciclaje. El diariamente, desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde,  se dirige casa a casa en el municipio donde habita, para compra  a cada familia la llamada chatarra, que consiste en pedazos  de hierro,  aluminio, bronce, aparatos eléctricos  etc. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas para en un futuro mejorar su vivienda, su gran desafío es posicionarse, pues su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer compras mayores y aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por  la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en general chatarrería, electrodomésticos, hierro, aluminio, bronce, con esta inversión logrará tener un fondo de efectivo adicional para incrementar sus compras y vender mucho mas.
texts.en: From the year 2000, Ramon has been working with a friend and learned the craft of recycling. He works daily from 8 am to 4 pm. He goes from house to house in the municipality where he lives. From each family he buys scrap pieces consisting of iron, aluminum, bronze, appliances, and more. His goal is to increase sales in the future to improve his home. His challenge is his current position because he does not have sufficient capital to make purchases and increase revenue. This is the reason he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy general scrap, appliances, iron, aluminum, bronze, and more with this investment he will have extra capital to increase his purchases and sell more.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals to sell

loans.name: Maruti Shg Group

texts.en:
Subhadra, a citizen from a rural village located in the Koraput district, is age 27 years, married, and has three children; all of them are dependent on her and still in school. For the last four years, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables. Her husband supplements their income by working as a laborer. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month and save 2,000 INR per month for future needs. 

Subhadra is a member of Peoples Forum, which has enabled her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland, and also use some of it to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos hijos, y su negocio es la artesanía en yeso.
Ella es emprendedora, Alegre, optimista, feliz, espontánea, de buena actitud, comprometida, auténtica, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en ‘Colcapirhua’ que es una pequeña ciudad, quinto municipio de la provincia de Quillacollo, tiene una altitud de 2.565 metros sobre el nivel del mar, está ubicada aproximadamente a nueve kilometros de la ciudad de Cochabamba y la carretera principal que una a ambas es por la avenida blanco galindo. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella formó una banca de personas con afinidades similares para solicitar un préstamo.

Sandra es de tez morena, cabello largo castaño claro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el quechua el cual utiliza con la gente del lugar, para el comercio es más común el español (al fondo con blusa negra). Su negocio es la fabricación de esculturas en yeso. Para tal necesita un molde (también lo fabrica), al cual le dá una mano de aceite y luego lo llena con yeso, espera entre 20 y 30 minutos para desmoldarlo, le retira los excesos que queden en el borde y lo deja secar durante 1 o 2 días, luego la lija si es necesario y finalmente la pinta. Estas artesanías son vendidas en ferias en forma de alcancías, adornos, ceniceros, etc. 

Ella sueña con ser dueña de una tienda y un negocio grande para mejorar su calidad de vida. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y producción realizando la compra de materiales de trabajo como; un estante (donde dejar el yeso hasta que seque), pinturas, moldes, yeso, aceite, etc.
Es por esos motivos que Sandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo con yeso y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old, and she is a single mother of two children. She has a plaster crafts business.

She is enterprising, cheerful, optimistic, happy, and spontaneous. She has a good attitude, and she is dedicated, authentic, generous, kind, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in Colcapirhua, which is a small city in the fifth municipal section of the Quillacollo Province, at an elevation of 2,565 meters above sea level.  It is located approximately nine kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. The two cities are connected by a main highway called the Avenida Blanco Galindo. 

Out of a need to improve her family’s quality of life, she formed a banking group of like minded people in order to request a loan.  

Sandra has tan skin and long, light brown hair, and she is of medium height.  Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she uses with local people, and for business Spanish is more common. (She is in the back, wearing a black blouse). 

Her business is creating plaster sculptures. For this, she needs a mold (she makes this also), which she coats with oil, and later fills with plaster.  She waits between 20 and 30 minutes in order to remove the mold and any excess that may be remaining on the edge. She leaves it to dry for one or two days, and then sands it, if necessary. Finally, she paints it. These hand-crafted forms, such as piggy-banks, ornaments, ashtrays, etc., are sold at fairs.

She dreams of being the owner of a store and a large business, in order to improve her quality of life.  She wants to increase her working capital and production, purchasing working materials such as a rack for drying the plaster, paint, molds, plaster, oil, etc.

These are the reasons that Sandra is requesting a loan: to purchase tools for working with plaster, and to improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tools for working with plaster, and to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour to make more soft drinks.

loans.name: Famida

texts.en:
Famida appreciates the previous loan that helped her to expand her poultry selling business.

In addition Famida operates a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours to supplement her income. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac appreciates for the previous loan that helped him expand his business.

Isaac  operates a boda boda(motorcycle) transport business, where his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season it becomes hard to operate. His dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to service his  motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. He decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellín desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales y chorizos.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector donde vive y en donde inicio este negocio con la necesidad de sostener a su familia.
Silvia desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ingredientes para sus preparaciones y recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a humble and hard-working woman who has dedicated a large part of her life taking care of her children. She lives in the municipality of Medellín where she performs spectacularly in the kitchen. Her business is the preparation of custom made meals such as tamales and chorizos. She sells these foods principally to her neighbors in the area where she lives. She started the business because of the need to support her family. 
Silvia wants to increase her sales of foods and wants to work in a more comfortable manner. So she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials like ingredients to prepare her food and recipes. This loan will allow her to progress with her business to obtain the revenue she needs to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making tamales and chorizos.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Minati is a divorced lady, age 48, who lives with her son. She is the only source of income for her family, and her son still is in college. She sells bangles, nail polish, gold-plated jewelry items, clips, hair accessories, beads, etc. in her ladies’ novelty store. She has been in the business of selling cosmetics and jewelry for the past eight years. 

She is applying for a loan to buy more jewelry and beauty products, such as make-up, lipsticks, and creams, in order to improve and enrich the business through the availability of more variety of products to meet customer demand. This loan will help to improve her sales and enable her to offer a new product line to her customers. Her objective is to expand the business and include new products such as clothing in her existing business, and save enough for her family's future with the increased revenues from the increased sales supported by the variety of products.

The other members of the Maa Durga Self-help Group are engaged in different business activities, and all are eager to increase their business. They are very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase gold-plated jewelry and beauty products for her ladies' novelty store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell milk that will pay for his 3 children´s education.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan appreciates the previous loan that helped him expand his business.

He has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 10,000 he wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es:
Álvaro de 38 años de edad, padre soltero con un hijo menor de edad es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, de condición muy humilde. Pero con gran animo de superación para poder sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación,  el dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es compra un lote de cerdos y vitaminas, concentrados, desparasitantés para cerdos. Para que un fututo no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Álvaro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 38 years old, a single father with a young son. He is originally from the northern region of Sauce. He is described as being hard-working, responsible, and very humble. He has a great desire to be successful and help his young son have a successful life. Thanks to his efforts and desired to succeed he has a business raising and selling pigs. The business is located at his home, and he works eight hours per day.

The loan will be used to buy a batch of pigs as well as vitamins, concentrates and dewormer for the pigs. In the near future he will be able to obtain increased income. Álvaro is thankful for the Kiva investors' support that is provided to people of few resources like him and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have a way to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy pigs as well as vitamins, concentrates and dewormer for the pigs.

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Damaris de 39 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad los cuales están estudiado, es originaria de Malpisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Por falta de empleos formales en las empresas. Esta mujer se inicio con una pequeña venta de mercadería en general en el comercio informal, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de superación, su tenacidad, disciplina y perseverancia ha podido Salir adelante con su negocio.
En la actualidad lucha día a día para mantener surtido su negocio y aumentar de dicha forma su clienta y a la vez cumplir sus objetivos y metas propuesta  como es brindarles a sus hijos la educación que se merecen y poder terminar su casa de habitación.  El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  el objetivo del crédito es compra mercadería como: pantalones, short, blusas, vestidos, jeans, ropa interior, sandalias, ropa de niño. Damaris agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Damaris is 39 years old, single, with two small children in his care who are in school. He is originally from the northern area of Malpisillo. Because of a lack of available jobs, Damaris began a small business informally selling general merchandise. Thanks to her hard work and will to succeed, her tenacity, discipline and perseverance she has been able to make her business successful.

Today she fights every day to maintain her business stocked and increase her customers while meeting the goal of providing an education to her children, which is something they deserve. She also wants to be able to finish a bedroom in her home. The business is located in her home. She works ten hours every day, offering her products, so that in the near future they will have greater income.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, blouses, dresses, jeans, underwear, sandals and children's clothing. Damaris is thankful for the help provided by Kiva investors. This help assists those of few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a way to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, blouses, dresses, jeans, underwear, sandals and children's clothing.

loans.name: Emerenzania

texts.en:
Emerenzania, who is in her late 30s, is married with one son who is still at school.  She has been running a retail shop for ten years now .She works from 6:45am to 10pm daily and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Emerenzania's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase short stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her retail shop. She dreams of owning a wholesale business, selling soft drinks. 

Emerenzania will hold herself responsible for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her retail shop

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, a 54-year-old mother of five, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is retired, while Jamila sews wallets along with her two daughters and two sons at home to generate income for the entire family. She has two sewing machines operated by her daughters, and her sons deal with customers, take orders, and sew wallets to order.

To maximize profits, Jamila wants to sell her wallets directly in the market, but she does not have sufficient capital to buy the required raw materials. She has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan to buy materials such as Rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. Jamila thanks Kiva and Brac Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy Rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. for sewing purses and wallets.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: Isidora de 46 años casada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Este es el grupo “Los Capullitos” conformada por 10 socias responsables y trabajadoras. Isidora se dedica a la se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Así mismo como actividad secundaria alquila habitaciones. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de polos, camisas, shorts y pantalones. Tiene planeado ampliar su local para incrementar el volumen de prendas de vestir. El grupo “Los Capullitos” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Isidora se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en: Isidora is 46 years old, married, with one child. She is a member of the "Los Capullitos" group which consists of 10 responsible and hard-working members. Isidora sells clothing through orders placed. She also has a second income from renting rooms. The loan will be used to buy shirts, shorts and pants. She plans to expand her locale to increase the volume of clothing. The "Los Capullitos" group is thankful to the people who made this loan possible. Isidora is the first person seated on the left side, wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts and pants.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama, who is in her mid-50s, is single with two grown children. She stays with three of her grandchildren who are going to school. She has been running a business of selling soft drinks at wholesale prices.  She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Salama's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell charcoal, and then started selling water at wholesale prices.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support.  She used her profits to pay school fees for her grandchildren; to build her house; to buy a TV set, deck, sofa set and cupboard; and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy drinks to sell at wholesale prices.  She dreams of expanding her soft-drink business.

Salama will take care of her loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mlandizi Kati Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her early 40's, is married and has five children, three of whom are grown-ups and two who are still at school. She has been buying and selling goats at the market place for two years now.  She goes to the buying place at 6am and comes back the following day.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request to be apportioned among Mlandizi Kati, thirteen members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will use this loan to to buy more goats to sell at the goat-selling market place. Her desire is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell at the goat-selling market place.

loans.name: Bamba Group

texts.en:
Phillip is in his late fifties and is married with four children. Three of his children are in school and another is grown. Two years ago, Phillip was employed as a civil servant, working in a medical institution. For the sake of managing his family better after retirement, Phillip opened a pharmacy where he sells human medicines, a business he has been with for nine months. He works from 08:00AM to 09:00PM daily and is able to realize a good profit each month.

This is his first credit request via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He will share this loan with his loan group "BAMBA," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Phillip will use this loan to replenish his pharmacy with more medicines. He desires for his medical shop to grow.

loans.use: to replenish his pharmacy with more medicines

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She operates a restaurant at the market. She serves all kinds of people in her restaurant. She has been in this business for the last five years. She takes care of additional family members. 

Regina works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, and beans. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of building a residential house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, beans, flour and green bananas

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 64-year-old man married to Kavuli who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. John has been a farmer for twelve years earning an income of 3,000 KES at the end of every month.

John was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of 7,899 KES and intends to use this amount to buy a solar lamp which will be of great value to his homestead and the children will be able to read at night without any challenge.

John hopes to provide the best education to his children and become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex used his previous loan to buy a tea plantation. 

He is still in the tea business and also sells fresh milk. He faces the challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. Also, he hopes to improve his daily income by renting more tea plantations to supplement his during the peak season. 

Alex needs a loan to rent a tea plantation.

loans.use: to rent a tea plantation.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport and retail plus farming. He faces the challenge of weather changes. In spite of that, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Christopher needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe is 25 years old, single and a hard working lady. For the past four years, she has been operating a retail shop selling a variety of both retail and household goods. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.
	 
She has applied for a second loan of 10,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to buy one good quality digital camera for better and clear photos.                                                                                           

Pheobe will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the shop like sugar, salt, bales of wheat flour and washing detergents.

loans.name: Saadia Bibi

texts.en:
Saadia is 27 years old, married, and blessed with a daughter. Her husband is a shuttering worker. He has been doing this for many years now. He uses wooden boards and metal plates supported by rods and stakes to create molds. The molds hold the concrete in place as it sets, thereby creating a solid, smooth structure. 

Her husband wants to provide a better service to his clients in construction work. This is why he wants to buy materials to improve his work. This way, he will have more work and therefore a higher income, which will improve his family's quality of life.

Her husband wants to provide his family a quality life and wants to give higher education to their daughter. They are thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy boards, rods, plates, etc. for shuttering purposes.

loans.name: Sele

texts.en: Sele used the previous loan to buy cross breed cows for resale. He is still in the same business, alongside selling milk and bananas for extra income. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and limited workers. Besides that, he dreams of becoming a model farmer. Sele needs a loan to buy ground nut (peanut) seeds and beans and pay workers for planting those crops.

loans.use: to buy ground nut (peanut) seeds and beans and pay workers for planting those crops.

loans.name: Silver Stephen

texts.en: Silver Stephen is a 52-year-old married man with seven children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a salary earner and also sells milk, which has enabled him to earn a lot of income. He faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes and competition, as there are many people selling milk. He has a dream of having a very good retirement package. Silver Stephen needs a loan to buy construction materials like timber and iron sheets to finish constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like timber and iron sheets.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, Alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad Calasaya que es una comunidad indígena, según la historia de los pobladores adoptó este nombre porque, por el lugar existía una carretera, donde transitaban los viajeros y mercaderes con carrozas de Caballo del lado Peruano para trasladarse a la ciudad de La Paz, justo al lugar adyacente de la carretera estaba una piedra situada verticalmente, donde los viajeros siempre descansaban, aquellos que hacían largos viajes decían en lengua aymara; KALA SAIKY UKARU SAMARAÑANI, traducido en castellano quiere decir "Descansemos donde aquella piedra está situada verticalmente", entonces se le fue conociendo como QALASAYA en lengua aymara, y en Castellano Calasaya, está ubicada al sur del lago Titicaca a 57 km hacia el norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Rosalia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura mediana, su vestimenta es típica (manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio en la ciudad. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal. El proceso que sigue es sencillo pero largo, antes de iniciar la fabricación del queso, con leche recién ordeñada, calienta la leche para eliminar microbios patógenos presentes en  la leche, corta la masa cuajada y la separa del suero, saca los cubos, los escurre  y los coloca en un molde, la sal es importante tanto para el sabor, como para la conservación y la formación de la cascara. La maduración es la última fase, ésta puede durar desde algunas horas hasta varios meses.
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella desea incrementar su producción realizando la compra de ganado lechero para generar mejores ingresos económicos y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Rosalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 30 years old, single, and the mother of two children. Her business is the production of artisanal cheese. She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, joyful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, and is committed, generous, friendly, responsible and very hard working. 

She works in the Calasaya community, which is an indigenous community. The story goes that the settlers gave it this name because a road went through the area on which travelers and merchants traveled in horse drawn carriages from the Peruvian side on their way to the city of La Paz. Directly adjacent to the road was a tall rock where the travelers always rested. Those that made long trips said in the Aymara language "KALA SAIKY UKARU SAMARAÑANI". translated to Spanish it means "We rest where the tall rock is." Therefore, it was known as QALASAYA in the Aymara language, and in Spanish, Calasaya. It is located south of Lake Titicaca, 57 km north of La Paz.

Rosalia has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, is of medium stature and her clothing is traditional (Peruvian manta and skirt). Her native language is Aymara and she uses Spanish for business in the city. Her business is the production of artisanal cheese. The process she uses is simple but long. Before beginning to make the cheese, using recently ordered milk, she heats the milk to eliminate pathogenic micro-organisms present in the milk. She cuts the curds and separates them from the whey, takes out the cubes, rinses them and puts them in a pan. Salt is important both for the flavor and for the preservation and the formation of the rind. The maturation is the final phase which can last from a few hours up to several months.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life. She would like to increase her production by buying dairy cows in order to generate better economic returns and give her children a better future. It is for these reasons that Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy dairy cows and to improve her family's quality of life with the benefits.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and use the benefits  to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima de 45 años de edad, casado con dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, en secundaria, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Esta mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar,  en la actualidad ella lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, aceite, huevos, jugos, gaseosas, la rutina de trabajo es de unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es surtir su pulpería, para mantener el cliente y aumenta sus ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano.  Fátima agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fatima is 45 years old, married and has two children in secondary school. She is from El Sauce in the northern zone of the region. 

She is a hard-working, responsible woman desiring to succeed. She was unfortunately unable to study due to lack of financial resources. Currently she strives every day to offer her children a better future.

Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead she owns a pulpería or small store where she sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, soaps, oil, eggs, juices and soft drinks. Her work routine is about ten hours per day offering her products for sale from her home.

The loan is to stock her business in order to keep her customers and increase earnings in the near future.

Fatima is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support offered to people of limited resources and from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they may make a living through decent work.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, soap, oil, eggs, juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She has been doing a tailoring business at home for many years with the help of her daughters. She wants to buy two additional sewing machines for her daughters, but she does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan for her tailoring business so that she can easily buy sewing machines for her daughters. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for her daughters.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is age 38, the mother of five children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Rehana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with three children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells fish at the market, and she has been in this business for 4 years. Annet has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more fish. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the perishability of fish. She aspires to buy a fridge to keep the fish fresh. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is age 41. She is living with her five children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker he can easily reach near to the people. The people like to buy vegetables at their doors instead of moving to the market. Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for vegetables has increased, and around noon his stock comes to an end.

Irshad feels proud for her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her husband so that can buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profit so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (B) Group

texts.en:
Sushila, the lady standing with her raised hand and wearing a sky-colour saree, is a 35-year-old lady who lives with her parents, husband and two children. She is engaged in the activity of tailoring, and has one sewing machine by which she stitches ladies’ dresses, blouses, and frocks, and dresses for kids. From this business, she earns 8,500 INR per month, which is not enough for her family. She started this business eight years ago to help her husband in managing the family's monthly cash flow. 

Sushila has a plan to grow her business and do this activity on a large scale so that she can render her services to the maximum number of customers. She wants to purchase two new sewing machines and some fabrics for her shop. 

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion for purchasing two more sewing machines to meet her customers’ demand and make them highly satisfied. She also wants to hire some workforce to help her in the business. 

Sushila hopes to provide a better education and study materials to her children and take good care of her family. She has a dream to live a happy life with her family members by fulfilling the family members’ requirements.

loans.use: to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mayuge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Safia has been working hard to manage her soft drinks business, in which she sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Safia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks, and will help Safia to generate greater profits and boost the business. Safia hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her standard of living. 

Safia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Ana Josefina

texts.es: Ana es una joven estudiante de contabilidad y a la vez trabaja en el área de rentas y recaudación y control. Ella se encuentra en el cuarto año de su carrera. Solo le faltan dos ciclos para concluir su carrera profesional. Ella se dedica 04 horas diarias  y el domingo todo el día a sus estudios. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de sus pensiones y libros contables. Su mayor deseo es terminar su carrera profesional. Ella gradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado
texts.en: Ana is a young accounting student who at the same time works in the rent, collections and control sector. She is in the fourth year of her studies. She just needs two cycles to complete her education. She works at her studies for 4 hours each day and all day on Sunday. The loan will be invested in paying her tuition and books. She is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the loan they offer.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and books.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 38-year-old divorced mother of two children. Thirteen years ago, she started making handicrafts and decorating wedding lounges to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved children.

Today, Hala is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary handicraft tools that will help her provide her customers with a more diversified and beautiful handicrafts collection. Hala is a talented woman who succeeded with her hard work to gain more customers. She always hopes to have a big exhibition to show people her beautiful decorations and arts.

loans.use: To buy necessary handicraft tools to help provide her customers with a more diversified and beautiful handicrafts collection.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, aged, 45, is a responsible mother who lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC and first with Kiva. Azra's son owns a scrap shop dealing in scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling them to the recycling factories. Due to household expenses, he presently does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Azra has requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. Azra is very impressed with this honorable support and wishes to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for reselling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 55 years old and lives in the town of Bugemba in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with none of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of produce and will help Jane to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to increase profits. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy sacks of produce

loans.name: Florence K

texts.en:
Florence K is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugemba in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Florence K has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence K has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes which will help Florence K to generate greater profits to set up another branch. Florence K hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger shop. 

Florence K is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence K who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 54-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children; now they have grown old and they have needs as well. 

Her son has a business of providing the transport of goods such as sand, pebbles, concrete, cement, and soil from one place to another. He has been doing this work for many years and generating a reasonable income for his family. Nowadays his manual trolley has broken due to overloading and unpaved paths. He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to fix the trolley. Due to this reason, he is unable to continue his services and his earnings are zero. 

Therefore, Azra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; her son will use this amount for buying a manual trolley so he can start his services again. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a manual trolley for loading and unloading goods.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Nueva Esperanza” conformada por 06 socios entusiastas y responsables. Angélica  de 44 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como Azúcar. Hace más de 06 años que viene desempeñándose y ha logrado crecer en su negocio. Tiene el anhelo de poner un nuevo puesto de especerías. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de harina, arroz, azúcar y fideos. El grupo  “Nueva Esperanza” está agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Angélica se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa rosado.
texts.en:
This is the "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] group. It consists of six enthusiastic and responsible members.

Angelica is 44 years old, married, and has three dependent children. She makes a living selling groceries such as sugar. She has been working in this field for over six years and has managed to grow her business. Her greatest wish is to set up a new spice stall. She requested a loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, and noodles. 

The "Nueva Esperanza" group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. 

In the picture, Angelica is standing at the back; she is the first from the right and is wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Rehmat is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of two daughters and three sons. She and her daughters have been doing embroidery at home for many years to support the family. In fact, Rehmat's husband suffers from fevers most of the time and is unable to work. For the sake of the family and to meet household expenses, Rehmat started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with all the raw materials for embroidery. She then completes her tasks, along with her daughters, over a wooden frame. 

Rehmat wants to sells her embroidery directly in the market so that she can generate more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy her own raw materials so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown. Rehmat has requested a loan to buy raw materials so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell and can generate maximum income. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages. He also brings some material home for Salma, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. For this purpose he requires some capital to buy desired inventories, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Salma made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Evelyn Fabiola

texts.es:
Evelin es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor.
Ella es emprendedora, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de Pampahasi, un sitio que se caracteriza por la leyenda de la existencia de una enorme piedra en el patio de la casa de una vecina, la roca era denominada ‘abuela’ debido a su enorme tamaño y su antigüedad en el lugar. La piedra llamaba particularmente la atención de los niños del lugar, quienes a diario acudían a donde ella estaba para jugar, el primer intento de deshacerse de aquella roca fue vano, vecinos la lanzaron por la quebrada y al día siguiente apareció en el mismo lugar,  una vecina se encargó de challarla con mixtura y alcohol, luego de este ritual, la piedra fue lanzada nuevamente al barranco del río Luquichapiy, después de dos días, la enorme roca desapareció. Ella vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos en un departamento alquilado.
Evelin es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor, ‘La ventaja de este tipo de venta es que se recupera la inversión y se obtienen utilidades en muy poco tiempo, aunque la cantidad monetaria de utilidad sea menor, se obtiene a cambio mayor liquidez’ comenta Evelin. El negocio se lo enseño su madre, ahora ella trabaja de forma independiente.
Su sueño es comprar una casa. Ella desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos realizando la compra de abarrotes en general por mayor y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Evelin solicita un préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Evelin, age 23, is single and has two children.  Her business is selling basic needs food wholesale.

She is enterprising, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, happy, responsible, and a very hard-worker.  

She works in the Pampahasi area, a place that is known for the legend of an enormous rock on the patio of a neighbor’s house.  The rock was named ‘grandmother’ because of its enormous size and its antiquity in the place.  The rock especially got the attention of the children in the area.  They went daily to the place where the rock was to play.  The first intent to get rid of this rock was in vain.  The neighbors threw it in the gully, and the next day it appeared in the same place.  A neighbor took charge of spraying it with a mixture and alcohol.  After this ritual, the rock was again thrown down a gully by the Luquichapiy River.  After two days, the enormous rock disappeared.

She lives with her parents and her two children in a rented apartment.

Evelin has a dark complexion and long, black hair.  She is average height.  Her maternal language is Spanish, and she knows Aymara.

Her business is selling wholesale basic foods.  “The advantage of this type of sale is that you recover the investment and get profits in a very short time. Even though the profit is small, you get greater liquidity in return,” says Evelin.  Her mother taught her the business.  She now works in an independent manner.

Her dream is to buy a house.  She wishes to improve her income by purchasing general groceries wholesale and increasing her working capital.

These are the reasons that Evelin is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and to use the profits to pay her two children’s expenses.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Tulabati is a 37-year-old widowed woman and responsible mother of a son. She is living with her son in Koraput district of Odisha, India. Tulabati has been involved in sewing for the last six years. When she was 31 years old, she decided to share her husband’s burden, earn, and be independent. So, she took training in tailoring, and from then on she has been engaged in tailoring. Now, she has all the responsibility for her son. Her son is in school. She currently has two sewing machines, which she uses to stitch salwar suits (traditional Indian dresses). 

Tulabati, along with her group, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR through People’s Forum.
