She will use her portion to purchase thread, fabrics, needles, and another sewing machine (picot sewing machine) that will help her do picot stitching for sarees (a special stitch for saree edges) and stitch saree blouses. Tulabati also plans to buy some cloth and make dresses to sell. 

She says the gain from her business will help her to strengthen her family financially and help her to be more independent. She hopes to be able to train some girls in her village and hire them for help by buying more sewing machines and growing her business, creating a living for other girls in the village. 

The other group members are engaged in different activities such as milk selling, daily laborer, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics, needles, and a sewing machine for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 54 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children with none of them currently in school. For the past 30 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which operates a clinic.

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy drugs and medicines helping Justine to generate greater profits and increase her income. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another clinic. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy drugs and medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more fish

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Ronnie has been working hard to manage his butcher business, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Ronnie has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy meat and will help Ronnie to generate greater profits and improve on his business. Ronnie hopes that in the future he will be able to own a factory. 

Ronnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Sayida

texts.en:
Sayida is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Sayida has been working hard to manage his food stall, which sells bananas. 

To help expand his business, Sayida has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of bananas and will help Sayida to generate greater profits and expand on his business. Sayida hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Sayida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sayida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Marina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marina de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos ya mayores de edad y una joven de 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que con su empeño de apoyar económicamente a su esposo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años de forma ambulante, su esposo es albañil y es gracias a ello que sostiene la economía familiar. Marina desea surtir su venta de ropa para atraer a más clientes, ya que su mercadería es poca aunque su venta es buena y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc.
texts.en: Marina, 42, lives in her own home with her husband and their adult children and a younger child who is 17  years old.  She is an enterprising woman who, with her efforts, financially supports her husband to improve the quality of life of their household.  She has had a business selling clothing in an itinerant manner for 3 years.  Her husband works in construction, and thanks to this he supports the household.  Marina wants to stock her business with clothing to attract more customers, because she has very little merchandise although her sales are good.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, skirts, blouses, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: El grupo “TAYTA CRUZ DE MURUHUAY” está conformada por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Erika tiene 29 años de edad es soltera con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Años atrás trabajaba en un restaurant como mesera. En sus tiempo libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. El crédito lo invertirá en implementar mejor su negocio comprar sillas y mesas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Erika es la que se encuentra sentada cargado a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay group is comprised of members who are devoted to the retail trade.  Erika, age 29, is single and has one dependent child.  She sells food.  Years ago she worked as a waitress in a restaurant.  In her free time she sells beauty products.

She will use the loan to better establish her business by purchasing tables and chairs.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  

Erika is the one that is seated with her son.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Liz

texts.en: Liz is married with four children. She has no additional family members. She is a tailor. She has been tailoring for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials for making clothes. She operates on a retail basis from home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include defaulters and limited capital that has hindered her expansion. She is aspiring to buy an electric sewing machine to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Fardous

texts.en:
Fardous is a 44-year-old woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Fardous has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Fardous hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. 

Fardous is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Slowly, her customer base is expanding and her income is rising. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of products for the parlor. For this reason she has requested for a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products etc. in large quantities. She expects a boost in her net income and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, mayor de edad acompañada con dos hijos los cuales ambos son mayores de edad y están casados, de origen chinandegana, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo y sus hermosas playas,es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una hermosa pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles,aceite, pan, galletas simples, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos, embutidos, pollo, queso, cuajadas, bananos verdes, golosinas, pamperes, shampoo,leche en polvo, sobres de café, de sopas maggi, sopas marucha, leña, tomates, cebollas, plátanos maduros, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias, rasuradora para afeitar, salsas de tomates, inglesas, mostaza, ajo, harina, refrescos naturales, al igual que ropa, entre otros mas, sus compras son al contado en mercados, distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y en algunas ocasiones al crédito tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios viendo la necesidad de salir adelante ya que quedo sola con sus dos hijos y sin ayuda de nadie ella decide iniciar este negocio con fondos productos de su trabajo anterior con una pequeña truchita(negocio pequeño mini-pulperia), pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a buena atención y variedades de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano desde las 5:30 am hasta las 10:30 pm, hoy en día esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir aun mas su pulperia con nuevos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes como: arroz, azúcar, golosinas, productos congelados, leña, detergentes, entre otros mas.
texts.en:
Lucia has a partner and two children who are both married adults. She is from Chinandega in the western part of the country, an area where commerce, tourism, and beautiful beaches abound.

She is a micro-entrepreneur, owner and manager of her nice small store where she sells groceries such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, crackers, detergents, soft drinks, juices, cold meats, chicken, cheese, milk curd, green bananas, snacks, pampers, shampoo, powdered milk, instant coffee packets, Maggi and Maruchan instant soups, firewood, tomatoes, onions, plantains, toilet paper, sanitary pads, shaving razors, tomato sauce, worcestershire sauce, mustard, garlic, flour, beverages, as well as clothing and other items.

She makes cash purchases from the local markets, distributors and delivery trucks. She makes cash sales and occasionally extends credit. She has a steady customer base as well as potential customers.

She started the business with her own funds when she saw the need to get ahead after being left alone with her two children. With no other help, she took funds from her previous work and set up a mini store which has been growing little by little thanks to good customer care and to the assortment of products available for sale. She begins work very early at 5:30am and until 10:30pm every day.

Nowadays she requests a loan to invest in working capital and further increase the range of products with new items such as rice, sugar, snacks, frozen foods, firewood and detergents among others.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and purchase groceries such as basic grains, frozen foods, detergents, soft dinks and juices among other items.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos 3 ya mayores de edad y una hija de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su buena visión para los negocios ha logrado mantener por mucho tiempo la tienda de productos varios, de la que ella es propietaria. Rosa desea ampliar su negocio diversificando los productos que ofrece en su tienda, invirtiendo en diversos productos con los que ya cuenta y otros que no ha logrado comprar por falta de financiamiento, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, bebidas frías, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, café, sachets de champú, etc.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 48 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own home along with her four children, of whom three are already adults and one daughter is 13 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who thanks to her good understanding of business has managed to maintain a store where she is the proprietor for a long time. She sells a variety of products. Rosa wants to expand her business, diversifying the products that she offers in her store by investing in various products, some of which she already has and others that she has not managed to buy due to the lack of financing. For this reason she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in candies, cold beverages, rice, beans, sugar, sweet breads, coffee, packets of shampoo, etc.

loans.use: to invest in candies, cold beverages, rice, beans, sugar, sweet breads, coffee, packets of shampoo, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Nicole Katherine

texts.es:
Nicole es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y trabaja vendiendo ropa para bebe en una galería comercial.
Ella es emprendedora, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, alegre, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en villa Fátima un sitio caracterizado por las estaciones de buses interdepartamentales hacia el norte de La Paz.
Nicole es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español. Ella estudia gastronomía a nivel técnico superior y necesita realizar el pago de sus mensualidades como también realizar la compra de utensilios de cocina y material de estudios. Ella sueña terminar su profesión para poder ayudar a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Nicole solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su instituto y comprar material de estudio.
texts.en:
Nicole is a young 21-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She sells clothing for bebe in a commercial gallery. She's entrepreneurial, sweet, caring, sensible, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, happy, optimistic, responsible and a hard worker. She works in Fátima, which is a place characterized by its bus stations that link to the north of La Paz. 

Nicole has a dark complexion, long black hair, medium stature and her native language is Spanish. She studies gastronomy at a higher technical level and must pay her monthly tuition, as well as paying for cooking utensils and study material. She dreams of finishing her degree so she can help her family. It is because of this that Nicole is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition and to buy her study materials.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru: Хомид счастливый отец 3 детей. Он занимается откорм скота, дома содержит 2 коровы и 1 бычка. Также у него есть несколько голов овец. Хомид хочет что его семья жила счастлива и в достатке. Он долгое время занимается животноводством.   Каждое утро он и его семья доят коров и продают молоко на базаре. Это молоко быстро скупается на рынке. Это дает хороший доход семье. Куплей продажей коров тоже занимается сам Хомид . Дети конечно же помогают ему в его деле. У него семья очень дружная, дети очень хорошо воспитанные. После откорма коров он каждые две недели выходит на скотный базар и продает корову и взамен на деньги покупает молодого теленка. На данный момент он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота но на руках не имеет достаточной суммы. Поэтому Хомид обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется ,что Арванд откликнется на его просьбу и выделит сумму,необходимую для поддержания его бизнеса.
texts.en: Homid is the happy father of three children.  He makes a living fattening livestock and he currently owns two cows, one young bull and a few sheep.  Homid wants his family to be happy and to have a good life.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for a long time.  Every morning, he and his family milk the cows and then sell their milk at the market where the demand is high.  They derive a good income from this activity.  Homid is also involved in buying and selling cows, a business in which his children naturally help him.  Homid's family is very friendly and the children are well-mannered.  Every two weeks, after fattening his livestock, Homid goes to the cattle market to sell one cow and to buy a young calf.  He now wants to increase his cattle headcount, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.  This is the reason why he has turned to MDO Arvand for financial assistance.  He is hoping to get some support from MDO Arvand and to receive the money needed to keep his small business going.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 14 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of clothes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and expand on her business. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 14 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, eggs, flour, water, and sodas. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of rice, detergent, eggs, flour, and water, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and boost the business. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to have more stock. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice, detergent, eggs, flour, and water

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem has successfully built her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 30 years old and the mother of three children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband's tyre selling store; he sells and purchase vehicles' tyres. He is a young and energetic person; through this business he generates an income for his family.

He wants to buy vehicles’ tyres of various sizes and types to grow his business, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy more tyres. 

Therefore, Kishwar contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for getting a loan. 

Kishwar seems very happy after receiving this loan, and she thanks Kiva and hopes that the lender will take an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: to help Kishwar's husband purchase tyres.

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es: “CRISTO REY DE NICOLAS DE PIEROLA” es un grupo conformado por mujeres trabajadoras. Victoria tiene 60 años de edad es divorciada. Ella apoya a su hijo de 21 años de edad en sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de limpieza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes y productos de limpieza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Victoria es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo azulino y casaca de color beige. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Amparo en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
Cristo Rey de Nicolas de Pierola" is a group formed by hard-working women. Victoria is 60 years old and is divorced. She supports her son, who is 21 years old, in his education. She sells groceries and cleaning products. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more groceries and cleaning products. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the credit offered to them. Victoria is the third one on the left side. She is wearing a blue polo shirt and a beige jacket. And in the same way, the photo of Amparo is added in the upper left part because she could not be present for the meeting.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and cleaning products.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita INTEGRAL un crédito para poder construir dos cuartos y una pared en la parte de enfrente de la casa,y así comprar los materiales como: cemento, ladrillos, hierro, laminas, arena, pintura, pago de mano de obra, etc. para construir lo dicho anteriormente y así ella y sus hijos puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Ana, 47, lives in her own house with her three children.  She works as an employee in a private company.  With what she earns from her work, she is able to cover the expenses that come up in her home.  Ana wants to improve her residence, but with what she makes from her work, there is not enough to afford it.  For this reason, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to construct two rooms and an wall in the area in front of the house, and thus purchase the materials, such as cement, bricks, rebar, corrugated tin, sand, paint, payment for the labor, etc. in order to construct the aforementioned.  In this way, she and her children will be able to live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, rebar, corrugated tin, sand, paint, payment of labor, etc.

loans.name: Rhina Claribel

texts.es: Rhina de 41 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de diferentes tipos atoles, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy céntrica por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con los ingresos que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Rhina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de elotes, maicenas, maíz, azúcar, leche, y demás ingredientes para continuar con la elaboración de los atoles y así obtener mejores ingresos para seguir dándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rhina, who is 41 years old, has been selling different types of atoles (hot cereal-based drinks) for a number of years. Her business is located in her home in a very central zone. For this reason, she has many customers. With the income that she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay the expenses that arise in her household. Rhina lives in her own house with her family group. She is applying for a loan to purchase sweet corn, cornmeal, white corn, sugar, milk, and other ingredients to continue making atoles and thus obtain better income to continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn, corn meal, white corn, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, bed sheets, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy onions, potatoes, vegetables, tomatoes and cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bunghokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. Four children are currently in school. 

For the past nine years, Fatumah has been working hard to manage her spare parts business which sells spare parts like brake pads, bearings, and fuel filters. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts and will help Fatumah to generate greater profits and increase capital. She hopes that she will be able to expand the business in the future. 

Fatumah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatumah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts like brake pads, bearings, and fuel filters

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Ten women from a village stepped out and formed a group named Maa Santoshi Self Help Group in Odisha. They help each other, share their problems and solve them together. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. Bhan, the leader of the group, is engaged in the activity of selling products made of plastic like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware, containers, etc. She purchases these products from a wholesaler and then sells them at the market. Her group members assist her in selling these products. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily family activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase more products of the same kind in bulk, so that she can reduce her transportation cost. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all the expenditures in her business. 

Bhan, along with her group, has requested a loan of 130,000 INR for her group, so that they can earn more and control their family's cash flow. She will use her portion to purchase more products of the same kind in bulk to reduce her transportation cost.

loans.use: to purchase plastic products like mugs, plates, table covers, Tupperware and  containers for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 46-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and supports her entire family with her generated income. 

She has been using a manual sewing machine and now wants to buy a professional sewing machine which works with electricity so she can sew clothing rapidly and on time.

However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to buy a new sewing machine. For this reason, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create a means of increasing income so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for stitching clothing.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old. She is married with one child who is 18 years old and goes to school. She has a super market and has been selling for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more yogurt, milk, bread, cakes and fruit for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more yogurt, milk, bread, cakes and fruit to sell

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 28-year-old married man and a father of four children. He lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. He studied until his secondary education. Due to that, he got married when he was a very young man and he couldn't complete his studies. Now, Sameer is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the house. The house where Sameer and his family live lacks many home appliances and the others are very old. He believes that it is very necessary to improve the living conditions of the house. Sameer knows that to do this, he needs a lot of money and his income is not enough to do that. Sameer turned to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank and applied for a youth loan of 160,000 YER to purchase some home appliances such as a new oven and refrigerator to improve the living standards of his family.

Sameer hopes to send his children to a private sector.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and refrigerator

loans.name: Bijay Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Indra is a 47-year-old lady and has three children. She lives in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India with her husband and her children. She owns and manages a "Chaat stall" (Indian spicy and sour street food). She roams around the village and in the nearby market place. From this activity, she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is too little to cover her total family expenses so she wants to expand her business and make more money.

Indra, along with her group, is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy ingredients like wheat flour, grams, lentils, sauces, spices, vegetables, etc. for making "chaat". With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting the loan in a group of 10 members, all of whom are women and live in the same community. They named their group Bijay Laxmi Self Help Group, situated in the Koraput district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, grams, lentils, sauces, spices, and vegetables for her food stall

loans.name: Ngaakom Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ngaakom. It consists of eight women from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of 6,300 GHS from ID Ghana. They are selling groceries, drinks, salted fish, vegetable, gari (cassava flour), rice, materials, soap, jerseys, underwear, plates, bowls, bracelets, earrings, corn and cassava dough, ceramic products, and cutlery sets. 

Cynthia is a 41-year-old married woman with only one child who is 11 years old. They live with her family in the family house in Teshie. Cynthia and her husband share expenses, and therefore, she has to work so that she can fulfill her part of the contribution. 

Cynthia will use her share of the loan to purchase salted fish, vegetables, gari, and rice so that she can better serve her customers. Cynthia is requesting a loan of 1,400 GHS from ID Ghana in order to purchase enough and to respond to the current customers' needs.
 
They will use group pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase salted fish, vegetables, gari, and rice so that she can better serve her customers.

loans.name: Michael Bingo

texts.en:
Michael Bingo is 51 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Michael Bingo has been working hard to manage his clothing shop where he sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Michael Bingo has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Michael Bingo to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Michael Bingo hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a very big business. 

Michael Bingo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Michael Bingo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en: Clotilde is 42 years old. She is married with four children between 19 and 7 years old, all of whom go to school. She has a butcher shop and has been working in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for meat. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay for the welfare for her family.

loans.use: To buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Rose has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which sells bicycle spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Rose hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for five years now.

She will be using this loan to buy more clothes to sell. This will enable her to make more income since the demand for clothes is high in her area. She will use the generated profits to expand her business. 

This is her first loan and in the future, she hopes to open a big enterprise for selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 41-year-old hardworking and energetic lady. She is a mother of six children. For many years, she has been supporting her family by stitching clothes. The income from her business has enabled her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her household. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase fabric, threads, zippers and needles. She hopes that more investment in her business will help to generate more income and provide for her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 37-year-old hardworking woman. For the last 10 years, she has provide the service of stitching in her locality. She is quite popular for her sewing skill. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. In her third loan cycle, Farzana has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons. Farzana is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will generate a healthy source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 36 years old. He is married with four children between 15 and 3 years old, all of whom go to school. He has a shop and has been running the business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt, rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Heziron

texts.en:
Heziron is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Heziron has been working hard to manage his clothing shop. 

To help expand his business, Heziron has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Heziron to generate greater profits and to increase his business. Heziron hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Heziron is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Heziron who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 34 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, and battery cells. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, and battery cells, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and expand on his business. Patrick hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy more stock. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, and battery cells

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en: Xaverine is 52 years old. She is married with five children between 26 and 7 years old, three of whom go to school. She sells wood and has been selling in this business for the past six years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more wood for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale.

loans.name: Aashee

texts.en: Aashee is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become well-known for selling good quality cloth in her community. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth to accommodate the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.  She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 43-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Now her son has just started to drive a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bare the  jerks over the roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his Moto Rickshaw.

Kishwar has requested a loan so that her son can buy the moto rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. 

Kishwar thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children. For the past four years, she has been running a business purchasing and selling cattle along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding it, while her husband sells it at different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Noreen has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Ellen has been working hard to manage her shoe store.

To help expand her business, Ellen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Ellen to generate greater profits and to increase her stock. Ellen hopes that in the future she will be able to provide for her family's needs with the profits. 

Ellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Budhi Maa Shg Group

texts.en:
These 10 women from the small village of Odisha came together and formed Budhi Maa SHG in 2014. Rebati was selected as the leader of Budhi Maa SHG. The lady who is standing with her raised hand in the photograph is Rebati. She is 24 years old, a single mother and lives with her father and her child. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her father has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her father has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family. 

She, along with her group, has requested this loan and will use her portion to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Jai Bir Hanuman Shg Group

texts.en:
Sulochana is a 34-year-old divorced lady living with her one son and two daughters, who are in school. After her separation from her husband, she started this business four years ago to manage her family's expenses. She earns 5,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month from this activity, but this is not enough to pay her children's school fees and the family's other expenses. She owns and manages a ladies' novelty corner in her house where she sells cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories. She wants to enhance her business by adding more stock of what she sells. She says that adding different designs and brands of products will improve her earnings and her family's status. 

Sulochana, along with her group, has requested a loan of 240,000 INR and she will use her portion for purchasing of cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories for her ladies' novelty corner. She dreams of educating her children and saving some money to make her future secure.

Other members of this Jai Bir Hanuman Self Help Group are engaged in different kinds of activities like selling milk, grocery items, vegetables, fruits etc..All are very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva lenders across the world for this great support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Monday has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs, and other items. 

To help expand his business, Monday has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs, and other items and will help Monday to generate greater profits and improve business. Monday hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock. 

Monday is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monday who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more  flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with none of them currently in school. 

For the past year, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items. It will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and improve the business. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to add stock to the shop. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more  flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is a 49-year-old married woman with 3 children  between the ages of 23 and 16, all attend school. 

She has run a shop for the past 6 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy  sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil and biscuits to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as trustworthy. 

Mercy operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a convenient place. 

Mercy will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.	Her business goal is to own a big hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 27-year-old man. He has a produce store selling beans and maize and earns additional income from his salary. He faces a challenge of seasonality but hopes to buy a plot and build. He needs a loan to buy maize, beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband, a professional driver who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years to pay for the family's expenses.  The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it  functioning. 

Nasreen has applied for 40,000, PKR for her husband  to buy new tires and spare  auto  parts for his vehicle. This will help him to  provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Khlida

texts.en:
Khlida is a vigorous, 33 year old, lady. She has been providing tailoring services for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has 6 children. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

In her 5th loan cycle, she has requested 40,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase a new sewing machine and more sewing materials such as needles, spools of threads etc. She wants to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and more sewing materials such as needles, spools of threads etc.

loans.name: Alishba

texts.en: Alishba is a 28-year-old young woman who has been running a school for the last four years. She took it over from her father who had been running it for 25 years. As her father became old, she started to help him. Alishba's father supports her dream and helps with the management of the school. Alishba's dream is to eradicate poverty-driven illiteracy from the community. This school has 173 students. In order to build a science laboratory in her school, she has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 from Kashf Foundation. Alishba wants to have a better life for herself and her family as well as for the children who are studying in her school.

loans.use: to build a science laboratory

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past year, Scovia has been working hard to manage her bar business where she sells beer, soda, water, and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, soda, and water and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Scovia hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase inventory. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food for his goats

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 40-year-old married woman who has operated a beauty salon for fifteen years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. She has a good reputation in her community. 

In order to meet  the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetics for the salon.  She contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her 4th loan and needs 40,000 PKR to buy hair and skin care products in large quantities. 

She hopes to serve more customers.  She expects an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair and skin care products  in large quantities.

loans.name: Zobina

texts.en:
Zobina is a 34-year-old married women with 5 children. She has helped her husband (shown in the photo) with his fruit selling business. They sell apples, guavas, and mangoes  on a small cart to the local people. She is a very hard working lady. 

She and her husband support their entire family. They have many household expenses and it is difficult to invest back in the business. For this reason Zobina has requested 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, guavas, and apricots from the market to meet the increasing demand. 

She hopes to provide a quality education for her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, guavas, and apricots.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 27-year-old single man who supports his elderly parents by operating a retail business shop for four years.  He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Francis requests  60,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this money to buy  sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and cereal to sell to his customers.

Francis plans to use the anticipated profits to open an additional retail shop in the nearby town and hopes to open a supermarket in his home town.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, detergent, wheat flour, maize flour and cereal to sell to customers.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Bienestar y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 20 y 16 años, todos viven en su casa y la menor de ellos  estudia en colegio. Su marido es chofer profesional.
Doña María para ganar algo propio y con esto ir mejorando su casa, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, dos días de la semana recorre por toda la ciudad realizando sus ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y Huaquillas cada vez que necesita. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos de catalogo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 9 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The “Bienestar y Progreso” (Wellbeing and Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from. 

María, 42, lives here. She’s married and has four children who are 23, 21, 20 and 16 years of age; they all live at home and her youngest daughter attends school. Her husband is a professional chauffeur. 

In order to earn her own income and make home improvements, she sells all kinds of clothing and shoes by catalogue. She goes out two days a week throughout the city offering her products and collecting credit payments every 15 days. She also sells from home where her best-known customers come by.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas as needed. She’s been in business 9 years and has done very well. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes by catalogue. She’s been in the communal bank for 9 years and likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her dream is to have a nice house with all the comforts.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 44-year-old married woman. She has made different sizes of balls for many years and sells them in the local market. The man shown in the picture is her son and assistant. They have become famous in their town for providing good quality balls and earn enough to meet their household expenses. 

She contacted  Kashf Foundation for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase large quantities of rubber, thread, and leather covers to attract more customers. 

She hopes to increase her sales to generate more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the profits to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber, thread, and leather covers in a large quantities.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is a 49-year-old woman with four children.  

One of her sons (shown in the photo) runs a butcher shop and sells goat meat and hens to many of their community members. 

 Kaniz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase animals. Kaniz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son, and will bring positive changes to his business. 

She is in her 9th loan cycle and has successfully repaid the loans..

loans.use: to purchase animals..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es soltera y tiene 6 hijos con los que aparece en la fotografia Ana y su familia vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propiedad de la madre Ana se gana la vida como ofrecer servicio de te, ella tiene un puesto fijo y tambien atiende pedidos a oficinas Ana quiere un prestamo para comprar insumos (cantidades de té, cafe, leche) y vajilla (platos, tazas)Anteriormente su padre tuvo problemas de salud y Ana se hizo cargo de los gastos medicos, por eso su negocio necesita su ayuda Ana es la unica fuente de sustento de su hogar y goza de buena salud.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has six children who appear with her in the photo.  Her family lives with her parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house which belongs to her mother.  Ana earns a living through her tea business.  She has a stand and also serves orders to offices.  

Ana is requesting a loan to buy supplies (quantities of tea, coffee, milk) and dishes (plates, cups).  Her father has had health problems in the past and Ana paid the medical expenses, so her business needs your help.  Ana is the only source of income for her household and she is in good health.

loans.use: To buy supplies (quantities of tea, coffee, milk) and dishes (plates, cups).

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a 41-year-old man who lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, all attend school. 

For the past 5 years, Milton has worked hard to manage his retail shop to sell sugar, rice, bread, tooth paste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, batteries, posho, and soda. 

Milton requests a loan of 200,0000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, bread, tooth paste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, batteries, posho,and soda, and will help Milton to generate greater profits and educate his children. 

Milton hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house. 

Milton is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milton who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bread, tooth paste, detergent, oil, vasline, batteries, posho,and soda

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35-year-old married mother with three children, who has worked in decorating and selling special-occasion chocolates and souvenirs since 2008.

Fatima is a hard worker who puts much effort to develop her business in order to support her family and cover their increasing living needs.

She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her inventory  with special newly released decorating collections to provide her customers with diversified items.

She hopes to keep expanding and developing her business in a well managed way to support her beloved family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory with special newly released merchandise.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé,  Mawussi  est  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée  et  mère avec 3 enfants en charge.ELlle vend  des poissons frits, des produits alimentaires de premieres nécessité et  s’approvisionne  4 fois par  mois  au  marché d'assahoun et  revend  par vente ambulante  . Mawussi sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mawussi is 32 years old and  lives in the Adidogomé district of Lomé.  She is married and has three children in her care.

Mawussi sells fried fish and other basic foods.  She buys her supplies from the Assahoun market, four times a month.  She then sells her food on foot.

Mawussi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of fish and other food products for resale.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans  Kafui est mariée et mère avec 3 enfants en charge  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant des produits d'alimentation générale. Elles'approvisionne 4 fois par mois grand marché de Lomé et revend sous un hangar à à son domicile.  Kafui sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Kafui is 46 years old, married and has three children in her care.  She lives in Adidogomé.  Kafui sells general food products.  She buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé, four times a month.  She then sells them from a stall at her house.

Kafui has requested this loan in order to expand her business, satisfy the demands of her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of smoked fish and 3 boxes of tinned tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 3 hijos, no esta casada pero tiene pareja (que no es el padre de sus hijos). Isabel vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticretico Isabel se gana la vida como cocinera en un restaurante de chicharrones de cerdo (un platillo de cerdo exquisito y de gran demanda)Dado que Isabel es una cocinera muy buena y experimentada ha dedicido abrir su propio negocio y por eso necesita un credito Isabel quiere vender chicharron de cerdo por su cuenta, ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Isabel has three children.  She is not married but has a partner (who is not the father of her children).  Isabel lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house where she pays rental.  She earns a living as a cook at a pork crackling restaurant (an exquisite pork dish in high demand).

Since Isabel is a very good, experienced cook she has decided to open her own business and needs a loan.  She wants to sell pork cracklings on her own.  She is the only source of income in her household and is in good health.

loans.use: To open her own pork cracklings business.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 52-year-old married woman who has operated a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of toffees and sweets  at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.

 Sakina makes enough money to provide for her family. She requested a loan for 45,000 PKR  to buy packs of biscuits, toffees, juices and snack items from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has successfully repaid her loans..

loans.use: to buy  biscuits, toffees, juices and snack items.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is 36 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She does farming and she has been in this business for three years. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and also build a better house.

This is Evalyne's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to add more livestock and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is a 49-year-old vigorous lady who has been providing the service of tailoring for many years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has six children. To cope with the increasing demands of the customers, Bashir has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of thread, etc. She is expecting a boost in her net income.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of thread, etc.

loans.name: Wazeeran

texts.en: Wazeeran is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk for the last five years. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes, performs the task of collecting milk from them, and sells it at different places on a daily basis. In this way she obtains decent profits. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She uses the income to support her family. In order to make more profit, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Amparo De La Concepcion

texts.es: Amparo de la Concepción mayor de edad madre soltera de cinco hijos de los cuales todos son mayores y profesionales, originaria de Chinandega ubicada en el occidente de la país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, lo cual lo ha venido demostrando en todos los créditos anteriores en cuanto a la responsabilidad de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios terminando solo la primaria, ya que desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de hogar hoy en día es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra de cerdos en pie los cuales destaza diariamente y que comercializa en uno de los mercados de esta localidad donde tambien abastece a otros comerciante, el cual utiliza para elaborar comidas típicas de la región como son: frito, pepena, charrasca, moronga, nacatamales, chingaste entre otros mas, su jornada diaria inicia desde muy temprano en salir a las comunidades aledañas a comprar cerdos al mejor precio para la futura venta, y que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado. el  objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos para su crianza y venta, debido a que se lo están ofreciendo a un buen precio,Amparo de la Concepción  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Amparo de la Concepción is a single mother to five children, all of whom are adults and have a profession. Originally from Chinandega in the west of the country, Amparo is very hard-working and responsible. She has proven this with her previous loans as she has been responsible in her repayments.

Due to a lack of money, Amparo could not finish her education and completed only primary school. From a young age she started to work in order to help with household costs. Today she has a small business that she manages: Amparo buys and slaughters pigs. She sells them in one of the local markets, supplying to other businesses that use them meat to prepare typical dishes from the area, such as fried pork, organ meats, barbecue meats, black pudding, tamales and more. 

Amparo's day starts very early when she goes out to nearby communities to buy pigs at the best possible price. In the not-too-distant future, Amparo would like to have a better income. She has regular and one-off customers and sells in cash. This new loan will be used to invest in working capital and to buy pigs to raise and sell, as they are currently on sale for a good price. 

Amparo is grateful to Kiva investors for their help to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, and for helping those with little money to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy live pigs, condiments, bags, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, cold drinks and beer.

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, soap, cold drinks and beer, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more income.

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cold drinks and beer.

loans.name: Shamilah

texts.en:
Shamilah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Shamilah has been working hard to manage her restaurant.

To help expand her business, Shamilah has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock food items and drinks, and will help Shamilah to generate greater profits and expand the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits.

Shamilah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shamilah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: stock food items and drinks

loans.name: Rene Donato

texts.es:
Rene es un hombre de 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de tres años y una hija de un año, su trabajo es el servicio de taxi.
Él es emprendedor, luchador, fuerte, constante, buen padre, sensible, sincero, generoso, comprensivo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en Sacaba que se encuentra a 14 kilometros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su fiesta patronal más importante es la Virgen de Amparo y tiene como principales atractivos turísticos: la localidad de Ukuchi, el templo de Bella Vista, la laguna de San Isidro, el circuito de Motocrosss de Quintanilla, la casa de Hacienda de Tocopona, el templo de Melga, el camino del Inca, entre otros. En los cerros del norte de Sacaba se practican deportes extremos como parapente. 
René es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el Quechua el cual utiliza mayormente con sus parientes, en el trabajo utiliza el español. Su trabajo es el servicio de taxi, él se encarga de transportar a turistas y otros pasajeros por todos los lugares de Sacaba. El sueña brindarle a su familia un hogar con todos los servicios básicos como agua. Recientemente logró la construcción de su casa que se encuentra con un avance del 70% y no cuenta con instalación de agua.
Es por esos motivos que Rene solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua en su domicilio y poder brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rene is 47 years old and lives with his partner. He has a son, age three, and a daughter, age one. Rene drives a taxi for a living.

Rene is enterprising, plucky, strong, persevering, sensitive, generous, understanding, responsible, a good father, and very hard-working. He works in Sacaba, 14 kilometres from the city of Cochabamba. The most important local festival here is the Amparo virgin festival, and local tourist attractions include Ukuchi town, the Bella Vista temple, San Isidro lake, Quintanilla motocross tracks, the house on the Tocopona estate, Melga temple, the Inca path and more. On the hills north of Sacaba, people participate in extreme sports, such as paragliding.

Rene is dark skinned and has short black hair. He is of medium height and his native language is Quechua, which he uses mainly with his family; at work, he speaks Spanish. Rene is a taxi driver. He takes tourists and other passengers to all places in Sacaba. 

Rene dreams of providing his family with a home that has all basic services, such as water. Rene recently managed to build his house. It is 70% complete but does not yet have running water. As a result, Rene is applying for a loan in order to have running water in his home and to be able to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to have running water in his home and to be able to give his family a better future.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a pharmacy where she sells drugs. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to own a private hospital within five years. She hopes that in the future her business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis es un joven soltero, con 18 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace 6 meses trabaja como atención al cliente en un Restaurante y cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza, brinda una atención personalizada y es muy responsable.
Luis quiere estudiar una carrera profesional para poder brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque el apoyo que le han brindado va a comprar algunos enseres para su hogar, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para iniciar sus estudios superiores y más adelante convertirse en un profesional exitoso y competente.
texts.en:
Luis is a young, single adult aged 18.  He lives in Ica with his family.

He is very keen to progress in life, and for the last six months he has been working in customer services at a restaurant.  He thinks that he does the job well because he always makes an effort, offers a personalized service and is very responsible.

He wants to study a degree so that he can provide a better future for his family. 

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support that they give him will allow him to buy some items for his home.  This will improve the living conditions for his family.  

He will continue with his goal of starting a university degree to become a successful professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy some household items.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her grocery, which sells household materials.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household items, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells bags, shoes, metallic boxes, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bags, metallic boxes and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags, metallic boxes and other items.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Él es emprendedor, sincero, Inteligente, generoso, comprensivo, paciente, solidario, fuerte, optimista, comprometido con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de Batallas que se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, al sureste de Lago Titicaca en el Altiplano entre la Cordillera de los Andes y la Cordillera Occidental en el oeste y la Cordillera Central en el este. La región tiene un pronunciado clima frío en donde los rayos solares pueden ocasionar fuertes quemaduras.
Ramiro es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y lo combina con el español según las necesidades de comercio. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se dedica a la compra de ganado para su cría y engorde que es una característica de muchos pobladores del Altiplano, sin embargo aumentos en las tasas de población aunados al tamaño de las propiedades, están causando mayor presión de uso de los pastizales, especialmente de los bofedales sobrepasando en muchos casos la capacidad de carga. El necesita realizar la compra de tierras para el pastoreo de ganado, para tener mejores ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Ramiro solicita un préstamo para la compra de tierras para el pastoreo de su ganado.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 26 years old, single and has no children. He has a business selling bovine cattle.

Ramiro is enterprising, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, supportive, strong, optimistic, dedicated to his work, responsible and very hard-working. He works in Batallas community, at an altitude of around 3900 metres above sea level. Batallas is south-east of Lake Titicaca, on the altiplano between the Andes, the West Andes and the Central Andes. The region has a cold climate with sometimes strong and burning rays from the sun.

Ramiro is dark-skinned and has short black hair. He is of medium height. His native language is Aymara but he also speaks Spanish when required at his business. Ramiro has a cattle business. He buys cattle to raise and fatten-up, a work typical to many inhabitants of the altiplano. However, increases in population along with small properties is affecting grazing land which are often filled to over capacity. Ramiro needs to buy land to graze the cattle in order to have a higher income and improve his quality of life.

As a result, Ramiro is applying for a loan in order to buy land for his cattle to graze on.

loans.use: to buy land for his cattle to graze on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats and goat food.

loans.name: Daniel Agustin

texts.es:
