El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive don Daniel, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en  escuela. La mujer es  ama de casa. 
El señor Daniel es un hombre muy luchador que le gusta salir adelante y con esto darles lo mejor a sus hijos y esposa, el trabaja de albañil, son muchas las personas que le buscan para que les construya casas, cerramientos o para que les realice arreglos y remodelaciones en sus viviendas, el necesita de los créditos para poder comprar varias herramientas que utiliza y que le permitan facilitar su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio, el de esta forma dura se gana la vida y la de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar una carretilla, madera y varias herramientas más que necesita para brindar sus servicios. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Familiar" loan group meets every fortnight in a town called Colorado, just a few minutes from Montecristi. Here the majority of inhabitants have business, such as a producing ivory palm buttons, artisan products and general trade businesses.

And it is here that 39-year-old Daniel lives. He has a partner with whom he has two children, ages thirteen and ten. The eldest child is in secondary school, the youngest in primary. Daniel's partner is a housewife.

Daniel is a very plucky man who likes moving forward and giving his wife and children the best life that he can. Daniel is a builder and he has many customers who come to him so that he will build their houses and fences, or to carry out repairs and remodeling. Daniel needs this loan in order to buy various tools that he needs and that will make his work easier. He will then be able to offer better service to customers and can earn a living for his family.

This loan will be used to buy a cart, wood and various tools that Daniel needs to provide building services. Daniel has been with the loan group for four loan cycles and he likes it because he receives loans in order to get ahead. Daniel's dream is to give his family the best life that he can.

loans.use: to buy a cart, wood and various tools.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive la señora Rosario, tiene 40 años  de edad, esta separada y de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos, uno mayor de edad y tres de  14 y 8 años (gemelos), uno estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. 
Doña Rosario es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días, aprovecha las horas de la mañana para realizar sus recorridos ya que es cuando sus hijos están en la escuela y sale con mayor facilidad, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 2 años con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo ya que tiene varios pedidos. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles a sus hijos lo mejor.
texts.en:
The lending group “Familiar” meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, which is only a few minutes from Montecristi. In this area most of the inhabitants have various trades like manufacturing buttons from tagua nuts, crafts, and trade in general.

This is the place where Rosario lives. She is 40 years old and separated from her partner, with whom she has four children. One of them is already grown-up, one is 14 years old and two (they are twins) are 8 years old. The oldest son is at college and the smaller children at school.

Rosario is a very good mother and took up her trade because she wanted her children not to lack anything. She sells all kinds of clothes from door-to-door and works every day. She uses the morning hours to do her job, because this is when her children are at school and so it is easier for her to leave the house. She sells on credit and collects the money every eight days. She has done this job for more than two years and it helps her to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothes as she has various orders. She has been a member of the lending group for three cycles and she likes that the loans help her to get ahead. It is her dream to give the best of everything to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the fort portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years Godfrey has been working hard to manage his clinic, which provides medical services. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beds for patients, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and expand on the clinic. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy beds for patients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making jikos and sufurias.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 36-year-old man with three children. He deals in motorcycle spare parts. He faces the challenge of high goods prices. However, he hopes to have enough capital. Robert needs a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to add stock of motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man and has eight children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for three years. Kennedy describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to own a big timber yard within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to build a big business yard. He hopes that in the future, his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old woman, married to Morris who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Mary has been operating a grocery stall for a period of four years, earning an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Mary is now servicing her first loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional green vegetables, mangoes, oranges, water melons, bananas and cereals to sell to her customers on a daily basis. Mary plans to use the anticipated income to pay for school fees and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy additional green vegetables, mangoes, oranges, water melons, bananas and avocados to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manrique Danilo

texts.es: Manrique tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 4 años, 6 años y 10 de edad. Él es un hombre visionario quien desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su esposa también se dedica al comercio lo cual le permite equilibrar la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de seguir ofreciendo sus prendas de vestir ha tomado la decisión de solicitar nuevamente un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, faldas, etc. Agradece por el apoyo brindado en el pasado.
texts.en: Manrique is 28 years old. He lievs in his own house with is wife and their three children, aged 4, 6 and 10. He is a visionary who for a long time has worked selling clothes. This allows him to support his home. His wife is also a merchant and that allows them to balance the household budget. To keep offering the clothing for sale he has decided to ask for a loan again from FUSAI to invest in his business by buying articles of clothing such as: Pants, blouses, underwear, skirts, etc. He is grateful for the support given in the past.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, underwear, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra es una chica muy trabajadora, en la actualidad se dedica a trabajar en una hacienda cuidando ganado, ella se encuentra en estado de embarazo y espera muy contenta la llegada de su bebe,  comenta Alejandra que es duro su trabajo pero que el beneficio que ella tiene es que le hacen tener una vaca junto al ganado que cuida y no le cobra de la hierba, el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera y por medio de la venta de  leche ayudarse en los gastos que le toca afrontar en el momento que nazca su hijo y el tiempo de su maternidad.
texts.en: Alejandra is a very hard working girl. Right now she works at a ranch caring for cattle. She is pregnant and is happily awaiting her baby's arrival. Alejandra says that her work is hard but the benefit is they let her have her own cow with the cattle she cares for and they don't charge her for the grass. She is going to invest the loan in buying a dairy cow and by selling the milk she can help cover the costs she will face when her child is born and during her maternity.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mayra Cristela

texts.es: Mayra de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Mayra está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mayra is 46 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She sells clothing for women, men and children. She has her business in the city market. She has a lot of customers because of the variety of product she has and the good prices. Mayra is asking for a loan to buy more clothing to continue with her sales and thus have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to reinforce the walls in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la venta de ropa, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, la joven vive en casa de un familiar con su compañero de vida y su hija de tres años de edad, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This is a young girl whose face is blurred because she is only 21 and lives in a high risk area.  

She sells clothes to make a living.  Her business is located in her home, where she has lived for several years.  The house she lives in belongs to a relative and her husband, who together have a three-year-old daughter.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes in bulk so she can continue selling them and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Wendy Gabriela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Wendy, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de dos años. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio local.
Doña Wendy con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, lo cual es una ventaja para volver a vender ya que aprovecha los días de cobro de sus clientes. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños tener su casa propia ya que vive con familiares.
texts.en:
Familiar Communal Bank meets every two weeks in a place called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi.  The majority of the people there have different businesses, such as tagua nut buttons, crafts, and commerce in general.

Wendy, 21, lives in this area.  She's married and has a two-year-old daughter from this relationship.  Her husband works in the local town.

Wendy sells all types of clothing so she can earn something on her own with which she can get ahead at home.  She sells door-to-door and also at home, where her customers go when they need some item of clothing.  She works every day, selling to her customers on credit and collecting every two weeks.  This is an opportunity to go back and sell on the days she collects from her customers.  She has worked in this business for three years and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans.  Her dream is to have her own house, because she lives with relatives.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to tend to his rice crop

loans.name: Wendy Yaneth

texts.es: Wendy de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de ropa, actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años y la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hijo al lado de su compañero de vida, que a su vez se desempeña como albañil, ambos se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo. Wendy desea aumentar sus ganancias por lo que ha decidido aumentar su mercadería es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: calcetines, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, chaquetas, etc.
texts.en:
Wendy, 23, lives in her own home with her husband and 4-year-old son. She is a very enterprising woman who sells clothes for a living.  

She has been doing this for seven years and it allows her to provide for her son, along with her husband.  He is a builder; and both of them work hard to give their son all they can. 

Wendy would like to improve her profits, so she has decided to expand her range of stock.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy songs, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, jackets, etc.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra vive en casa propia, es madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de pastelitos de carne, yuca y papas fritas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado afuera de la escuela que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Sandra está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como: papas, yuca, maíz, verduras, carne, aceite, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in her own home.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children and her mother.  

She sells meat pastries, yucca and French fries.  Her business is located outside a school near her home. She has a lot of customers thanks to her friendly service.

She is asking for a loan to buy more raw ingredients such as: potatoes, yucca, corn, meat, oil, etc.  In this way, she can continue with her sales, which are the only source of income.  This in turn, gives her family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Cristobal Rafael

texts.es: Cristobal tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Cristobal es un hombre muy trabajador quien trabaja como jornalero, ayudante de albañil y además, se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos, especialmente, maíz. Cristobal  expresa estar muy agradecido por el financiamiento que recibió en el pasado para invertir en su negocio de compra y venta de maíz. Nuevamente, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio dado que ha notado una mejoría en la demanda del producto. Con el crédito comprará maíz al por mayor para continuar satisfaciendo de la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristobal, 28, lives in his own home with his wife and two young children. He is a hard-working man who is a laborer and a builder's assistant, as well as devoting some time to buying and selling basic grains, especially corn. 

He is very grateful for the financial help he received in the past which he used to invest in his business of buying and selling corn. 

Once again, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI so he can continue to invest in his business, as he has recently noticed an increase in demand for his product. With the loan, he will buy corn in bulk which will help to satisfy his customer demand.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Jennifer Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jennifer de 21 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad lucha día a día para salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios,  pero quiere que su hijo tenga los estudios que ella no pudo culminar.
Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Productos como: rubor, delineador, marbelline, antiojeras,  sombras de ojos, lápiz de ojos, labiales, astringentes, body de cuerpo, perfumes. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jennifer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 21, is a single mother with one young child.  She comes from Sauce, which is a place located in the north of the region.  She is hard-working, responsible and has a great desire for self-improvement. 

At the moment she is struggling daily to make ends meet.   Unfortunately, she was unable to finish her studies.  However, she wants her wants her son to be able to complete the education that she could not.

To earn an income, she sells cosmetics both on the streets and from her home. She sells products such as: blush, eyeliner, Maybelline, eye shadows, eye creams, eye pencils, lip-sticks, skin moisturizers, body lotions and perfumes. She works eight hours a day to satisfy her customers and gain new ones. 

She aims to invest the loan in her work and stock the business so that in the near future she can generate more of an income. 

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders because they help people like her who have limited resources in countries such as Nicaragua to have a reasonably acceptable job.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetic products for retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge for his mother.

loans.name: Edwin Camilo

texts.es:
Edwin es un padre de familia amoroso, tiene 28 años y vive en Tate junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja en un fundo Agrícola y en las noches se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte con una mototaxi que alquila, Edwin cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable, sabe discernir entre lo bueno y lo malo y porque siempre pone en práctica todos los consejos que su madre le brindó para ser mejor cada día.
Edwin ama a su hijo, es el mayor regalo que le han podido dar. Está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para su hijo, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y más adelante podrá brindarle una educación de calidad para que se convierta en un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Edwin is the father of a beloved family.  He is 28 and lives with his family in Tate.

He has a huge desire to progress.  He works on a farm and at night he offers a transport service on a motorcycle which he rents.  

He thinks his success is due to his responsible attitude.  He can discern between the good and the bad because he always puts into practice the advice his mother gave him, which helps him improve daily.

He loves his son.  It is the greatest gift he could have ever had.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to buy some new bedroom furniture for his son.  This will improve his standard of living and it will allow him to study and get a good education to become an excellent professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy some bedroom furniture for his son.

loans.name: Moisés Alberto

texts.es:
Moisés vive en Lima con sus padres, su familia es natural de Tumbes, ciudad ubicada al norte del Perú y emigraron a la capital en busca de un mejor futuro y educación para sus hijos.
Moisés trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, el realiza transporte público de pasajeros en una unidad de mototaxi, en sus momentos libres, con lo cual ayuda a su familia con el sostenimiento del hogar y a su vez destina dinero para el pago de sus estudios, ya que sus padres no pueden financiarlos por la crisis económica que atraviesan en casa.
El esta cursando actualmente la mitad de su carrera y el horario así como la cantidad de cursos que lleva dificultan que pueda trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, por lo que deberá dejar sus estudios y laborar a tiempo completo de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El es un joven emprendedor y con muchos deseos de salir adelante para crecer y ayudar a su familia, por lo que agradece toda la ayuda que pueda recibir de antemano para poder continuar sus estudios y cumplir sus sueños.
El cree que la educación es la herramienta básica para poder desarrollarse por lo que considera la tarea de los beneficiarios de Kiva como muy loable y digna de admiración e imitación.
texts.en:
Moises lives in Lima with his parents.  His family come from Tumbes, which is a city in the north of Peru.  They moved to the capital in search of a better future and education for their children.

He works and studies at the same time.  He offers a public transport service on a motor-taxi.  In his free time he helps his family by taking care of the household chores.  The income he generates goes towards the family and his studies.  His parents are unable to pay his course fees because they are in financial difficulty.

He is halfway through his course at the moment and his timetable and the amount of subjects he has to study make it difficult for him to work and study at the same time.  If it weren't for the help of the Kiva lenders, he would have to give up studying and work full-time.

He is very enterprising and he has a strong desire to make progress and grow, as well as helping his family.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks them in advance for the help that they can give him to finish his studies and fulfil his dreams.

He believes that education is the basic tool needed to be able to develop, so he thinks that those who take advantage of Kiva for this purpose are very laudable and worthy of admiration.

loans.use: to pay for his course fees as a textile mechanic.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 months, Teddy has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells saucepans, buckets, detergent and sugar. 
  
To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  saucepans, buckets, detergent and sugar, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, buckets, detergent and sugar.

loans.name: Doris Cecilia

texts.es: Doris tiene  26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto as su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Doris posee un negocio de pupusas desde hace  cuatro años lo cual es lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Con el deseo de seguir dando a su familia lo necesario ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos  y desea seguir manteniendo su negocio por mucho más tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, gas propano, etc. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma invertir en los insumos para el negocio de pupusas.
texts.en:
Doris, 26, lives in her own house with her life companion and her young son, age 5.

Doris has had a pupusa [stuffed tortilla] business for four years that allows her to support her household.  She wants to keep on giving her family the necessities, so she decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in her business, her main source of income.  She wants to keep up her business for a lot longer.

She's going to buy corn, rice, cheese, beans, propane gas, and so on with the requested amount.

Doris hopes to be able to have the loan so she can invest in the ingredients for her pupusa business.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, and beans.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates an entertainment business where he owns pool tables for customers to play snooker. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more pool tables. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big supermarket. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more pool tables.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en:
Clovice is 30 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Clovice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells detergent, rice, bread, soda and water. 

To help expand her business, Clovice has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy detergent, rice, bread, soda and water, and will help Clovice to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Clovice hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Clovice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Clovice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy detergent, rice, bread, soda and water.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 8 years. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a tailoring firm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 18 and 7 years, and all of them go to school. She sells from her shop and she has been working in a business for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, biscuits and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy cows and goats and to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more salt, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro vive en concubinato en la comunidad de Avichaca, en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Pedro se gana la vida como agricultor y necesita un prestamo para comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Pedro es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda, el cliente goza de buena salud y negocio es estable
texts.en: Pedro lives with a domestic partner in the community of Avichaca, in an adobe house which belongs to him. Pedro works as a farmer and needs a loan to buy a motor pump to water his crops. Pedro's work is the only source of income in his household, and he needs your help. Pedro is healthy and his business is stable.

loans.use: to buy a water motor pump to water his crops.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 34 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, soda, Vaseline, rice, sugar and groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bread, soda, Vaseline, rice, sugar and groundnuts, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy bread, soda, Vaseline, rice, sugar and groundnuts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells water, sweets, juice and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy water, sweets, juice and sugar, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy water, sweets, juice and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be self committed. She operates a retail business where she sells salt, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of salt, sugar, cooking fat and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved lifestyle. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora vive en concubinato y es de la comunidad de Avichaca Ella vive en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Teodora es agricultora y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Teodora es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y su negocio es estable
texts.en: Teodora lives with her domestic partner in the community of Avichaca. She lives in an adobe house that belongs to her. Teodora is a farmer and she wants to buy a water motor pump to water her crops. Teodora is the only one who brings income to her household, but she is healthy and her business is stable.

loans.use: to buy a water motor pump to water her crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be visionary and good minded. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to open another outlet within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Abedengo

texts.en:
Abedengo is 28 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 4 years, Abedengo has been working hard to manage his produce, selling posho (corn meal), cassava flour and beans. 

To help expand his business, Abedengo has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of posho, cassava flour and beans, and will help Abedengo to generate greater profits and improve family's standard of living. Abedengo hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Abedengo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abedengo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of posho (corn meal), cassava flour and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a 27-year-old businesswoman and mother from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She supports herself by selling kapenta (dried sardines) at her homestead. Selina has been selling kapenta for the past two months, with her family’s assistance. When Selina is not working, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a nearby school. 

Selina is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can buy fish in bulk, and she also needs plastic papers to wrap the fish in. With the additional profits Selina will earn, she will be able to expand her business and eventually sell not just kapenta, but groceries, too.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk and plastic papers for packaging them.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Gladys has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells detergent, groundnuts, rice, posho (ground corn) and salt. 

To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy detergent, groundnuts, rice, posho and salt, and will help Gladys to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Gladys hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gladys who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy detergent, groundnuts, rice, posho and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for his business.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Because Amani is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Amani is a 23-year-old married lady, living with her husband in Jordan. Her husband has been running a bird shop for two years, and it became the only source of income for them. Amani is seeking to help her husband in expanding his shop in order to raise their income. Now she is applying for this youth loan to buy more birds for her husband's shop, adding a variety of them to raise their profit and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more birds for his shop.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 28-year-old woman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She has been running her own business for the past year and a half; Shamiso sells chickens at the local business center. She also has two employees that assist her in her poultry project. 

When she is not at the business center, Shamiso can be found at the local secondary school, where she volunteers each week. Shamiso is a Camfed Learner Guide who mentors young students. With the Kiva loan, Shamiso intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, chick feed, and vaccines. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business into a larger poultry project.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of chicks & chick feed.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is 40 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children and neither of them is currently in school. For the past 6 years, Rose Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beer, soda, sugar, soap and milk. 

To help expand her business, Rose Mary has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, soda, sugar, soap and milk, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve the family's standard of living. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rose Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, sugar, soap and milk.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva de 37  años de edad es viuda y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una joven de 18 años de edad y un varón de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de joyería como: arracadas, pulseras, cadenas, collares, anillos, etc. todo hecho a base de plata y enchape de oro, dichos artículos los vende por catalogo y de forma ambulante, y es gracias a ello como esta visionaria mujer ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos después de la pérdida de su esposo. Rosalva desea seguir ampliando su clientela y espera lograrlo surtiendo más su mercadería y es por ello que se ha acercado a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en: pulseras, collares, cadenas, anillos, arracadas, etc. De plata y enchape de oro. Además Rosalva manifiesta sentirse muy agradecida con FUSAI ya que este sería el segundo crédito que adquiere, ya que con el anterior de igual forma invirtió en mercadería y es gracias a ello que ha logrado mantenerse en el gusto de sus clientes, esperando que el nuevo crédito sea aprobado lo antes posible para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rosalva, 37 years old, is a widow. She lives in her own house with her two children: an 18 year old girl and a 15 year old boy. She is an enterprising woman who works selling jewelry such as: earrings, bracelets, chains, necklaces, rings, etc., made of silver and gold plate. She sells these items by catalog and as a street vendor; and it is thanks to it that this visionary woman has been able to move her children forward after her husband's loss. Rosalva wants to continue growing her customer base, and she hopes to do so by stocking up her merchandise. For this she has approached FUSAI to request a loan to invest in: bracelets, necklaces, chains, rings, earrings, etc. in silver and gold plate. Furthermore, Rosalva says that she is very grateful to FUSAI because this would be her second loan with them. The previous one was also invested in merchandise, and thanks to it she has been able to maintain her customers by satisfying their tastes. She hopes the new loan is approved as soon as possible so she can improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past four years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells maize flour, beans, cooking oil, and rice. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, soap, beans, cooking oil, and maize flour, and it will help Josephine to generate greater profits and expand the business. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to produce quality products. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, beans, cooking oil, and maize flour.

loans.name: Helal

texts.en:
Helal is a 28-year-old single man, living with his family in the house of his father in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. 

He has a diploma certificate and he is an employee in the public sector with a small salary. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the house. 

His house lacks of many home appliances and the others are very old. He wants to replace some of those old home appliances with others. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Helal applied for a loan of 170,000 YER to purchase some home appliances like a new refrigerator and cooker for his house.

Helal looks forward to purchasing a piece of land and building his own house on it. He also hopes to purchase a taxi to work as a driver to transport people to earn money in order to help him improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase some home appliances like a new refrigerator and cooker for his house.

loans.name: Gamuchirai

texts.en:
Gamuchirai is a 22-year-old businesswoman from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. 

She runs a clothing business at the local flea market, and she even employs two people who assist her. When she is not at the flea market, Gamuchirai is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who counsels students at the nearby school. 

Gamuchirai is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can purchase clothing in bulk. She would like to expand her business with the profits she will earn. 

Gamuchirai imagines her business will grow so large that she will need to hire more people.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Polibenin

texts.en:
Polibenin is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. She describes herself as business-oriented. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, cereals and plastic containers. Her business is located in a local area. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a major business within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 26-year-old businesswoman who resides in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. 

Patience has been successfully running a grocery store for the past two years. When she is not at her business, she is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches young students communication skills. 

A loan from Kiva would mean that Patience could purchase more products to sell in her store. She will be able to sell more products and earn more money. The profits will go toward creating a larger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 17 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells shirts, trousers, and t-shirts. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more trousers, ties, t-shirts, and shirts, and it will help Harriet to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to produce quality products. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, ties, t-shirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner for six other members of his family. 

He used to work in the upholstery business, but his limited income compared with his big family's increasing needs forced him a year and a half ago to make a change. He got employed in a potato chips factory so that this stable monthly income will help him in covering his family's increasing needs.

Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car necessary for facilitating his transportation needs, especially to finish his own business on time.

He hopes that in the future he can establish his own upholstery factory and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a car .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase buy more coffee and to hire farm labor

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is aged 26. She is married with one child who is 1 year old and not yet going to school. She has a shop and has been running a business for the past 13 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, salt, powder, rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, salt, powder, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres es casado y vive en Avichaca, en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, tiene luz y agua Andres quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios, ya que el cliente es agricultor, su esposa le ayuda en la economia del hogar realizando bordados de trajes tipicos para bailes folcloricos pero lo que gana no alcanza por eso el cliente necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Andres is married and lives in Avichaca in an adobe house that he owns.  It has light and water service.  Andres wants to buy a motorized water pump in order to irrigate his crops.  Since the client is a farmer, his wife helps with the household finances by doing traditional costume embroidery for the folkloric dances, but what she earns is not enough. This is why the client needs help.

loans.use: to get a motorized water pump in order to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David vive en concubinato y tiene 5 hijos, la familia vive en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, tiene luz y agua. David es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios David es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y su negocio es estable
texts.en:
David is in a common-law marriage and has five children.  The family lives in Avichaca in a house made of adobe.  He owns the house, and it has electric and water services.

David is a farmer, and he wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

David is the only source of income for his household.  However, he enjoys good health, and his business is stable.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano es casado y vive en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es propia  y tiene luz y agua. Mariano es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Mariano es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y es una persona responsable
texts.en:
Mariano is married.  He lives in Avichaca in a house made of adobe.  He owns the house, and it has electric and water services.

Mariano is a farmer, and he wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

Mariano is the only source of income for his household.  However, he enjoys good health, and he is a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 33 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and increase his income. Godfrey hopes that in the future, he will be able to start up another source of income. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, bread, sugar, eggs and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children. She has a retail shop, and she has been in the business for 11 years now. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods for selling in her shop. These include sugar, salt, flour, bread and soft drinks. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has been paying her previous loans successfully. In the future, Mary hopes to be a successful business lady and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for selling, including sugar, salt, flour, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 40-year-old man married to Anastacia, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children. Fredrick has been operating a transportation business for the last nine years, earning an income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Fredrick is servicing his third loan of 40,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount buy chicks and hens to sell to his customers on a daily basis.
 
Fredrick plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and purchase his own land to build a permanent house for his family.  He hopes to improve his family's living standard and become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To buy hens to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married and has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, which she has been doing for three years. Her business is located in a convenient location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fashion changes. 

Ann requested a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nyirasafari

texts.en:
Nyirasfari is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a shop, which she has been doing for four years.  

Nyirasfari requested a loan, which she will use to buy more soap, rice, sugar, books, and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, rice, sugar, books, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's school fees

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre casado y vive en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad La vivienda tiene luz y agua Francisco es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Francisco es la unica persona que aporta en su hogar y por eso requiere de su ayuda, el cliente tiene buena salud y su evaluacion de credito es buena
texts.en:
Francisco is married.  He lives in an adobe house, which he owns.  The house has electric and water services.

Francisco is a farmer, and he wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

Francisco is the only person who supports his household.  That is why he needs your help.  He is in good health, and his credit evaluation is good.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 31 years. She describes herself to be a time keeper. She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a dairy cow. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 52-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married mother of three children who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, in addition to their limited work access, she decided four years ago to open a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Ibtisam is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to continue building her house to make it a healthier living place for her beloved children. 

She hopes to develop her business in a well managed way, and finish her house building needs.

loans.use: To continue building her house to make it a healthier living place for her beloved children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber cutting machines and hire labor

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en: Rashed is a 22-year-old single young man living in Marka, Jordan with his family that consists of three members. He is a university student majoring in Mechanical Engineering, and he is in his fourth year. Rashed is seeking to work in his study field after getting his Bachelor's to start depending on himself, but he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be vision oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a married woman. She has 10 children. She describes herself to be business-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cereals and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a local area. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge to be weather and low supply. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals. Her business goal is to own a grocery shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SINDIYA est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le  précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de NASSOUN qui est la femme  assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Sindiya Group is made up of six married women who average 40 years of age and four children each. They live in nuclear families in Heremakono Nord, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capability and improve their business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second loan. The first one was repaid without problems.

The women of this group sell various products, just like Nassoun, the woman sitting in the front in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy 10 lengths of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She retails for cash and on credit, at home and in the market, to a mixed gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, to be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Miria Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MIRIA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  pagnes à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 mètres de bazin et 8 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Miria Group is made up of five married women who average 25 years of age and three children each. They live in extended traditional families in Heremakono Nord, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capability and improve their business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second loan. The first loan was repaid without problems.

The women of this group sell pagnes (colorful African cloth), just like Katiadou, the second woman from the right in the sitting row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy eight meters of bazin (a kind of fabric) and eight lengths of pagnes from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She retails for cash and on credit, at home and in the market, to a mixed gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000, to be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto es casado y vive en la comunidad de Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad La casa tiene luz y agua Benedicto es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios  El cliente es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, su esposa le ayuda con sus sembradios pero no tiene actividad propia
texts.en: Benedicto is married and lives in the community of Avichaca in an abode house that he owns. The house has electricity and water. Benedicto is a farmer and he wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops. He is the only source of income in his house. His wife helps him with his crops but does not have her own business activity.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 26 years old and has two children. She lives in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. Ellen is able to provide for her family because she operates her own grocery store with two employees. Ellen volunteers weekly, as well. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches young students communication and leadership skills. 

Ellen requested a loan, which she will use to make bulk purchases of rice, cooking oil, sugar, cotton wool, sanitary pads, and salt to expand her business. Ellen hopes that a thriving business will lead to more employees; she knows it is is important to create employment opportunities for people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Esther has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce of maize, beans, rice. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of produce, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to build rentals. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of produce

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo Ella vive en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad  La casa tiene luz y agua Mercedes es agricultora y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Mercedes por el momento no es apoyada economicamente por nadie por eso necesita su ayuda, la cliente y su hijo gozan de buena salud y la evaluacion de su situacion es prometedora
texts.en: Mercedes lives in a common-law marriage, and has a son.  She lives in Avichaca in an adobe house that she owns.  The house has electricity and running water.  Mercedes is a farmer who wants to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crops.  At the moment, Mercedes does not receive financial support from anyone, which is why she is in need of help.  The client and her son enjoy good health and their current situation is promising.

loans.use: purchase a water pump to water her crops.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David  vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos el cliente es de Avichaca y vive en una casa de adobe que es propia La casa tiene luz y agua David es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios En sus ratos libres David gana dinero extra como integrante de una banda de musica pero no tiene quien le apoye economicamente por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: David  is in a common-law relationship and has 4 children. He is from Avichaca and lives in an abode house that he owns. His house has lights and water. David is a farmer and wants to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops. In his spare time David makes extra money as a member of a music group. But he has nobody to help him financially so he needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Nitson

texts.es:
Nitson es un joven soltero de 23 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por algunas circunstancias económicas en su familia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y como para apoyar a sus hermanos aprendió a manejar y desde hace varios años brinda servicios de transporte con una mototaxi que tiene, Nitson cree que le va bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable, siempre amable y preocupándose por el bienestar de sus clientes. Es un hijo ejemplar porque está sacrificándose mucho para que sus hermanos puedan tener un mejor futuro.
Nitson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar y realizar el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes cuando traslade a sus pasajeros y sus ingresos mejorarán. Así pues, con mucho esfuerzo más adelante podrá cumplir uno de los más grandes sueños de su familia. Tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nitson is a 23 year old bachelor with a strong desire to get ahead.  Due to some financial circumstances in his family, he was not able to attend college.  In order to help his siblings he learned to drive, and for many years, he has provided transportation services with his rickshaw.  Nitson believes that it has gone well for him because he is hardworking, responsible and is always kind and concerned with the wellbeing of his customers.  He is an exemplary son because he is sacrificing a lot for his siblings to have a better future.  

Nitson is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to repair and maintain his rickshaw.  This way, he will not have any issues while transporting his passengers and his earnings will increase.  With this, and a lot of effort, he will be able to realize one of his family's biggest dreams of owning their own home.

loans.use: repair and maintain his rickshaw.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be a risk-taker. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, washing soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a very competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Pauline will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, flour and other items. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, flour, and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be focused and determined.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. He will use the  20,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own several motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Sergio Luis

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y trabaja como vendedor de zapatos deportivos.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, inteligente, fuerte, luchador, soñador, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la feria de las mañaneras de la avenida Buenos Aires, un lugar caracterizado por la venta por mayor de ropa abrigada: zapatos, chamarras, chompas, mantillas y edredones de fabricación nacional. Esta se inicia a las 06.00 de la mañana y termina a las 10.00. A esa hora se retiran por la presencia de comerciantes de puesto fijo.
Sergio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara por sus familiares. Él estudia computación a nivel técnico superior, trabaja a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y le queda el resto del día para cumplir sus funciones de estudiante. Él necesita realizar la compra de una computadora portatil para completar sus estudios, actualmente no cuenta con una y sufre de muchos problemas en la entrega de sus tareas. Él sueña ser profesional y dedicarse a su carrera.
Es por esos motivos que Sergio solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para poder continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Sergio is 22 years old, single and has no children. He works selling sports shoes. He is enterprising, resolute, consistent, intelligent, strong, a fighter, a dreamer, cheerful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, is responsible and very hard working. He does his work at the morning market on Buenos Aires Avenue an area known for it's wholesale sales of warm clothing: shoes, jackets, sweaters, shawls and nationally made quilts. It starts at 6 am and finishes at 10 am. At this time the merchants are replaced by those with permanent stalls.

Sergio is dark-skinned, has short black hair and is of medium height, He speaks Spanish but knows Aymara from his family. He is studying computers at the Superior technical level. He works very early in the morning and has the rest of the day for his studies.

He needs to buy a portable computer (PC) to complete his studies. He does not currently have one and has many problems handing in his assignments. He dreams of being a professional and working in his field. For these reasons Sergio is requesting a loan to buy a PC to be able to continue to study.

loans.use: to buy a PC to continue with his studies.

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a 20-year-old businesswoman who resides in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. 

Sinikiwe supports herself by running a clothing boutique. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches young students how to overcome obstacles in their daily lives. 

Sinikiwe is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can buy dresses, pants, and shoes in bulk. She will then sell her purchases to the people of her community. Earning some extra income will be beneficial in Sinikiwe’s quest to go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes's group is comprised of two hard-working women. 

Agnes is 17 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Potal region of Uganda. For the past year, Agnes has been working hard to manage her business where she sells fresh beans. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh beans to sell, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh beans to sell.

loans.name: Ilce Yessenia

texts.es: Ilce de 22 años de edad es soltera y habita en vivienda propia al lado de su madre. Ella es una joven con una gran tenacidad, la cual le ha permitido sostener la economía familiar por medio de su negocio de crianza de pollos, además se desempeña como tutora de niños aportando así su valiosa ayuda a su comunidad. Ilce desea seguir ampliando su negocio y es por ello que vuelve a acercarse a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado. Ilce se encuentra muy agradecida con FUSAI ya que gracias al crédito que se le concedió ella pudo ampliar su negocio y ahora observa que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos y es por ello que desea adquirir el nuevo crédito lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ilce is 22 years old, is single and lives with her mother in their own home.  She is a young woman with great tenacity, which has allowed her to sustain the family's finances through her work raising chickens.  She also works as a tutor for children, where she provides valuable help to the community.  Ilce wishes to expand her business, which is why she approached FUSAI to request a loan to purchase chickens, vitamins and feed.  

Ilce is very grateful for FUSAI because thanks to the loan that she received, she was able to expand her business, and she has seen her customer base increase everyday.  For this reason, she hopes to receive a new loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as well as food and vitamins for them.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa, sus padres y sus 4 hijos de 18, 12, 9 y 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón como responsable y trabajador, ya que desde hace 15 años se gana la vida como agricultor, además posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda, por lo que logra mantener la economía familiar. Raúl se encuentra muy preocupado ya que una parte de su vivienda, se encuentra en peligro porque esta sobre un talud de tierra que puede ceder en cualquier momento, por lo que él desea construir un muro de contención lo antes posible, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, bloque de cemento y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Raúl is 45 years old and lives with his wife, his parents and their four children, ages 18, 12, 9 and 4, in their own home.  He is a well known man in his community for being responsible and hardworking.  For the past 15 years, he has earned a living as a farmer.  He also has a small basic goods store in his home, which allows him to maintain the family's finances.  

Raúl has been very worried because there is a dangerous part of his property which is on a slope that could give way at any moment.  For this reason, he wants to build a retaining wall as soon as possible, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, cement clocks and iron to build the retaining wall.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks and iron to build a retaining wall in his home.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a conservative lady. So she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Ibtisam is a married lady living in Salt, Jordan with her family that consists of four members. Her son Adel, who appears in the photo, is a university student majoring in Water Resources Management, and he is in his fourth year. He is seeking to work in his study field after getting his Bachelor's to start, depending on himself. 

But Ibtisam currently doesn’t have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. So she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Calphinia

texts.en:
Calphinia is a businesswoman from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She is in the business of poultry; she even has two employees who help her run the project. When Calphinia is able to step away from her business, she heads over to the nearby secondary school, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. Calphinia mentors the students there. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase chicks, chick feed, and vaccines in bulk to cut down on costs. She will be able to sell more chicks and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Sikhulisiwe

texts.en:
Sikhulisiwe is 21 years old and lives in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She has been operating a grocery store for six months and employs one person to assist her in the business. Sikhulisiwe also serves as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at a nearby school. She teaches young students life and study skills. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Sikhulisiwe intends to purchase groceries in bulk to reduce costs and boost sales and profits. With these profits, she hopes to expand into a larger business and create more jobs in her community.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира занимается любимым делом животноводством. Она замужем за 43-летнего предпринимателя. Самой Мохире 36 лет. Она со своей семьей живет в предгороном районе А.Джоми. В течение 6 лет своей жизни Мохира у себя во дворе разводит коров и быков. В этом деле ей конечно помогает муж. Он помогает ей в закупке и продаже скота. Мохира сама ухаживает за скотами. Уже вошло в привычку каждый день кормить и выгуливать скот. Мохира сейчас хочет создать хоршие условия для своих скотов. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита, она хочет построить коровник, а также купить пару бычков. Благодаря кредиту Мохира сможет расширить свой бизнес и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mohira is involved in her favorite business of animal husbandry. She is married to a 43-year-old entrepreneur. Mohira is 36 years old. She and her family live a suburban district of A.
