Jomi. Mohira has been raising cows and bulls in her backyard for 6 years of her life. Her husband, of course, helps her with this business. He helps her with buying and selling livestock. Mohira takes care of livestock by herself. The task of feeding and taking livestock to a pasture every day has become a habit already. Mohira currently wants to create good conditions for her livestock. She wants to use the loan amount to build a cowshed and buy a couple of bulls. Thanks to the loan, Mohira will be able to expand her business and hopes for the support.

loans.use: to build a new cowshed and buy a couple of bulls

loans.name: Demesio

texts.es:
Demesio tiene 68 años de edad, su estado civil es Casado. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz); vive en el distrito de Yamango. Natural de la zona, la comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno, al comercio de café y a la agricultura; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Demesio se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de café, desde hace ya varios años, él necesita el crédito para sembrar y abonar sus chacras de café, lo que le permitirá tener una mayor producción, mejor cosecha y por ende pordrá vender sus producto a un mejor precio lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por consecuente mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demesio is 68 years old and is married.  He has his own home that has water and electricity.  He lives in the Yamango district where he was born.  The community is small and its residents work raising cattle, selling coffee, and farming.  This community is in the province of Morropón in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

Demesio works planting and selling coffee, which he has done for many years.  He is in need of this loan to plant and fertilize his coffee plants, which will allow him to have a better production and a better harvest, so that he can sell his product at a better price, which will generate greater earnings, a better income and through that, a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: plant and fertilize his coffee crops.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат женщина 63 лет. Она замужем имеет 4 детей. У нее большая и дружная семья. Все члены семьи стараются поддерживать  друг друга. Для того чтобы прокормить семью муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Фарогат положительная женщина, которая не может сидеть сложа руки.  Наравне  с мужем она тоже зарабатывает. Она занимается продажей сухофруктов. Ее  мечта, чтобы дети смогли получить хорошее образование. Сейчас она хочет взять кредит для образования своей невестки. Фарогат является не новым клиентом в Арванд  у нее хорошая кредитная история она повторно обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Фарогат  благодарна МДО Арванд  в поддержке.
texts.en: Farogat is a 63-year-old woman. She is married and has 4 children. She has a large and friendly family. All of the family members support each other. Her husband went to work in Russia to provide for the family. Farogat is a positive woman, who cannot sit without doing anything. She earns a living just like her husband. She is involved in selling dried fruits. Her dream is for her children to get a good education. Now she wants to obtain this loan for her daughter-in-law's education. Farogat is not a new client for Arvand. She has a good credit history, and she comes to Arvand once again. Farogat is grateful to MDO Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter-in-law's education

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 28 años de edad,  se dedica a la producción y venta de pasteles, desde muy niña mostró una gran inclinación hacia la culinaria y su padre reforzó con su trabajo de panadero esta aptitud, al lado de su madre,  quien con mucho cariño, la enseño el oficio. Una vez aprendió las técnicas de preparación alimentaria, empezó a trabajar en un negocio de pastelería y pasa bocas, para posteriormente emprender su propio emprendimiento en esta misma línea, agregando a su haber las picadas, que hoy también son parte de su oferta. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en su vecindad y son amigos y familiares,  que conocen la calidad con que Cindy trabaja, vendiendo de contado y a crédito, durante todos los días de la semana sin descanso. Su meta es ampliar su negocio separándolo de su espacio familiar y terminar sus estudios profesionales, mediante el incrementó de sus ingresos. En la actualidad, Cindy está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo domingo, mediante el cual comprará un horno de panadería y sus accesorios, una mesa de acero, e insumos para producir mas picadas, aumentando su productividad y mejorando la presentación mediante una oferta a su clientela  que impacte la calidad en el servicio, con lo cual mejoraría su negocio.
texts.en:
Cindy is 28 years old and works making and selling pastries. Since she was a child she has shown an interest in cooking which her father reinforced in his work as a baker. She learned the trade along side of her mother mixed in with a lot of love.

Once she learned the techniques of food preparation, she started to work in a pastry and appetizer business. Later she started her own business in this same field adding to her offerings picadas (fried food platters) which she are part of her business today. Her main clients are from her neighborhood, friends and acquaintances who know the quality of Cindy's work. She sells in cash and on credit all the days of the week. Her goal is to expand her business separating it from her living space and completing her professional studies through the increase in her income.

At present Cindy is requesting a loan from Kiva the first loan she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy a pastry oven and accessories, a steel table and supplies to produce more picadas. She will increase her production and improve her presentation through what she offers to her clients, which will impact the quality of her service and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven and accessories, a steel table and supplies to produce more picadas (fried food platters).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Abduazim

texts.ru: Абдуазим родился в 1996 году. Абдуазим очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Он живет с родителями в отдаленном регионе. Их пятеро детей в семье. Его отец работает учителем в средней школе и получает не большую зарплату. Мать занимается скотоводством. Его старший брат учится на 4 курсе в университете. Абдуазим в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Он надеется на то что он закончить университет успешно и будет работать как высоко квалифицированным специалистом. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abduazim was born in 1996. Abduazim is a very hardworking and goal-oriented young person. He lives with this parents in a remote region. There are five children in the family. His father works as a secondary school teacher and earns a small salary. His mother is involved in animal husbandry. His older brother is a fourth-year student at a university. Abduazim graduated from the secondary school this year and got accepted to the Khujand State University. He hopes to successfully complete the university and start working as a highly qualified specialist. He is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a resident of Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. She is a businesswoman who sells plates, cups, and other kitchen products. She sells to people in her community, but sometimes Tracy travels to the nearby villages in order to sell her merchandise. 

Tracy volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school as well. 

Tracy is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase dinner sets, plates, tea mugs, and cups in bulk. More sales will lead to increased profits, and additional profits will enable her to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen products in bulk

loans.name: Samuel Wingfield

texts.en:
Samuel Wingfield is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal area in Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Samuel Wingfield has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells grocery items. 

To help expand his business, Samuel Wingfield has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more grocery items, and will help Samuel Wingfield to generate greater profits and increase his business. Samuel Wingfield hopes that in the future he will be able to add more stock. 

Samuel Wingfield is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel Wingfield who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Ronic

texts.en:
Ronic is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married, and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Ronic has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, selling spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Ronic has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Ronic to generate greater profits and improve on the standards of living. Ronic hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Ronic is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronic who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат родилась в 1955 году. Она разведенная и мать 4 детей. Сабохат из южного региона Таджикистана. Она 3 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Сабохат предоставляет свои услуги дома. Она еще не имеет большой круг клиентов. Сабохат нуждается новой швейной машинке, чтобы развевать свой новый бизнес. Она имеет старую швейную машинку. Сабохат запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sabohat was born in 1955. She is a divorced mother of 4 children. Sabohat is from the southern region of Tajikistan. She started her business of sewing women's clothing 3 months ago. Sabohat provides her service at home. She does not yet have a large customer base. Sabohat needs a new sewing machine to develop her new business. She has an old sewing machine. Sabohat is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her new business

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: María de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de frutas y verduras, dicha actividad la realiza en el mercado municipal, desde hace 13 años por lo que cuenta con una extensa cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. María desea construir un corredor en su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía su vivienda no cuenta con uno y cuando llueve el agua ingresa a su vivienda causando que sus pertenencias se deterioren, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un corredor en su vivienda
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her 4 children. She is an enterprising woman who works as a seller of fruits and vegetables. She has done this for 13 years in the municipal market. She has an extensive quantity of clients who always look for her products.

María wants to construct a veranda at her house and as you an see in the photo she does not have one. When it rains water comes into her house damaging her possessions. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized laminate, wood and nails to construct a veranda on her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized laminate, wood and nails to build a veranda on her house.

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack is married and has nine children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows that produce milk, which he has been doing for three years. His primary customers are dairy cooperatives. 

Barack requested his third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy another cow. His business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалил целеустремленный молодой человек. Он живет в отдаленном регионе с матерью и 2 братьями. Его братья учатся в средней школе. Условия жизни у них очень тяжелые. В прошлом году умер его отец. Его мать занимается скотоводством. Она единственная кормилица семьи. Абдухалил студент 4 курса. Он учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете. В свободное время от учебы он занимается выращиванием картофеля. Абдухалил должен оплатить за учебный договор в университете и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abduhalil is a goal-oriented young person. He lives in a remote region with his mother and two brothers. His brothers attend a secondary school. Life is very difficult for them. Their father passed away last year. His mother is involved in animal husbandry. She is the sole provider for the family. Abduhalil is a fourth-year student. He attends the Khujand State University. In his time free from studies, he is involved in growing potatoes. Abduhalil has to pay for his university tuition and is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 US dollars for this purpose. He needs and relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофату 49 лет. Она жизнерадостная и целеустремленная женщина. Латофат вдова. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Она осталась без кормильца, и вся жизненная тяжесть лежит на ее плечах. Латофат имеет 4 детей. Для того, чтобы улучшить условию домохозяйства она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды 6 месяцев назад. Она шьет платья со старой машинкой и поэтому качество сервиса не очень хорошее. Она нуждается новой швейной машинке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Latofat is 49 years old. She is a happy and goal-oriented woman. Latofat is a widow. Her husband passed away several years ago. She was left without a provider, and all of the difficulties of life now lay on her shoulders. Latofat has 4 children. To improve her household conditions, she started her own business in sewing women's clothing 6 months ago. She sews dresses on an old sewing machine, which is affecting the quality of her service. She needs a new sewing machine. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy a new sewing machine to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to increase the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Yanett Lissett

texts.es: Yanett de 28 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida gracias a su trabajo como promotora comunitaria, con el cual a su vez le aporta a su comunidad y es con dicha actividad que sostiene a sus 3 hijos y apoya a su padre con la economía del hogar. Yanett desea reparar el corredor de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra bastante deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Yanett is a 28 year old single mother who lives in her own modest house with her three children aged 11, 9 and 3 years old. She is an enterprising woman who goes out every day to earn her living as a community outreach worker. With her work she helps her community, supports her 3 children and helps her father with the household finances. Yanett wants to repair the veranda of her house as it is in poor condition. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the veranda of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the veranda of her house.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is married and has four children. All of her children go to school. She has additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 18 years. 

Jesca has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to build a permanent business premises. She lives in rented house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 30 years old and has a motorcycle transport business. He is married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with one child. He also supports five members of his family. He has been in this business for five years now, and he currently makes a monthly income of KES 35,000.

He will be using this loan to buy another motorcycle and thereby expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also provide for the needs of his family.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. In the future he hopes to grow his business and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 38 years old. She is married with eight children between the ages of three and twenty. Four of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en:
Jecinter is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be business-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a local area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rise and fall of prices. 

Jecinter will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Raphel

texts.en:
Raphael is 57 years old, married, and has five children. Raphael has been a farmer for 10 years, earning 10,000 KES a month.

Raphael requested his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya for 30,000 KES, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm produce. He plans to use the anticipated income to add more stock of goods to his retail shop, which is managed by his wife and hopes to provide the best education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda 39 years old; she is married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 14, and 3 of them go to school. She has had a shop for six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more plates and basins to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children, and to buy medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more plates and basins.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 23-year-old single young man living with his family, which consists of six members. He also works in the evenings at a coffee shop. 

Tariq is a university student majoring in Mechanic Engineering, and he is in his fifth year. He is seeking to work in his study field after getting his Bachelor's, with a better income from work. But he currently doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gaetan

texts.en: Gaetan is 33 years old. He is married with two children aged between 4 and 7, one of which goes to school. He has been selling foodstuffs for 4 years.w With the loan, he would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy electricity.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a 25-year-old married mother of two from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothes, shoes, and blankets from her homestead to support her family. 

In her free time, Peace is a Camfed Learner Guide who works with young students to improve their well-being and overcome life obstacles. 

Peace is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase large quantities of skirts, tops, pants, and shoes.  With the profits she will earn, Peace will expand her business, meet her basic needs, and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra's Group

texts.en:
Sandra's Group is comprised of two hard working women. Sandra is 20 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. For the past three years, Sandra has been working hard to manage her money transfer business.

To help expand her business, Sandrh has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase phone credit and add more capital in the money transfer business. It will help Sandra to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Sandra hopes that in the future she will be able to open up other branches of the same business. 

Sandra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase phone credit and add more capital to the money transfer business,

loans.name: Top Secret Group

texts.en:
Sariya is the featured borrower for Top Secret Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Sariya is a 28-year-old single lady. The low financial status of her parents didn’t affect her studies. She started working at a beauty shop two years ago to cover her needs and expenses, in addition to her university fees. However, the economic downturn in Lebanon made her salary no longer adequate to cover her expenses and university fees. For this reason, she acquired a youth loan to continue her studies by paying her university tuition fees, as she hopes she could own a beauty shop in the future. 

This loan was applied for the other group members also. Amani is a 25-year-old single lady who gives private lessons and wants to cover her university fees, while Mahasen is a 22-year-old single lady who works at a beauty salon and wants to pay for her English language courses. 

Sariya is the lady wearing pink and standing in the middle of the two other ladies, Amani on the right of the photo, and Mahasen on the left.

loans.use: To pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 16 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, rice, beans, and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items to resell, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and buy food for the family and pay school fees for her young siblings. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business into wholesale. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items to resell

loans.name: Al Itihad Group

texts.en:
Rajaa is the featured borrower for Al Itihad Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Rajaa is a 50-year-old, married mother of five children. As her children grew, her husband’s salary became insufficient to cover their living expenses and needs, thus she got employed three years ago in a clothes-selling shop to help her husband.

Today, Rajaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to start her own clothes-selling business from her house, since she proved to be a hard-working woman who gained a good experience and reputation in her domain.

With respect to the other group members, Jeniyeh is a 43-year-old, married woman of three children, works as an accessories and make-up saleswoman and wants to increase her merchandise by adding new, fashionable products for the upcoming autumn season, while Samira is a 41-year-old, married woman who wants to open a Tupperware and lingerie shop. 

Rajaa is the woman on the left of the photo, Jeniyeh is the woman on the right, and Samira is the woman seated in the middle.

loans.use: to start her own clothes-selling business from her house.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as trustworthy and focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to own land within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is a 23-year-old single young man living in Mafraq, Jordan with his family that consists of four members. His father is a retired man who currently works as a taxi driver. Odai is a university student majoring in business administration and he is in his second year. He is seeking to work in his study field after getting his bachelors degree; however, he currently does not have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Odai has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a transport business where she has employees who transport customers using her motorcycles. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are the general public. Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. Her business goal is to buy a public service vehicle within 5 years. Mary hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Chemistry, and she is in her fourth year. She lives with her family that consists of eight family members. 

Alaa is seeking to work after getting her Bachelor's. She will support her family financially, and she is one step closer to reaching her aim. 

But she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as focused and disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good place to stay. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he does mobile phone servicing and charging. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a semi-urban area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a hair cutting machine to enable him start a barber shop. He hopes that in the future his business will grow. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a hair cutting machine

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de venta de paletas y cuajadas, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años de forma ambulante. Mercedes desea repellar su vivienda de adobe, colocar balcones a las ventanas y comprar una taza lavable para el servicio sanitario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en:  una taza lavable, balcones, cemento y arena para repellar su vivienda, colocar balcones y colocar taza lavable en el servicio sanitario de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 36 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and their 2 children of 14 and 13 years of age. She is a woman who, thanks to her effort and tenacity, has managed to get ahead with her small business selling popsicles and fresh cheese. She has done this work ambulatorily for 4 years.

Mercedes wants to plaster her clay home, place bars on the windows and buy a toilet for the bathroom. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a toilet, security bars, cement and sand to plaster her home, put up security bars and set up a toilet in the bathroom of her home.

loans.use: to invest in a toilet, security bars, cement and sand to plaster her home, put up security bars and position the toilet in the bathroom of her home.

loans.name: Simangele

texts.en:
Simangele is a 27-year-old businesswoman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. 

She owns a small stall at the local market where she sells kapenta (dried sardines). Simangele inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who teaches students about how to maintain their well-being and as an entrepreneur. 

Simangele will use the loan from Kiva to purchase many bags of kapenta from the fisheries in bulk, and then she will make a profit. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. She also hopes to help the underprivileged children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase kapenta (dried sardines) in bulk

loans.name: Darika

texts.ru: Дарике 58 лет, замужем, 4 детей, они все взрослые, живут самостоятельно. У Дарики средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении многих лет работает библиотекарем, также в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Дарики есть 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок. По хозяйству помогает супруг. Дарика известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). На доходы от животноводства Дарика начала строительство дома, однако не хватает средств на его завершение, поэтому Дарика и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который направит на перекрытие крыши и штукатурку стен. Кредит позволит ей сохранить поголовье скота, а в дальнейшем и приумножить его. Также Дарика намерена накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Darika is 58 years old, married and has 4 children, all of whom are grown and live independently. Darika has a secondary-specialized education. She has been working as a librarian for many years and has been involved in animal husbandry to provide an additional source of income. Darika has 1 dairy cow, 1 horse and 1 bull. Her husband helps her with the business. Darika is known as an honest, decent, reliable and a person with strong principles. Today, her business yields a monthly profit of about 20,000 som (KGS). Darika started to use the profit from the animal husbandry business to build a house, but does not have enough money to finish the construction. This is why Darika requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank and will use it to do the roof and wall plaster. This loan will allow her to retain her livestock headcount and increase it in the future. Darika also intends to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her house and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells water, soda, and bread. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy water, soda, and bread; and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Immaculate hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy land. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Immaculate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, and bread.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead. 

Abeer is a 64-year-old married mother living with her family that consists of four members in Salt, Jordan. Her aim is to provide her children with the best education. Her son is a diploma student majoring in graphic design and he is in his second year. He is seeking to find a job in his field after graduating. Because Abeer does not have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a business woman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide and works with students to improve their leadership skills. Angeline also runs a shop that provides essential groceries to members of her community. She is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase sugar, flour, rice, kapenta (dried sardines), and other goods in large quantities to meet the high demand of her community and increase her profits. She looks forward to the day when her higher income will enable her to be financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 22-year-old university student majoring in finance, and she is in her fourth year. 

She lives with her family in Irbid, Jordan. Her father is a retired man. 

Israa is only one step away from reaching her aim of finding a job in her field after getting her Bachelors’. But she currently doesn’t have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Marta Morena

texts.es: Marta de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 23 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida como promotora de salud, y es gracias a este trabajo que apoya a su compañero de vida con la economía familiar, además por el tipo de trabajo que desempeña también es un aporte a la comunidad, ya que los apoya con temas muy importantes para su salud. Marta desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta, 48 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and her 23 year old child. She is a tenacious woman who earns a living as a health promoter and it is thanks to this work that she supports her life partner with the family finances.

Additionally, the type of work she does is also a contribution to the community since she supports it with very important health topics.

Marta wants to lay tile in her home for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: tile, cement, sand and gravel to lay tile in her home.

loans.use: to invest in: tiles, cement, sand and gravel to lay tile in her home.

loans.name: Rosa Augusta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es abrir otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member, Rosa, continues working in her grocery store, selling basic food items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  Through this business, the member wants to get ahead in life.  She has worked in this business for several years already and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to open another grocery store.   Rosa is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, milk, cookies and crackers.  She is happy to receive the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, cookies and crackers

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 57-year-old married woman living with her family that consists of six members in Salt, Jordan. Her husband is a retired man. Fatima's son is a diploma student majoring in finance and he is in his second year. He is planning to work in his study field after his graduation; however, he currently does not have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Fatima decided to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a good life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Manonga

texts.ru:
Manonga tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Manonga se dedica a la venta de articulos para obsequios tales como peluches, ropa, calzado, juguetes, entre otros; tieena ya más de 10 años de experiencia en este rubro, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para realizar invertir en compra de ropa y calzado por temporada de Primavera, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de productos, y asi poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de sus clientes; lo que le va a generar mayores inrgesos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Manonga is 47 years old, married, and has a son.  She lives with her family in a rural area in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Manonga earns her living selling gift items such as stuffed animals, clothing, footwear, and toys.  She has more than 10 years of experience in this field. Manonga's business is located in her home itself.  She is asking for a loan to buy spring clothing and footwear.  This investment will allow her to have greater diversity of products and thus meet the different needs and preferences of her customers. This will generate more income, better earnings and thus her quality of life and that of her family will improve.

loans.use: .to buy merchandise (spring clothing and shoes)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Seham

texts.en: Seham is a conservative lady. So she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Seham is a married woman living with her family in Marka,Jordan. Her son is a 20-year-old, diploma student majoring in accounting. He is in his second year. He is seeking to finish his studies to work in his study field. But because he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, Seham has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has five children, ages ranging from 6 to 18 years old. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells coffee. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His primary customers are coffee factories. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more coffee to sell. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a 30-year-old woman, married to John, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Philomena has been operating a grocery shop for a period of three years, earning an income of 5,000 KES at the end of every month.

Philomena was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 10,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to buy vegetables, tomatoes, onions, kale, and fruits to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Philomena plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and kale to sell to her customers on a daily basis

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan esta casdado y tiene un hijo, Juan es de Avichaca y vive con sus padres en una casa de adobe que es propia, la casa tiene luz y agua Juan es agricultor y albañil y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Juan no tiene a nadie que le ayude, por eso quiere la colaboracion de KIva
texts.en: Juan is married and has one child. Juan is from Avichaca and he lives with his parents in a clay house that he owns; the house has electricity and running water. Juan is a farmer and a builder and he wishes to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops. Juan does not have anyone who can aid him that is why he is seeking collaboration from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo Hugo vive con sus abuelos en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es propia y tiene luz y agua Hugo es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Hugo no tiene otra actividad y no tiene a nadie que le ayude con el dinero por eso requiere su ayuda
texts.en: Hugo is in a civil union and has one child. He lives with his grandparents in Avichaca in a clay house with electricity and running water. Hugo is a farmer and wishes to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops. Hugo is not involved in any other profession and does not have anyone he can turn for support to access funding, that is why he requires your support.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Paola Lizet

texts.es:
Paola es una joven madre de familia de 24 años, vive en Santiago junto a su familia.
Su hija es el mayor regalo que Dios ha podido darle y es por él quien día a día se esfuerza para brindarle un futuro mejor. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera de Técnico en Farmacia y hoy ejerce su profesión en una cadena de Boticas, ella cree que le va bien porque pone en práctica todos los valores y la ética con la fue educada siempre.
Paola está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá remodelar su vivienda, es decir va a colocar una nueva puerta y renovará las ventanas. De esta manera su familia gozará de mayor seguridad y comodidad, así ella seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paola is the young mother of a family. She is 24 years old and lives with her family in Santiago. Her daughter is the greatest gift that God could have given her and it is for her that she makes the effort, day by day, to provide for a better future.

Thanks to her parent’s support she was able to study for a career as a pharmacy technician and now exercises her profession in a pharmacy chain. She believes that she is doing well because she puts into practice the values and ethics with which she was always educated.

Paola is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided her she will be able to remodel her home. That is, she will set up a new door and renovate the windows. In this way, her family will enjoy greater security and comfort. She will continue making the effort to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to put up doors and windows on her home.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with two children, both of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Juliet sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of  UGX 900,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy bunches of green bananas.  

She works from home, seven days a week. She generates additional income from farming. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation which increase operational costs. 

Juliet aspires to buy more land to grow green bananas. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos, el cliente vive con sus padres en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Victor es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Victor es  la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, no tiene otra actividad, pero goza de buena salud y su evaluacion es buena
texts.en: Victor is in a civil partnership and has two children. He lives with his parents in Avichaca in a clay house that he owns. Victor is a farmer and he wishes to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops. Victor is the sole provider of income for his family and he does not have any other job but he is in good health and he has been positively evaluated.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monica is 20 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Monica has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more tomatoes and onions for sale, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and buy food for the family and also take care of her parents. Monica hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big hotel in town. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more tomatoes and onions for sale,

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es casado y tiene 3 hijos Mario vive con sus abuelos en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene luz y agua y no tiene defectos de ninguna clase. Mario es agricultor  y quiere comprar una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Mario es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y requiere su ayuda, el cliente goza de buena salud y su negocio es estable
texts.en: Mario is married and has 3 children. He lives with his grandparents in Avichaca in a clay house that is his own. The house has electric and water services and suffers from no defects whatsoever. Mario is a farmer and he wants to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops. Mario is the sole provider of income in his family and he requires your help. He is in good health and his business is stable.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Aklay

texts.ru: Аклай 64 года, не замужем, мать 2 дочерей, образование среднее, уже 3 года работает кассиром, также получает пенсию, в общей сложности ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Аклай в целях сохранения энергии и утепления своего дома, обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на установку системы отопления, а именно установку теплого пола и утепленную наружную дверь. Позже за счет экономии на оплате за коммунальные услуги, Аклай хочет накопить средства на покупку дома для дочери, которая после развода осталась одна с грудным ребенком.
texts.en: Aklay is 64 years old, not married and a mother of 2 daughters. Aklay has a secondary education, has been working as a cashier for 3 years, and also receives a pension, all together amounting to a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS). To conserve energy and provide heating for her house, Aklay requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank and will use the money to install a heating system, specifically heated floor and insulated front door. Later, using the savings from the utilities expenses, Aklay wants to save money to buy a house for her daughter, who was left alone with a newborn child after her divorce.

loans.use: to install a heating system, specifically heated floor and insulated front door in order to conserve energy

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, cooking oil and other items. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are private and commercial. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have  a better life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her bills.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, and other items

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be optmistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fried chicken. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of chicken. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid succcessfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of chicken

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a farm where he grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to sell. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be a better business person. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 36 лет, замужем, есть дочь. У Рыскул высшее образование, с 2005 года она стала заниматься торговлей трикотажных изделий в местном торговом центре, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 45,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня товарооборот Рыскул составляет 150,000 сом (KGS), а ежемесячная прибыль около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку женской одежды для расширения ассортимента товара в магазине. Доходы от кредита Рыскул направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Ryskul is 36 years old, married and has a daughter. She has a higher education. Since 2005, she has been selling knitwear in the local shopping mall. She began this business with 45,000 som (KGS) in start-up capital. Today, Ryskul's sales turnover is 150,000 som (KGS) and her average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Ryskul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy women's clothing to expand the assortment of merchandise in her store. Ryskul plans to spend the earnings from the loan on the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to expand the assortment of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en:
Pretty is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. 

She lives in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe and owns a small stall at the local flea market where she sells jackets, shirts, and dresses. Further, Pretty sometimes travels around the community with a bag of clothes to sell to her neighbors. 

Pretty inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who teaches students about their well-being and as an entrepreneur. She started her business in 2013 when she saw an opportunity to provide for herself. 

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s quality of life. Pretty also hopes to help the underprivileged children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and groceries. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals and other items she sells. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to open a mini shop.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals and other items

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy beauty products for her salon. Her business goal is to own a fully equipped salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a pick up. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be disciplined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve on sales.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, ubicada en una zona rural del centro poblado de Nueva Arica, distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, rregión Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Angélica se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio; ella solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de cerdos y animales menores como son patos, cuyes, gallinas; para comenzar a criarlos y después venderlos, lo que le permitira diversificar su stock y asi poder cumplir con todos los gustos de sus clientes, lo que le va a permitir captar nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica has two daughters and lives in a home that she owns.  She lives in a rural area in the city of Nueva Arica in the Cayaltí district, of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  Luz Angélica has worked raising and selling pigs for the past 10 years.  Her business is located in back of her home.

She is seeking a loan to purchase pigs and small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and chickens that she can raise and later sell.  This will allow her to diversify her stock, satisfy the needs of her customers, attract new customers, increase her income, improve her earnings, and be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase pigs and small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and chickens so that she can raise them and later sell them.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 7, 11, 13 y 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre que gracias a su tenacidad y esfuerzo está sacando adelante a su familia, apoyándose en su trabajo de panificador en el cual, elabora diversidad de pan tanto francés como dulce. Carlos desea construir una letrina de fosa, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, grava, una letrina de cemento y una plancha de cemento para construir una letrina de fosa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old and lives with his wife and their four children, ages 7, 11, 13 and 15, in their own home.  He is a man who thanks to his tenacity and effort is getting his family ahead.  He supports his family through his work as a baker where he makes a variety of breads including french bread and sweet bread.  

Carlos wishes to build an outhouse, which is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, gravel, a cement toilet and a cement slab to build the outhouse on his property.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, gravel, a cement latrine and a concrete slab to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La socia Anastacia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros,la socia se sigue dedicanos al negocio de fabricacion de tejas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.
texts.en: Anastacia is still making a living from the business of selling dry grains, such as wheat, and from the business of making tiles. She wants to get ahead with her businesses; her dream is to expand her business selling grains. She is asking for the loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley and wheat

loans.name: Clotilde Margarita

texts.es:
Clotilde es una madre de familia luchadora, tiene 61 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia. 
Desde muy joven luchó por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos se han convertido en personas de bien y muy exitosos. Desde hace muchos años inició su negocio de venta de bebidas y con esos ingresos pudo educar a sus hijos. Clotilde cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza, es muy responsable y trabajadora.
Clotilde está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar vitrinas para poder exhibir sus productos y así pueda llamar más clientes. Con esto ella tendrá mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá tener una vida tranquila al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Clotilde is the mother of a hard-working family, she is 61 years old and she lives in Ica with her family. Since she was very young she fought to get her family ahead in life, and thanks to her efforts her children have become good people who are very successful. 

Many years ago she started her business of selling beverages and she was able to educate her children with the money she earned. Clotilde believes that things are going well for her, because she always makes an effort, and because she is responsible and a hard worker. 

Clotilde is grateful for the Kiva investors, because with the support they have given her, she will be able to buy glass cabinets to be able to display her products and this way, she will attract more customers. This will allow her to have a larger income to improve her quality of life and to be able to have a peaceful life alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy glass cabinets to display her products.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадине, 28 лет, замужем, есть 3 малолетних детей. У Мадины среднее образование, уже много лет занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Мадины есть 2 коровы и 0,7 ГА земли, где она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В общем доход от деятельности Мадины составляет от 15,000 до 20,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно, что зависит от урожайности и сезона. Мадина смогла начать строительство ее дома. Однако, не хватает средств на перекрытие крыши. Поэтому Мадина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку шифера, реек и балок для перекрытия крыши. Кредитные средства позволят сохранить скот, а доходы от ведения бизнеса направить на его дальнейшее развитие.
texts.en: Madina is 28 years old, married and has 3 small children. Madina has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years. Madina has 2 cows and 0.7 hectares of land, where she grows corn for the household consumption and sale. All in all, Madina's income from the business amounts to 15,000-20,000 som (KGS) per month, depending on the harvest and season. Madina was able to start a construction of her house, but does not have enough money to cover the roof. This is why Madina requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy slates, planks and wood to cover the roof. This loan will allow her to retain her livestock headcount, and she will invest the earnings from the business into its future development.

loans.use: to buy materials to cover the roof of her new house in order to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Peninah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale, and will help Peninah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Peninah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big restaurant. 

Peninah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities as well as a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Areli de 62 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que sale a ganarse el pan de cada día por medio de su chalet en el cual vende productos como: bebidas frías, café, chocolate, golosinas, pupusas, pan dulce etc. Dicho chalet está ubicado en el centro escolar de su cantón, por lo que la ubicación del negocio es bastante buena al igual que sus ventas. Areli desea construir una pila con baño en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagará mano de obra para la construcción de una pila con baño en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Areli is 62 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns her daily living from her snack shop in which she sells products such as: cold drinks, coffee, chocolate, sweets, stuffed tortillas, sweet bread etc. The shop is located in the local school, and this is a good location and offers good levels of sales.

Areli wishes to construct a water storage basin and bathroom in her home, for which she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and labour costs for the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and pay labour costs to construct a water storage basin and bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 2 meses de edad. Él es un joven emprendedor que todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, apoyándose en su trabajo como agricultor, por medio del cual cosecha maicillo y frijol productos que luego vende para mantenerse y guarda para el consumo, además se desempeña como albañil, manteniendo así la estabilidad económica del hogar. Rufino ha observado que su vivienda no cuenta con las condiciones de salubridad necesarias para su pequeña hija, ya que el piso es de tierra y esto puede provocarle problemas respiratorios, por lo que Rufino solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rufino is 27 years old and lives in a modest house that he owns, together with his partner and their 2 month old daughter.

He is an entrepreneurial young man who makes a great effort every day to provide for his family. He works as a farmer, growing sorghum and beans that he sells to earn money and also keeps to eat. He also works as a builder, and in this way he is able to maintain the economic stability of his household.

Rufino has observed that his house is not a suitably healthy environment for his small daughter, as there is a mud floor and this can create breathing problems. He is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand and gravel to concrete the floor of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to concrete the floor of his home.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Trinidad se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leña,la socia por medio de este ngeocio quiere saliar adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leña. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leña.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Trinidad continues to work in her business selling firewood.  Through this business, she hopes to get ahead.  She has worked in this business for many years, and it has gone very well for her.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her firewood.  She is seeking a loan to purchase firewood.  She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase firewood.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as generous. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, sugar, eggs, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals, sugar, eggs, soap, and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, sugar, eggs, soap, and other items

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cooking fat, sugar, and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Muy cerca al mar habita Everlides. Ella es una confeccionidta con 15 años de experiencia en esta actividad, dese que inició ayudando a su amiga en el año 2010 y se independizó genmerando dsu propio generador de ingresos. Everlides en su taller ubicado en una habitación de su propia casa, confecicona prendas de vestir femeninas especialmente, trabajando todos los dias durante 12 horas que inician desde las 8 de la mañana. Su mayor fortaleza es el conocimeinto que de la calidad con que produce tienen sus clientes y por esto le refieren permanentemente a nuesvos compradores., a quienes les vende a crédito y de contado. En la actualidad está plicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos y accesorios que yudarán a que Everlides tenga una mayor productividad y un stock de inventarios, que harán de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Everlides lives very close to the ocean.  She makes clothing, and has 15 years of experience in the field.  In 2010, she started helping her friend, but later decided to branch out on her own in order to generate her own income.  In her workshop at home, Everlides makes clothing for women.  She works everyday for 12 hours starting at 8am.  Her greatest strength is the quality of the items she makes, which is why her customers prefer her work and refer her to new customers.  She sells her products on credit and in cash.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase fabrics, thread and accessories.  These will help Everlides to improve her productivity and her inventory, making her investment a successful one.

loans.use: purchase fabrics, thread and accessories.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are promising. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will own a vehicle. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish
